online.review_text: Small, quiet and well-equipped garden, in the afternoon sun with benches and a place in the shade.
This is the square where I work, it's a very quiet place, ideal for a refreshing break
A nice place, although a little small.
Perfect for children; little interest if you come without
Cool games for little ones. But a little lacking in space.
Beautiful children's square
Children love
Quiet 🤣🙏
The vegetation .

If you’re a foodie like me, you’ll love this place! The menu has a fantastic selection of dishes, and we loved everything we tried. We only had good comments about the food. I can’t wait to come back again. some of the best food I’ve had recently. They use the freshest ingredients and make sure each dish is done the right way. The vegitarian food was especially memorable. Must try!”

The food was excellent. The flavours were wonderful and we all enjoyed our meals. The only disappointment was that the "Quick-lunch" dishes we ordered were very small. Next time we will take a standard meal! We will be back! Food : 4/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 … More

Good indian restaurant direct opposite if the basel bad train station. We came for lunch and the restaurant was rather empty. The staff was welcoming and our delicious mango lassi s came fast. The food we ordered came in batches. First were brought the nicely decorated idly dish, while we had to wait longer for the other two dishes, a thali and a dosa. It was very much worth our wait as all the food tasted delicious. Will go back here the next time we are visiting Basel.

I had reserved before arriving here. Ordered aatu kaal soup (taste was so so), seeraga samba mutton briyani (ultimate and must try), aapam chicken curry (was delicious), chicken lollipop (was decent).. overall food was delicious. Kesari was good which is complimentary i guess. The staffs and service were good except one guy. I think he is main in-charge. His attitude was weird and not friendly. I wanted to order lime soda, they dint have lime. Tap water was not provided which is against swiss rules. U only have to order bottled water. Im complaining about this. Overall was decent experience.

The food was extremely good and very very tasty. The ckicken Biriyani was superb and the sauce had the right level of spiciness. The Mutton Dum Biriyani was good but without too much meat however it was simply delicious. Totally recommended! 😁 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Last Friday, I had the pleasure of visiting Anjappar Chettinad Indian Restaurant in Switzerland with some friends, and it turned out to be a fantastic experience. The atmosphere was lively and welcoming, making it an ideal spot for a relaxed evening out.The service was excellent, the staff were attentive and friendly. There was even an intern who stood out with their enthusiasm and eagerness to ensure we had a great time. Thank you very much to this wonderful man. The food was authentic and flavorful, capturing the essence of Chettinad cuisine perfectly. I highly recommend trying their signature dishes. Overall, it was a memorable dining experience that I would gladly repeat.

The food was really authentic and delicious. I am a fan of Chettinad cuisine and this place did justice to it . Service was excellent . I ordered thali and all the portions were great , there are many non- vegetarian options as well for meat lovers. I can highly recommend we comment this place if someone wants to try authentic cuisine

Food was delicious.  I had the poondu kolumbu and parata and also a filter coffee. The coffee wasn't great but the food was spicy and absolutely perfect. Husband had a meat dish which he really enjoyed. The parata wasn't great but the curry more than made up for it.Vegetarian options: Tons of veggies dishes and idli sambar dosa etc

The bahubali thali, traditional banana leaf meals which were special for tamil new year and dosa and chicken curry were all spot on. The taste was authentic and was served with a smile by the staff. Shan who welcomed us was the highlight and an example of how service should be handled Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

The menu offers a wide variety of options, and everything we tried was delicious. I especially loved the creative twists on classic dishes.The service at restaurant is top-notch! The staff is friendly, attentive, and goes above and beyond to ensure a memorable dining experience. Kudos to the entire team"MUST TRY" Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Idly, Soup, Traditional South Indian Meal … More

In summary, this place offers a good variety of Mediterranean food.- Falafel: 8/10 - Very crispy.- Harissa Eggplant: 8/10 - Very meaty with a great char from the grill.- Trio Dips: 7/10 - Nice, but the hummus is just okay.- Brick Chicken: 9/10 - Extremely flavorful and juicy.- Lamb Shank: 8/10 - Very flavorful with great spices.- Flatbread: 7/10 - Not too exciting; the Burrata one is better.- Branzino Fish: 9/10 - Great location and super fresh.

This is the perfect place to go to for a celebration lunch or dinner, the food, while a bit overpriced, is very aesthetically pleasing as well as delicious. We took my Indian grandparents there with restrictive diets and they thoroughly enjoyed it. A good amount of vegetarian and dairy-free options too.Dietary restrictions: Dairy - free + gluten - free

The desserts were exquisite and each bite had a unique flavor to taste.I loved kunafa and the cardamom custard. The chocolate date cake was good too.I loved the starters and main course too but the desserts were top notch!Vegetarian options: Falafel bites, hummus dips, turmeric cauliflower and plenty of other vegetarian options.

I was impressed by the soft, tender, and delicious lamb shank. The crisp appetizer is a must-have. While the meatballs were too tight, the ribs were quite good.Still water will charge you extra 9$ per bottle, nobody will tell you such. 5% extra fee will be charged for employee benefits.

Overall, service and food was great.We got a few small plates and a large plate to share and enjoyed each dish.I loved the ambiance and decor of the place and it has a cute outdoor seating area as well.Taking off one star because it is really pricey for what you get.

Beautiful restaurant with amazing food.Went here on a weekday and it was still packed. Good we had reservation.The food is exceptional and the service is cherry on top.We came here for our anniversary and every server that came to us, wished us.Also got champagne on the house and card.All in all very good experience.Will recommend.

The food was good.Loved the falafel. They were delicious.Lamb shank was delicious and perfectly seasoned.  The couscous complemented it really well.The grilled chicken was ok. The chicken was flavorful. However, since the portion size was large, the inner portion was not well seasoned. Would have preferred to have a sauce complimenting it to elevate the flavors.The ambience was really good.Definitely a good place to visit.

Superb service and atmosphere. The Kufta meatballs were really good (5 stars). The lamp flatbread was so good too (4 stars); I wish if they make lamp shawarma of that particular lamp. I tried the passion fruit soda, it was not that good (2 stars).Parking: Many free parking lots and garages around the area.

I went here with a small group of friends to celebrate a birthday and had a pleasant experience. I enjoyed the options of still of sparkling Evian water. The atmosphere and decor is attractive and feels simplistic and clean. The food was deliciously fantastic. We shared several small plates and had a couple cocktails each. Our waiter was kind and we had decent service. The restaurant provided a cardamom tart for our birthday girl which we appreciated. Overall we had a lovely time. We hope to visit again soon with the same good service.

We had a lovely brunch at Meso Modern. It has a great setting with lovely sitting and ceramics. The quality for the food is outstanding. We ordered from Brunch menu, including trio dip plate, heirloom tomato flatbreads, Falafal pita, eggs, and drinks. Service was a bit slow than I would like but it was compensated with good food and right proportions. I am glad we have found a great upscale Mediterranean restaurant. To many more brunches in future. Thank you!
I never eat italian outside of italy. It's always a disappointment. Here i felt like at home. A good glass of merlot and a legit amatriciana was all i needed after almost a month away from home.

Food was very tasty. We had the pizza and a pasta with prawns and mushrooms - little light on the prawns, but the flavour was nice. Pizza was a very good size and very tasty.The atmosphere was OK but lacked any background noise. The server was kind and courteous, but not the most engaging or attentive. You are very much left to your meal until you request the cheque

Great Italian restaurant in Riga. One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to.Everything that we ordered was amazing: bruschettas, pesto spaghetti,  bull steak, panacotta, tiramisu... everything! Incredibly flavoursome!We also loved the decor. Tastefully designed and decorated with log burning fire.Service was also great.
Location, atmosphere and service is 5/5. Pasta and pizza were ok but not the best in my life. Then we sit, we were told that waiting for food will be 40 minutes (that is very good to know).

The bruschetta with anchovies is simply an amazing masterpiece of taste. Pasta was well prepared and discerningly sauced! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Mixed Bruschetta … More

So good!  I am so glad we walked through this little lane and saw this place.  The tiramisu is legit, and nothing we have tried has disappointed. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Risotto with Porcini Mushrooms, Mixed Bruschetta, Lasagna … More
Beautiful small Italian Restaurant in Riga! Kind Service, fair prices and nice location away from the crowdy Tourist Spots. Carbonara and bruscetta was great.
Amazing food and amazing service! 5 stars are well deserved. Arthur, the server on duty, was so attentive and polite! Loved this experience 🙌🏽💛

Great food, but lacks in everything else-Literally haven't had Mongolian Beef as good as you could get it from here. Served and cooked to perfection. The portion sizes here were a joke though, serving what looked like was a half portion in comparison to a regular PF Chang's. Also cost a staggering $30 and left me feeling hungry afterwards.I would not recommend dining in either. The staff here can get rowdy and full on scream at each other, despite other customers still being in the restaurant.
The food was very good, my husband and I loved it. great service Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Small place mainly for takeouts and deliveries, though there is dining in available. The 2 meals we bought were excellent quality and quantity and quickly made. As with everything in Washington a little expensive at equivalent of £45 for 2 meals and 2 sodas. Would go again though if we were staying longer. Recommended dishes
Mongolian Beef Bowl, Honey Chicken … More

In June of this year I had P.F.Chang’s to cater my mom 90th birthday party, and everything was so great I had to go back. The food is awesome,the service is amazing. If you’re looking for excellent Chinese food you want to go there.Parking: I recommend you to take someone with you so they can stay with the vehicle.

Food wise, it's the shiit. The noodles I bought with veggies and rice were bombastic. It was completely empty, maybe because it was super early when I went. The customer service is exceptional for sure. The lady attending me was kind !Dietary restrictions: I believe they do have vegetarian options. I just can't remember 😂Parking: There are plenty of options to park if you plan on staying all day, you got options for 10$ to 20$ all day parking near by !

My boyfriend and I dined here for our 1 month-aversary (I know, I know lol). But so glad we did! It was a smaller P.F. Change but perfect for the vibe we were going for and we prefer smaller venues anyway. It was clean and well kept. We went on a Monday night. The Head Chef (Chef D) stopped by our table and was warm and welcoming. He explained the menu with great detail and suggested a couple of his favorite items for us to try (Chang's spicy chicken and the Mongolian Beef). Both were PHENOMENAL choices! Hot, fresh, flavorful and enough for me and my boyfriend to share. We also added on the pork egg rolls, chili garlic green beans, and crab wontons which were exceptional as well, but we both agreed the Mongolian beef took the cake! Will definitely be back and look forward to seeing Chef D and his staff again!

Dinner did not disappoint. Hands down best Chinese in Gboro. Best to order ahead, if you don’t mind waiting. Veggie spring rolls are super fresh. Good luck eating a whole combo plate.Vegetarian options: Vegetable Lo Mein

*1st time here*Let me start by stating what we ordered... We got sesame chicken and orange chicken combo plates. When I say baybeeee, OMG    the chicken is crunchy and seasoned really well, and the rice is fluffy not wet. I didn't try my egg roll cause I'm stuffed to the gills. My bestie said her spring roll was good... "I could eat 6 of them and be good"🤭. The seating area is small and quaint but clean. The man taking our order greeted us with a smile as we approached the counter. Zero complaints. We will def be back.

This place is delicious! I got the garlic chicken lunch special with vegetable fried rice and hot and sour soup. The soup was tasty, spicy, and hot. Not too slimy like some places. The rice was fresh and hot with plenty of vegetables and not too greasy and not the yellow rice. And the chicken was fantastic. Flavorful, moist, not too much fish sauce and lots of vegetables.

The closet I could get to Chinese food from CT or NY. Been coming here for years. Always great service and friendly. I now have to drive from Lexington to get this delicious food!! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

🍜🍜🍜🍜NOT MY BEST CHOICE!!!🍜🍜🍜🍜The food was freshly made, but I was very disappointed in my 🦀 Crab Rangoon. So plain! No taste at all and my wonton was double fried.  😥 Sweet n Sour Chicken was fried for too long.  Their Beef 🥩 tastes a bit weird and there's more breading than Chicken 🍗 in the General Tso dish. The egg rolls are good, but too fried. The Moo Goo was too dry needed more sauce and veggies. The rice 🍚 is always good at most Chinese restaurants, no complaints on that! GREAT STAFF AND AFFORDABLE!

I was in the plaza doing some shopping and decided to grab something in before calling it a night. As I departed from Ross, Golden Wok caught my eye so I decided to hear over!Before walking in, you could see the cleanliness of the restaurant from the outside. It’s super bright with vibrant colors which adds to the curb appeal and draws you in. Upon arriving at the county I was immediately greeted and presented with a menu. As I figured out what I wanted, the aromas of fresh garlic and the sounds of rice being fried captured my attention and made me even more hungry. LoL!!!Deciding on the General Tso Chicken combo and substituting the Vegetable Fried Rice for Pork Fried Rice, I placed my order and took a seat, paid, and took a seat.As I was waiting for my food, I could tell it was going to be a good dish. People were in and out picking up their orders and you could tell by how they interacted with the cashier that they were repeat customers. This is always a good sign.Upon receiving my food I was once again captured by the aroma. This time it was the aromas of General Tso Chicken and a fresh out of the grease Pork Egg Roll!! Oh yeah… Let’s Eat!!!Upon opening my tray the visual alone let me know this was going to be a good eat. LoL.The General Tso Chicken was perfectly made. Crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The sauce has a perfect level of spice with a hint of sweet. I’m talking goooooooddddddddd. Truly a 10 out of 10.The Pork Fried Rice wasn’t dry, had the perfect  golden fried color and tender meaty chunks of pork.The Pork Egg Roll was packed full of fresh fixings and fried to golden egg roll perfection.I truly enjoyed my Golden Wok experience. If you’re in the area and looking for something with great quality, great flavors, and filling… You must stop in.

I always have a good experience here. They Have great Egg Foo Yung and Lo mein. Customer service has always been fast  friendly and professional. I drive out of my way to support them. Try their moo shi pork or chicken it's the best. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
General TSO's Chicken Combo, Chicken Lo Mein, Fried Chicken Wings … More

I had a really good experience here. The customers and the staff are super friendly. I had an item that I didn't want and with no question or hesitation they replaced it with a smile! I travel all across the United States even at many different restaurants and this is the first one I ever ran into that had a health score of 99! So that means they practice proper sanitation and food preparation. 🙌🏾💜

After a little walk at Jacksonville Arboretum and Garden, my wife and I stopped by for lunch. It’s cafeteria style and we ordered two combos and pancit palabok. First combination plate was fried rice with lechon and pork adobo. Second plate was fried rice with Bicol Express and Pinakbet. Enjoyed everything. Authentic Filipino food if you looking for one. Great service too.

I like trying new food so I went to Cabalen with my girlfriend and daughter to check out some Filipino food.The staff was helpful and friendly in helping us to choose a couple of options. The food was very tasty and the price was right.There was a small area for indoor dining and it was clean and efficient.The three of us enjoyed what we ate. It was definitely worthwhile to go there.

We came in 15 mins before they were closing. The lady accommodated us with our orders. There wasn’t a lot of option left as they were closing but we got halo-halo and Bicol express. I like the halo-halo even though they were out of Leche flan, it was still good. My half-Filipino kids tried their Bicol express and they enjoyed it very much especially my son. Only thing was it was very warm inside considering the weather outside b/t 85-90 degrees F. Overall, we liked what we ordered and we’ll be coming back to try different dish while on vacation here in Jacksonville.Next day we came back and got longganisa and dinuguan 😅.

This is a hidden gem in plain sight!I wanted to get some food from the Philippines, and Cabalen did not disappoint me! I had the pork adobo, Lumpiang Shanghai, and of course Coke Lite.The meal was delicious, very filling, and the service was outstanding. I enjoyed the laid back atmosphere and the Filipino news that was on the tele.If I am in the area again, I will return here! I recommend Cabalen Restaurant to everyone!Parking: Plenty of parking with disabled spaces available also.

I love finding this place! This restaurant/eatery reminded me of my home in the Philippines! The staff are really nice and friendly. The food is great as well! Highly recommend the Menudo and the Halo-Halo❤️ Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Halo Halo, Pinakbet

Parking space
Plenty of parking

Parking options
Free of charge parking lot … More

The BEST pork I’ve ever had in my life. The lady at the counter was very friendly and even gave us a free sample since it was our first time and I HAD TO get that bikola express. 11/10 you need to try this place. Prices and portions are very fair too. The service was great too, very helpful and nice. I’ll be coming back as much as I can!

Whenever we're in the neighborhood, we make sure to grab a bite here. It's cozy and simple, but I enjoy it because it feels like a tasty homemade meal. 🍽️The service is quick and friendly, and it's run by a family, which adds to the charm. ✨Just a heads up for those used to traditional sit-down restaurants: they operate cafeteria-style and serve food in styrofoam containers. If that's not your thing, you might want to skip it.Also, during busy times, they tend to run out of popular items, so it's best to go around noon rather than later in the day. And naturally, the food is freshest right when they open. ⏰

Pancit and adobo was soo delicious. The person at the counter asked if I wanted wrapped fried plantains and I am so glad I got them! Everything was amazing and the staff was really nice. Well worth it.

I'd give this place 5 stars as the food was excellent.... but the girl working the cash register was really bad on explaining the menu and food. She made me feel like I shouldn't eat there almost. In describing the food she was very negative in going over ingredients,  even telling me I probably didn't want a certain menu item just because it had liver in it. I ordered anyways,  despite her weirdly negative selling of her own store's food,  and like I said it was good,  just a strange customer service experience. Lumpia was delicious,  definitely order some if you go here.
4 star for atmosphere b/cz its limited space And 4 star for food b/cz not much chicken items,but food and service overall is ok Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Salmon fillet with potato mushroom was excellent, but some of my companions didn't like the food. Service was good, nothing special. We waited the food for an hour but there was some birthday celebration going on the same time. Views were good and you can see the city of Rīga from the table. Food : 4/5 | Service : 3/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Duck breast with orange sauce was perfectly cooked and beautifully presented. Delicious and perfectly balanced.  The terrace has great views if a little distant from the old town. Highly recommended. Food : 5/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More
Very tasty food,fantastic service beautiful atmosphere second time here 10/10 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

The food and the atmosphere are great, the staff did not speak well in Latvian and worked quite slow (including left our plates on the table for long). However, the food and atmosphore compensated it. Food : 5/5 | Service : 3/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
Beautiful music, views to busy Riga and of course food. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
A very pleasant place, perfect service and delicious food. Beautiful view of Riga and very acceptable price range. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
Restaurant with an amazing view over the city of Riga. Food and service has an eastern European touch. 🙃 Food : 4/5 | Service : 3/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
The food and service were excellent. It both tasted and looked amazing. The view is also beautiful.
Burger was very good, service friendly but minimalistic, waiting time was about 70 minutes, which was a bit too long. Food : 4/5 | Service : 3/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Amazing cuisine and atmosphere. Called and booked a reservation, they asked for occasion, it was a birthday, and they treated us like royalty. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Bundt Cake … More
Interesting take on mussels. The spring rolls weren’t bad, the soft shell crab was lightly battered and pretty tasty. The staff is awesome. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Merlion in Kemah is a gem! The authentic Thai food is absolutely delicious and truly captures the essence of Thai cuisine. The atmosphere is vibrant and fun, making it a great spot for a meal with family or friends. If you love spicy food, this is the place to be – the flavors are bold and perfectly balanced. I had an awesome dining experience and can’t wait to go back. Highly recommend!

My husband and I went to celebrate our anniversary and they made everything very special.  Rose petals on the table, excellent service,  complimentary dessert and complimentary champagne on the house. We had a lovely evening.  My only slightly negative is that the food can be improved. It is not bad, but not very authentic.  I feel it has been modified to suit folks who are not used to thai food. They do give enormous portions., definitely sharable between 2 to 3 people.Parking: The restaurant is located in Kemah....waterfront.

My wife and I shared a memorable dinner last Friday. Jimmy, our waiter, was attentive and very informative about the menu. The pad Thai was delicious and the vibe was very cool. We can't wait to visit again. If you haven't tried Merlion, then you are missing out. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Pad Thai Chicken, Calamari or Shrimp Tempura, Dirty Martini … More

I was taken here to celibate my birthday,  the table was set up nicely with little birthday words our wait staff was friendly and helpful our app was alright but the entrees were great. Unfortunately we had to wait a very long time to get our entrees after finishing the apps and the worse part for me was it was extremely loud in the room we were in, people yelling and others trying to talk loud so they could hear over the others.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would!!!We had the absolute BEST sever Shaye! The best we’ve ever received at a restaurant! Shaye knew the menu so well and every item she suggested was perfect!We were there to celebrate many milestones such a birthdays, anniversary, and engagement and Merlion did not disappoint!!But what truly made this dining experience stand out was the exceptional service we received from Shaye. From the get-go, Shaye's attentiveness was remarkable; seemed to anticipate our needs before we even voiced them. She described each dish with such enthusiasm and detail that I couldn't help but trust her recommendations and so glad we did! She went above and beyond to make us feel like a valued guests creating an atmosphere of genuine hospitality that's hard to find these days.So started with shrimp in the mussel sauce along with the French bread! Oh my word it was amazing! Then on to Kao Pad with sirloin and seared snapper with raad prick! All the dishes were just amazing.This was by far one of the BEST dining experiences we have ever had! Food was great but Shaye was a gem and she was stellar! Before we book we want to make sure she’s there and asked to be seated in her section. We highly recommend this restaurant. We will be back!

My wife and I and two other couples, had dinner at Merlion Thai restaurant in Seabrook.  Our server was Michael.  This was my first Thai food experience and we decided to go during Houston Restaurant Weeks.  For my first course I had the CHICKEN SATAY KABOBS which were chicken skewers served with peanut sauce.  My wife had Lobster and goat cheese stuffed dumplings, garnished with avocados and topped with pineapple curry sauce. For the second course I had PAD MED MAMMUANG (STIR-FRY CASHEWS) which were Hoisen based sauce sautéed with mushrooms, onions, snow peas, water chestnuts and cashews.  My wife had KANG KARI (YELLOW CURRY) which is Thai yellow curry with curry powder, potatoes, onions and cashews, with a hint of cumin, turmeric and cinnamon.  My dessert was Coconut sweet sticky rice topped with fresh chopped strawberries.  My wife had Cheesecake topped with mango puree.  We also shared a bottle of Nine Hats Red Blend.  I had asked the server to bring out extra spice on the side.  The food was delicious.  I did add some of the spice to the stir fry cashew and it really added some heat.  The restaurant was very busy and the wait staff was clearly over worked.  Michael was extremely friendly however we did have to wait a fairly lengthy amount of time for our first course and again for our check.  I did not mark down for this since it was clearly not the server's fault, however I mention it because customers should adjust their expectations if there is a crowd, at least until the restaurant can adjust its number of staff.  All in all we really enjoyed our first Thai meal at Merlion and we will definitely return.

This was a wonderful place! The whole restaurant was decorated for Christmas, and the atmosphere was so welcoming and relaxing. The service food and drink were very reflective of the environment, with seasonal options and fun interactions. I was blown away with the selections of meats that can be alternated with your favorite dish. This was my first time here, and I’ll definitely be coming back.

The place looks nice. I would try here again probably not before closing the staff although nice kept messing up my families orders and brought out food & drinks randomly for different people. We had to keep correcting them or different orders and drink orders were coming incorrectly. My thai ice tea was ok. I have had better & it was mostly ice for the price point it wasn't worth it. The wings are really good & flavorful. Number 5 the rolls with chicken was good. I got myself got the pork fried rice. It lacked flavor but using soy sauce & chili oil made it better. Coming a bit earlier or maybe with a small party might make the ordering better. You can tell with a party of 6 coming within an hour before closing might have been too much to handle. As I said I would try here again and see about a different experience. We liked some of the food and others lacked flavor or was done right the first time. Once again friendly staff but our waiter seemed to be a bit overwhelmed to the point another staff member took our food orders (maybe she was the owner)maybe due to timing of the evening or something. 3.5 out of 5 in my opinion, try here and see for yourself.

The pho here was delicious, plenty of meat in the soup and the flavors were on point. I believe it was about $14 for the regular pho, which was probably one of the best deals on the menu. Favorite pho I’ve had so far.For the downsides: A couple of the other items seemed to be more towards the $20 price range, and their summer rolls are about $4 for 2. Always disappointing seeing this kind of stuff, but with every place doing it, it’s hard to specifically knock this place too hard for it.

The REAL thing! Authentic Vietnamese cuisine. Ordered #47 Beef noodles soup, cannot go wrong.Superb! Great service. For a singaporean, this is as good as it gets in Orlando.The toilet is clean and very well kept / maintained, an important factor for many.

Excellent service. The Pho Tai Nam Gan pho noodle with rice noodle soup was amazing. Best in Orlando. The coconut was flavorful and a spoon & straw. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Beef Noodle Soup … More

Ordered the com suon heo bi cha for $16.95. The food came out quickly because the place was empty. Not the best (flavors were a bit bland and meat could have been more tender), but the portion size was crazy. If you’re just looking for something decent and filling, then this would be the spot for you. Food : 4/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

We are from Toronto Canada where Vietnamese food are fairly good all around town. We have a habit of trying our Vietnamese food when we go down south. I have to say this is comparable to the best of the Vietnamese food in our Toronto.Cindy the owner is Vietnamese hereself. She told us that her restaurant has been around for 30 years. To be honest, the spring rolls weren't the best because they didn't use the authentic wraps. However, the noodle soup more than made it up. The soup has the authentic Vietnam taste. The veggie condiments also included some vegetables where most restaurants don't include. That was a nice touch. I would recommend anyone visiting Orlando to give them a try. Ask Condy for some suggestions. She is super friendly to talk to.

We read reviews for the restaurants and gave it a try. We ordered different kinds of foods such as Bun Bo Hue, Pho, Mi  Quang, Banh Canh, Com Suon Dac Biet, Com Bo Luc Lac, and Com Chien Thap Cam, and Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio….Portion for foods were just right for each person. Ok food for the price. I typically go for chicken teriyaki because it's around $10 to get meat, boiled veggies, and rice.I wouldn't really recommend anything else because the food quality isn't that good for the other stuff. Though it's not bad - my first order was a beef bento and I'll never order that again!You can ask for more veggies vs rice. You can also ask for more sauce once you get your order. It's the same sauce for everything.They cook all the meat on one side of the grill and the rest of the food on another grill. The sushi is made in the kitchen/behind the cashier.Depending on when you get your food, you may need to wait a while (~20 mins) until they cook a batch of chicken - even though you may spot some cooked chicken on standby to be placed on a tray.The waiting line is like an assembly line - you order & pay and roughly follow your tray on the bar holder above the grill. They may or may not call your order # so I think it's better to roughly guess which tray is yours and follow it.

This was the first time I had been to Chili's in about 15 years, and I came here with my family. The experience was good. The waiter was amazing (I wish I could remember his name)[fair-skinned black guy around late 30s to early 40s], and he was extremely polite and attentive. I can honestly say that he is one of the best servers I've come across in a restaurant chain. He was even engaging with our 6 month old son and making him smile. That alone is an attribute that not many other servers possess. He made sure to come around multiple times to check on us and was on top of drink refills. His positive attitude stayed consistent throughout our entire time here, which made us feel very welcome.Now, the cons of this particular location;-The men's bathroom was pretty gross and had a very strong urine odor upon entry.-The tables were not thoroughly cleaned and specks of food were still clearly visible-The booster seat for our son was very unsecure, and we had to prop him in place and keep a hold of him to ensure he did not have a chance of falling-The jalapeno cheddar smoked sausage could have used more seasoning and it lacked smoke flavorOverall, the experience was decent, but the waiter made it memorable. Thank you for the amazing service you provided, and I pray that you see this review. Keep doing an amazing job!!

Best service at a Chili's I've ever experienced.  Fast, fast, FAST! All of the wait staff and management seem to want to be there which in this day and age is very unusual. Staff was really great, The location is really great, Breakfast was good for the most part, but the scrambled eggs were so bad that we could not eat but a small bite. The attendant in the breakfast area was very helpful and nice.  Beds are obviously old. Both beds leaned down at the head end and we had to prop it up with pillows under the mattress so we didn't feel like the blood was running to our heads. The AC ran all night and hardly cooled the room. Every time it cycled off there was a boom that woke me up several times during the night.The price quoted on their website was really off of what I was charged. I looked at the final bill and found that there is a " Service Fee" of 28%.  So, the rate of $199.00 sounded acceptable for a no frills room (2 queen beds with no extras) until they added a "service fee" of $31.84, and the Occupancy Tax of $23.88. So the rate of $199. turned into $254.72. I don't know what a "Service fee" includes, but had I known of the final total I would not have selected this hotel unless all of the hotels in this area have a similar 28% "Service Fee".  Probably going to use the mattress in the van more often:)The view was great, and the restaurant was really good with fair prices. Had it not been for the bed, ac problem, and the high service fee I would have given the hotel at least four, and possibly five stars. The staff at the front desk are fantastic and extremely helpful.

Had the Chirashi Special (inc. salad, but no soup).  The quality of the sashimi was excellent.  However, the restaurant is severely short staffed.  There was a line out the door on a Thursday at lunchtime, but only one waitress handling phone orders, take outs, and eat-ins (outdoor on the sidewalk).  I had ordered pick up through DD, but still had to wait for almost 10 minutes while my completed order sat on the back counter; the waitress was busy on the phone taking an order.2/19/21 Update:  Friday lunch today.  There was zero wait time with two waitresses.  Two item bento (sashimi x 3, nigiri x 2) isn’t quite enough - I had to make some miso soup at home to compensate.  Next time, I’ll go for the 3 item bento or the bento special.3/3/21 Update:  They removed the ringer at the front counter, so I had to wave down the waitress.  Luckily, I was in and out in 2 minutes.  Assorted sashimi lunch 12p for $18.95 is a good value/upgrade from large Poke Bowl for $15 elsewhere.  The slices were smaller and one grade down from the chirashi special, but still excellent and well worth it.  This may become my standard go-to order at Meiko.3/5/21 Update:  Chirashi Regular was excellent!  A good value at $22 for the quality.  The Chirashi Special had better slices for $25, but the Regular was fine, nonetheless.  Both Chirashi were a step up from the regular sashimi- plus you get vinegar rice and the tamago.  I was in and out in 30 seconds on this Friday (two waitresses).  I think the high turnover at Meiko ensures that you get fresh sashimi.7/16/21 Update:  I have ordered the regular Chirashi Sushi two more times.  The first time, I noticed a drop in quality in the sashimi/cuts and much heavier tasting rice.  Not sure if the drop in quality was a fluke, I waited a couple weeks and then ordered again.  Unfortunately, the same consistent drop in quality.  Tastes like they changed chefs.  Service is still fast and friendly.  Dropping one star to 4.

🇮🇳 🥗 One thing we quickly learned about Tampa, Florida is that it is home to a bustling Indian population. We were delighted to see many restaurant choices and many Indian markets! The only problem we then have is which one should we choose to eat at? Simple: choose the one that is full of people. PBC Factory was just that. After eating there we noticed a few things that set it apart from other restaurants similar to it. The prices are generally lower, the quality is just as high, and they have digital systems in place that make it very easy to order. This is great for people on the go. Everything we ordered was vegan and the Chef personally served us and walked us through the options. A+ customer service! We had (my favorite Indian dish) Gobi Manchurian , Samosa Chaat, and Masala Dosa. I noticed that chef utilizes citrus more than other Indian restaurants we’ve eaten at. I love that. The lemony touch is an incredible addition. Well done chef. Next time we are in Tampa we will definitely visit 👍🏽👍🏽

Recently got the app, "Doordash", and was hunkering for some indian food for quite some time. My keywords for the search: pakoras and naan. No sooner did I find the page for this restaurant, "Tabla Fine Indian Cuisine".Looking through there menu, my appetite grew. I not only orders a side of vegetable pakoras and garlic naan, I also ordered a DELICIOUS lamb rogan josh, and to wash it all down, a classic mango lassi.I ordered around 6:45, and my food came at about 7:20, not too bad for delivery. The food did get a bit cold on arrival, but I did reheat my food. Let's start: I was craving onion pakoras, but there were simply "pakoras" on the app, so I assume its a veggie-medley pakora. It is strong on squash/pumpkin if you like that flavor...I'd give that a 4/5. Delicious, but that squash is filling!The LAMB ROGAN JOSH was something I was looking forward to, because I've seen many people order it and say it's amazing. I loved it! Only downside? I wanted more meat! There was a lot of sauce to clean-up with the garlic naan, but I was done with meat (+rice) REAL QUICK. I think it's part appetite, but also part inflation. Whatever the reason it was gone too soon!Lastly, I got the mango lassi. I put it in the fridge to get cold again. What can I say? It's a wonderful fruity, smooth drink that washes all the spicy food down and gives me a fresh palette. There mango lassi has a slight hint of cardamum, fyi.Besides the meat issue and pumpkin-heavy pakoras, this place was a gem! 4/5! Would recommend!!

Wow! This place is great, delicious Indian food, very traditional and absolutely delicious! Prepare to sweat because the dishes are spicy! I’m surprised this restaurant has only 5 star ratings. The location is great, beautiful views, very nice terrasse. I tried calling to make a reservation a couple of days prior to our arrival in Venice. Tried speaking English, French, and Spanish to the waiter on the phone, he lied and said he only spoke Italian, so I did everything I could to be understood, but after a minute of trying, the waiter responded in English, frustrated, then hung up on me without taking my reservation! Impossible to have them back on the phone, they kept hanging up… very very rude… upon arrival, every single staff member was able to speak both French and English…The pizzas we ordered were plain, boring, not very hot and didn’t taste that exceptional… the butter knifes hurt our fingers, impossible to cut a slice without sawing through it! We come from France, and have had way better experiences in Italian restaurants here than in Venice. Maybe because it’s a touristy spot…or maybe we shouldn’t have ordered pizzas…too bad… we won’t come back.

And, if you forgot anything, they have it at the front desk.

We pulled into here to get a soft bed and hot shower and were not disappointed! Best hotel we stayed at in Baja. Great value, quiet, comfortable bed, and we felt safe parking out Vanagon (surfboards and everything else strapped to the roof), in their courtyard. We will definitely be back!Rooms: Beautiful room with hot shower, comfortable bed, and definitely a bargain.
This is the best hotel in the area. Very clean and spacious rooms.  We stay here all the time on our way south.Nearby activities: Mama Espinoza 's restaurant is right next door.

We have stayed here various times and it's always been a good experience.  I love the beautiful stone work and wood craftsmanship.  They put a lot of work into bldg this place.  The only thing still not completed is a restaurant!Rooms: I love the beautiful tile and stone work. The rooms have everything that you need.

Top notch local hotel built in the traditional Mexican style. The King bed room was a great size with comfortable beds (harder than traditional American beds, but very good if you like a firm mattress). Staff were friendly, and some spoke English - but brush up some basic Spanish phrases and sign language and a smile will get you the rest of the way. Prices are extremely reasonable, and represent great value. Even better, the hotel is pet friendly, which was a huge help to us. Overall we were extremely impressed by this hotel, and plan on returning whenever we’re in the area.

Nice place to relax and enjoy an excellent meal. The prices are reasonable for the quality of the food. Highly recommended.The owner speaks English too!

We have attended multiple events at Keepsake, and It is always wonderful.  The staff is always friendly and the food is incredible. Tonight, we attended the Dutchess County SPCA annual benefit, and it was amazing!

Everything was really fantastic. The food was spot on. The drinks were great, the environment was perfect. Entertainment was spot on. The only problem was the sound system. We had a very difficult time listening to the performer or honestly being able to listen to music. The distortion was crazy. Other than that, it's a first rate venue. Tina burner was on fire 🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥

Great selection of food. Had a bbq brisket sandwich & it was excellent. Could have used a side of fries but they don’t offer any. You can order from the 3 different food counters, sit at a table & get a drink from the bar. Everything looked good from the 3 food counters. Staff all work together in 3 & were great. Location is the only negative. Walked from the Metro North train & the area was kind of run down.

Not usually a fan of ordering sweet drinks very often, I am thoroughly enjoying this mangonada from Picolandia inside the Academy. Perhaps one day this place will be a commercially viable food hall if it's filled w/ genuine local favorites. However, I still think the Academy should've been reconverted into a gymnasium w/ a large weight room where Barnfox is located!

First time at Academy and we are blown over not just by the food and ambiance but by the atmosphere. Super friendly staff and amazing vibes. We tried the East West and it was impressive. Would highly recommend the pork belly boa bun and pork belly ramen. We tried caramel macchiato Starbucks style only better. The manager of the cafe was super sweet and the coffee he made was out of the world. We can’t wait for this project to be complete …… can only imagine how beautiful and happening it will be. If you happen to be a Ptown and need a bit or place to just hang out, then definitely head over to Academy. It’s super impressive.

Where do I even start. The entire composition of this business is high scale and unique; from the artwork on the outside of the building to the rustic, industrial interior. Everything I ordered was insanely delicious. You have to try the ramen and pork dumplings. I love the atmosphere and I can’t wait to go back. I was really impressed.

My partner and I visited last night for the first time, and we had ramen. Parking was easy (lot right across) and it didn't cost us anything due to the later hour. We had ramen from East-West which was decent enough as well as banana pudding from the BBQ joint. What I liked most was the vibe of the space for the food hall. We plan to visit again and try the other places. It was somewhat empty when we arrived at 7pm but got busier as time passed. They're only open until 9pm so I hope they will have slighlty later hours on the weekend. Worth a visit!

Was able to stop in during the first week and enjoyed a delicious pork shoyu ramen and gochujang wings from East-West. The wings were delicious and sticky, and the ramen was perfectly savory. Next time we go, I will try to build my own ramen, but being the first time, go with one that is already made to be perfect !

I heard from one very famous Lithuanian influencer that it is the best sushi in Lithuania. Well, now I really know that she is a total soldout.Sushi is ok, not the worst, but definitely not the best in Lithuania. They are so small, that we went to the bakery and bought desserts with coffee.  And we had soup with shiitake mushrooms and each 8 pieces sushi.Customer service is a disaster, if you charge 10eur for smallest sushi in town at least have something good. Nope, girl said to come pick food, then to take plates to the special stand and was quite unhappy when people started coming, it seemed she was somehwere else to be..Biggest disappointment in 2022.

The food was average, but sake with avocado was good. And do not expect something outstanding. The portions are small and since it is a food court ..you have to carry those heavy stone plates yourself. At some point, I thought what if I accidentally dropped them since this place was cramped and crowded, would I have broken my feet((? It is just a thought 🤔 so be careful just in case
One of the best take away sushi 🍣 in Vilnius. Great selection and quick preparation. Photo of Big3 set.
Proper big salmon pieces on Philadelphia roll. Probably the biggest i ever seen in any sushi place. And they add unique green sauce. So far one of the best sushi i ever ate

I've probably had sushi all around Vilnius and some places are pretty high level. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that Sushi Boutique is among one of those places. I recommend the woow roll (21) and the maguro mango tempura (14) Also the wife had the Udon Sriuba which was pretty tasty. The wasabi was as hot as I wanted it, if my nose doesn't burn, it's not good enough. Sake was a bit more price-wise than I expected but as the rest of the food, it was a great brand (Nigeria Sake) Last but not least, the service from one of the girls on the till was beyond any service I have ever had in all of Vilnius. The team here deserves your tip. Will definitely be coming back as I prefer the personal service than the faceless delivery. Ačiū labai :)

We took a family vacation, ages 6-75, and we had a great time! The motel was perfect for our needs, very clean and comfortable. And so much to do! We have used this campground over the years every August. They only keep getting better. We swam, used the play ground, played disc golf and played volleyball. The staff is very attentive and friendly.Nearby activities: Boats, swimming, playground, disc golf, volleyball, arcade.

Just had our wedding there this past Saturday and it was excellent!! Prices are very reasonable. Owners were very accommodating, friendly,  and laid back. Everyone was just so friendly. If you're looking for a weekend get away or plan a special event as a wedding or reunion this is definitely the place to do it at. We will definitely be back!! Thanks for everything and helping make our day special!!

We just spent one night here 6/2014, but really enjoyed ourselves.  The owners were extremely helpful and welcoming.  The site was large and shaded and the campground was very well kept. This is a campground we would definitely return to when in the area. The management is exceptional. The lake is nice and the amenities are great. We stayed in a yurt but the campsites look fine also. We did not use the pool, but the shower facilities are clean and well equipped. We used the laundry facilities and they were also fine. The wifi could be a bit stronger as it didn't reach our location, but we had cell service.

Amazing stay....again! The owners are absolutely amazing and such great supporters of Veterans!Entire place is clean & friendly! Atmosphere is great with a nice lake, walking areas, fire pits, pavilion.  Cabins and rooms are perfect for "glamping"2nd time here this year....and another trip booked for 2022 already!

I'm on a cross country bicycle trip and wanted to stay at the motel, but they were booked, so opted for a tent site in the campground.  Had a very nice chat with the owners and their son when I arrived (very nice people), and the campground is nicely set up around a man-made lake.  I'm only giving it 3 stars because they do not have a "quiet after 10PM" policy.  A family near my campsite had their radio on until after midnight and refused to turn it off when I requested them to, and a campground employee said it didn't seem loud to her.  I ended up having to move my tent at 12:30AM.  I see no reason for not having some sort of "quiet after hours" rule at every campground.

Good pizza, albeit a bit shy on the toppings. The bartender/hostess/server that opened up at 4:00pm was extremely nice and was very effective in completing her duties as her co-workers straggled in a bit late.

Went in to support a friend who just started working behind the bar and definitely found a new favorite spot. We had the cheesy pesto garlic bread, the baked formaggio, and the doloroso. We thought everything was amazing.We also had some incredible cocktails. My partner had the strawberry mule, and I had the Ciao Bella. A vodka-limoncello sour sweetened with oregano syrup. I thought it was the perfect cocktaik to have with pizza.We can be picky, but they make the small location feel cozy. They have a fun menu that tastes delicious. And the service was fantastic.Adding Brixx into our frequent rotation for sure.

Okay, folks, I've found it – the holy grail of pizza places! 🍕 This mom-and-pop shop doesn't just serve pizza; they serve what might just be the best pizza in town. Walking in, you're greeted by those cozy red walls that just scream, 'Welcome, let's have a great time.' It's the perfect spot to chill with friends, grab some drinks, and dive into some seriously delicious pizza. For me, it gives NYC vibes! Pizza is thin with a crunchy crust! Hot Hawaiian and shrimp gamba are the BEST!But here's the cherry on top: the owners. They're the nicest people you'll ever meet, making you feel like part of the family from the get-go. Trust me, this place isn't just good; it's the best. Do yourself a favor and stop by. You'll see exactly what I'm raving about!

This is a 3.5 star review for Sushi to Dai For.  Local sushi in quaint downtown San Rafael, CA was reasonably priced, and centrally located.  The space was large, boardering on vacuous, due to a lightly populated restaurant.  The food itself was acceptably good, although nothing to "Dai" for.  The service left something to be desired.  Not checked on on a regular basis.  Terrible salad dressing was left there, despite complaints, and a request to remove said offending salad, and "Can I get you anything?" was scarcely mentioned, as we lamented about poor service between ourselves.  I would recommend Sushi To Dai For, but with limited reservations, and hesitation.

Native Californian here. Grew up eating Mexican food and this is as close as it gets to it. It's the perfect tiny restaurant with excellent food and good service. The place does a brisk business with takeout orders, too. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Flawless tasting authehentic cuisine. Discovered the restaurant through Google and was skeptical at first. However,  the warm and humble waitress was attentive, as well as patient while I contemplated service. "This is a supermarket/ Bodega" was  My initial thought based on appearance and having lived in New York. However, after a thorough explanation of the specialty  and familiar dishes. I tried a few items.  The shrimp tacos were freshly made with crisp ingredients. The shrimp was not overly done with subtle spices. The calamari was also not overly seasoned but flavors were pronounced like the onions and jalapeños it was prepared with. The Shrimp fajitas tasted like it was cooked at home being fresh , and shrimp cooked to perfection. The confined set up of this establishments  dining area, gives way to more of a personal  exotic experience vs a feeling of inadequacy. The Food was really authentic and reminded me of my visit to Mexico. The the ladies were very warm and hospitable and I look forward to my next dining experience sometime soon.

All good. But why 3 stars…The ribeye is decent but did not wow me in any way. All the food tasted good but nothing out of the ordinary. For the price point, I expected more than ordinary and not having melted ice-cream which my friend ended up drinking as a shake and me wondering if it ever came with the dessert. I’m definitely not impressed by the taste profile of any of the food items.Our server was very attentive, with her constantly keeping the table clean of food debris, but another server who brought the dessert literally made my jaw drop for the wrong reason. He simply pour the syrup onto/into the soufflé without checking with us. It made the dessert too sweet to be enjoyed. That was not a good move. He basically brought it to the table and went about carrying out his act without 1st checking with us. I believe he did that thinking it is a show and him providing service but I definitely did not enjoy it. Also, instead of doing that, he could and should at least check and not served melted ice cream to us.We did come during dinner time, and I am usually not very particular about the ambience of restaurant but it is particularly dimly lit at this place that I could barely see what I’m really eating. Any details could have been missed.

Fine dining, great for a romantic night out.They offer halal wagyu which is nice because not many restaurants offer halal wagyu here in the states (just ask which ones are halal).The wagyu was smooth and delicious, likebutter.If you have dietary restrictions, let them know beforehand, as they do sometimes add non halal wagyu fat to their butter and many of the appetizers are made with animal fat/ alcohol.They were able to accommodate for our dietary restrictions and for celiac.Been here to this location for lunch and dinner, and the SF and Palo Alto ones as well. Make reservations for a special occasion to make sure you get a table and for special occasions, they will give you a handwritten card with a dessert at the end.

It felt like a day spa. The staff were so friendly, the acoustics were good, the chairs comfortable, the food was exquisite. I had the prixe fixe menu, with a party of three so I got to sample all three options. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Wow. We had an incredible meal at Alexander's Steakhouse! You feel it's going to be special visit from the moment you check in. And the service was wonderful. Patient and knowledgeable explaining the menu, very cordial, and prompt. A sophisticated dining room setting with the lights dimmed just so.Besides the palate cleansing watermelon bite with balsamic vinegar, and incredibly tasty bread basket and salted, whipped butter, we enjoyed a couple appetizers and three meals. The lobster bisque was sweet and savory with small chunks of lobster. Honestly, the bisque at another well known, new steakhouse in San Jose gives a lot more lobster. The beet salad was very nice and refreshing.But the reason for the five stars were the main courses. Perfectly prepared dry aged porterhouse and new york steaks melted in your mouth, yet had just enough texture. The mero sea bass was a large serving, flaky, soft, and delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed the food dancing in our mouths. The mashed potatoes and asparagus topped with crab simply amplified the fun.We were too stuffed for desert, but even so, they provided a full, nice, fluffy serving of guava cotton candy.Special occasions for meat lovers, this is your mecca.

Service: My expectations were high when we arrived at the restaurant. We watched as people who arrived after us were served first and received their drinks and even appetizers right away. The interaction was very pleasant when we got it!Food: For the appetizer, we had the three meat platter, and it was delicious in every way! The main course, Finnish Sashi beef, was a disappointment: the taste was 7/10, and it had noticeable toughness and connective tissue that didn't break down in the mouth. Ok food for the price. I typically go for chicken teriyaki because it's around $10 to get meat, boiled veggies, and rice.I wouldn't really recommend anything else because the food quality isn't that good for the other stuff. Though it's not bad - my first order was a beef bento and I'll never order that again!You can ask for more veggies vs rice. You can also ask for more sauce once you get your order. It's the same sauce for everything.They cook all the meat on one side of the grill and the rest of the food on another grill. The sushi is made in the kitchen/behind the cashier.Depending on when you get your food, you may need to wait a while (~20 mins) until they cook a batch of chicken - even though you may spot some cooked chicken on standby to be placed on a tray.The waiting line is like an assembly line - you order & pay and roughly follow your tray on the bar holder above the grill. They may or may not call your order # so I think it's better to roughly guess which tray is yours and follow it.

Finally made it to one of the top 5 restaurants in town according to the local foodies. Could never have sat outside in Michigan this time of year.  Unfortunately because of all the rain the mosquitoes were worse than a spring in the upper peninsula.Sydney was an excellent waiter.Appetizer was substantial and delicious, l recommend.Beat salad was unique, my late father would have loved.Scallop special was a must, should become a standard.Filet Oscar was larger than expected and perfectly cooked. We enjoyed our visit to this restaurant. We order bhel, pav bhaji, sev puri, and masala dosa.I told the server that I did not want cilantro in anything, he said it would be no problem.I only had two problems- the sev puri did not come on flat disks. They came in Pani puri - Puris. I think that was a mistake on their part.The masala dosa which I was looking forward to very much had cilantro in it. The server should have disclosed there was cilantro in the masala if it was premixed. Even though I did not enjoy the dosa, we were planning on returning the next day but we just didn't have time.

During my frequent visits to San Francisco, the Chaat Corner had always piqued my curiosity. Finally getting the chance to dine there, I approached it with an open mind, aware of the mixed reviews it had garnered. As a long-time aficionado of Indian chaat, I was eager to see how this place measured up to my expectations.Our group arrived with an appetite for authentic Indian street food. We ordered a variety of dishes, including samosa chaat, mango lassis, pani puri (also known as gol gappi), and pav bhaji. The samosa chaat was the star of the meal, earning a well-deserved perfect 10 rating. It hit all the right notes, balancing flavors and textures expertly.The mango lassis were a delightful respite from the spice, offering a sweet and refreshing counterbalance. They were consumed quickly and were a highlight of the meal.However, the pani puri presented a challenge. It skewed heavily towards the spicy side, overwhelming my palate and that of my group. While spice is a staple of Indian cuisine, this was a notch above our comfort level. Unfortunately, the pav bhaji was a letdown. The bhaji lacked the freshness I anticipated, tasting somewhat stale, and the bread served with it was regular sandwich bread instead of the traditional pav. This deviation from authenticity was a noticeable drawback.In terms of service, Chaat Corner performed admirably. We were seated promptly, and our orders were served quickly, a testament to the efficiency of the staff.Parking: There is a large underground parking lot right next to the restaurant.

Wonderful! Ate here twice during a five day stay in the Union Square area of San Francisco. I want to start off by thanking Giselle with the utmost sincerity. Yesterday was my son’s first birthday and his mother and I had planned an elaborate day for him that included many sights and stops. You could even say over planned for a one year old. But we hadn’t planned anything for family and friends to get together and celebrate with him. We called the Chuck E. Cheese’s reservation line the day of his birthday hoping to schedule a party for that night, but they informed us that it was absolutely nothing they could do to help make my son’s big day special because we needed to had called at least a day before to set up a reservation. So me, naturally not giving up in the face of adversity, stopped by the Gulfgate location early in the day where I spoke with the on duty manager, Giselle and explained my dilemma. She was so sweet and understanding, and although she could not create a reservation, she insisted that she could find a way to help make his day special in her location. When I returned later that night to celebrate with my son Giselle had kept her word, she had went above and beyond to give us an amazing customer experience. She set up our table decorations herself, put birthday crowns and cups together, put party cards on the kids wrists, and ultimately gave us the complete gift of feeling welcomed and appreciated as people. We had so much fun and enjoyed every moment. From the food to the games to service. Everything was amazing and Giselle helped to make a special day even more memorable. Thank you!

well my grandson loves this place and every time he comes to Houston this is where we have to take him so we're grateful that it's so close and I hope you guys never close again cuz during COVID when you did it was so hard No other place matches Chuck e cheese is just Chuck e cheese Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

We had the pleasure of dining at Red Restaurant and the experience was simply unforgettable. This Dutch restaurant masterfully combines elegance, comfort and top-class cuisine. The restaurant is tastefully decorated, creating a cozy and refined atmosphere that invites you to relax and enjoy every moment. Had a great experience here. We were seated immediately n served complementary rolls. Fresh n hot, came with some cheese/butter I'm not sure but i loved it. Ordered a bone in rib eye and porterhouse t-bone. Both came with 2 sides. We chose mashed potatoes, sauted mushrooms n house salad. The waitress did a great job suggesting us to have the italian dressing for the salad, that they make in house. After placing the order i requested the waitress to change a side. Stuffed baked potato instead of mashed potatoes. I thought she would say no or its too late but guess what she said yes n served both. Checked on us a few times.The steaks were pretty decent according to the price. For the rib eye, my partner asked sauted mushrooms n onions toppings. And it was the best decision. It was juicy as hell. The t-bone seemed a bit dry for me but its fine cz its solid meat. Pairing it with mashed potatoes gives a kick. But i expected a greater quantity of my mushroom side. It came on a tiny bowl. Baked potatoes was good too nothing special.The atmosphere is nothing special, too busy but cozy. Lots of people as it was Sunday. I'll definitely come back sometime.

Unfortunately not the best TX Roadhouse experience I’ve ever had. Clearly popular with locals cuz it was hopping on a Fri night, which I guess makes sense! Was glad I signed up for the waitlist before I drove over. Helped us wait not too long for our small party of 2. Quality of the food wasn’t what I’m used to. Ordered medium rare steak, it came rare. Seasoning of the six ounce sirloin just seemed off like it was missing something. The steam vegetables also didn’t seem to be good quality or cooked quite enough. Also my chili cup was a bit spicy even though I was told it wasn’t. The server didn’t come by much to check on us, so it wasn’t til I was almost done that she stopped by and offered some more cheese and sour cream to help me chill down the spice. At that point I had only two spoonfuls left. My friend seemed to enjoy his beef tips with onion dish and his fries were well seasoned (not overly done like some places). Their fresh rolls were good as always with the cinnamon butter but would’ve loved anorher basket much sooner. Bathroom was a bit poor of a design (couldn’t dry your hands when someone is right in front of it because it’s also where the sink is) and very dirty. Server and other employees were all very friendly and said goodbye to us on our way out which is a nice touch! Wouldn’t go back to this particular location and I just hope I caught them on an off day.Parking: Awkward parking lot that’s a bit chaotic to get in and out of so be carefulKid-friendliness: Fun kids menu to draw on to keep kids busy

We just moved here and finally hit up Texas Roadhouse (one of our favorites back in FL) and it was subpar.We sat for about 15 minutes before a manager came and got us drinks, our appetizer came out pretty quick but there was only a handful of fried pickles, not really enough to share with a whole table and for $10 I’d expect a lot more.The bread was good as always but even the butter didn’t seem as sweet or have as much cinnamon as back home?Our entrees took just over 40 minutes which meant we had been seated for over an hour before getting to eat.My husband ordered the pulled pork which came out chopped (not pulled) and dry, when we mentioned this they said “yeah they just 86’d that pork for being dry, we’ll take it off your bill” but never did.My chicken was also very dry, we took everything home and fed it to the dogs.Our waiter was very polite but he was running everywhere and slapping things down on the table and running away which just felt like we were an inconvenience.We will definitely be waiting to go back to FL before hitting Texas Roadhouse again.

Amazing place ! Super kind workers/servers! Food: Steak was great, had a 22oz sirloin cooked medium rare and it was delicious.Service: The waitress was nice but pretty inattentive. We were served bread without utensils and butter, by the time we got both the bread was no longer hot. In general, the entire staff seemed to be a bunch of high school/college kids who joked around at the registered instead of making sure people had refills and orders in.Atmosphere: It was so loud in there that we couldn’t even hear the music. There was also trash all over the floor at the tables next to ours from current and previous customers. Not a great look.

We got there when they first opened and our service was great. I’ve been places that act out off by the arrival of customers upon first opening so I am appreciative that was not the case. We drive for a living so getting to stop and eat somewhere is a treat. This spot is connected to a hotel so the parking may be minimal depending on what they have going on. We’re in a 40’ straight truck and still found parking with a full lot. Being that it was my first time I’d never had the Hawaiian chicken before. It reminded me of burbon chicken, which I am not a fan of. I asked if they could remake the chicken without the marinade and there was no issue. Don’t let that discourage you from trying the Hawaiian I’m just a super picky eater. The rice pilaf and broccoli were great! Check your water cups because I didn’t catch mine til later into my drink that it had some floaties at the bottom. I had no toddlers with me to cause this. I did let my waitress know and she took care of it and informed me she switched water sources. I mention this so anyone with an issue isn’t hesitant to bring it respectfully to their attention and they too will respectfully address and fix the problem. No yelling or fits are necessary. Now that we know this place is here and we can fit our truck we will be sure to try more dishes in the future should we return to this area. Thank you to the hostess and the rest of the staff for taking such good care of us.

Went in Saturday afternoon and had plenty of seating options. Ordered onion rings, calamari, Reuben balls (?), and mozzarella sticks. The cheese sticks were cheesy. The Reuben balls were tasty. I'm a little torn about this review, because our visit was so uneven. The staff is super friendly, and working their tails off, but are obviously swamped - we were there for nearly an hour and a half, but were never offered refills (even of water), and we had long waits between arriving, ordering, food delivery, and getting our bill. The atmosphere is fantastic, and you can tell that for many of the diners this is their regular stop.For the food, we admittedly went a little basic and just ordered the enchiladas, one with ranchero sauce and one with verde. We got the expected chips and salsa, which were very good. The main dishes were a mixed bag. The ranchero sauce is obviously meant for... "uncomplicated" palates, being sweet and otherwise pretty flavorless. The verde sauce, on the other hand, was fabulous, letting the tomatillos be the star rather than bombarding the sauce with jalapenos like so many other places do.Overall, give this place a try. Obviously, there are many people who love it, and we could have just been there on a night with staffing troubles. At worst, you'll have had an OK meal at a fair price at a pace that forces you to relax. But definitely skip anything with the ranchero sauce.

Ok food for the price. I typically go for chicken teriyaki because it's around $10 to get meat, boiled veggies, and rice.I wouldn't really recommend anything else because the food quality isn't that good for the other stuff. Though it's not bad - my first order was a beef bento and I'll never order that again!You can ask for more veggies vs rice. You can also ask for more sauce once you get your order. It's the same sauce for everything.They cook all the meat on one side of the grill and the rest of the food on another grill. The sushi is made in the kitchen/behind the cashier.Depending on when you get your food, you may need to wait a while (~20 mins) until they cook a batch of chicken - even though you may spot some cooked chicken on standby to be placed on a tray.The waiting line is like an assembly line - you order & pay and roughly follow your tray on the bar holder above the grill. They may or may not call your order # so I think it's better to roughly guess which tray is yours and follow it.

It’s all about the views when you come to Barrel House Tavern. Highly recommend sitting outside… if you can that is. The wait time here can really be no joke depending on how great the weather is. Great news- you can do a reservation on Open Table. When we walked in the wait time was over 30 minutes. Luckily we had a reservation and got our table immediately.Service was great. A wonder stop off for a bite to eat whilst enjoying exploring Sausalito. Staff and food are great here, it is a recommended place of mine if you’re in Sausalito.Vegetarian options: Good selection available on the menu.Dietary restrictions: Ask your server.Parking: Further inland.Kid-friendliness: Welcome.Wheelchair accessibility: Accessible. Lift to upper floors.

Barrel Horse Tavern offers a unique dining experience perched on the waterside of Sausalito, providing breathtaking views of the city skyline. This upscale brewery effortlessly blends the charm of a waterfront tavern with the sophistication of fine dining. The menu boasts an impressive variety of dishes, catering to every taste and preference.The clam chowder at Barrel Horse Tavern is a standout, offering a delightful combination of lightness and creaminess that tantalizes the taste buds. Meanwhile, the Tavern burger, a beloved staple on the menu, showcases the culinary expertise of the chefs with its mouthwatering flavors and hearty portion.For those mindful of their diet and physique, the half chicken with spinach is a phenomenal option, offering a protein-packed and satisfying meal without compromising on taste. Whether you're indulging in the classic comforts of clam chowder and Tavern burgers or opting for healthier fare like the half chicken with spinach, Barrel Horse Tavern ensures a dining experience that leaves a lasting impression.

We came at 12:30 and the restaurant was already full so I suggest making a reservation. We waited about 20 minutes to get seated outside looking out to the water. We didn’t love the menu but we liked what we ordered.Wheelchair accessibility: You have to walk up the stairs to access the restaurant but they have an elevator for wheel chairs.

I love Lucca, I live in Benica and come here 3 times a week. The food is awesome and the atmosphere is fantastic. You'll find a crowd of grounded middle aged to older people here. It's a great atmosphere with the perfect amount of chatter and never rowdy.Darcy, Jack, Anna, Luke, Justin and the other staff are all awesome people.Pictured: The Cobb salad is legit.

Service was great sitting at the bar. Definitely a locals hangout. We parked several blocks away, but the walk was enjoyable along the Main Street of Benicia, lined with interesting shops.

I had heard a lot about Amber Indian Restaurant, so I decided to give it a try. The ambience is very good, and you feel the positivity as soon as you enter. Walk-ins are allowed, but on busy days (especially weekends), they do accept reservations. Please note, you need to look for street or a public garage parking.Personally, I felt it is very pricey. Since I had a late lunch, I decided to go with starters and ordered just two items: Shrimp Ambotik and the Tandoori Sampler, along with Coke, Jeera Soda, and Lemonade. The total came to $100, including tip.The food was well done and the quantity was right. Quality-wise, it was satisfactory—nothing particularly amazing. They do serve liquor, if someone is looking for that option. Overall, the experience was good with attentive service. Food lovers can give it a try, but be prepared for the final bill.

Went there on Saturday evening and got a table instantly. It got busy around 8pm so probably it’s better to use reservation, especially for bigger parties. The place is very spacious, has several large areas and all of them are very cosy and intimate.I liked the menu, as it wasn’t too large and it was pretty easy to find what you’re in the mood for and make an order.We went with Tandoori Chicken, Malabari shrimp and Garden collage from tandoori. All the dishes were delicious and the presentation was great too.The service was also good. We had our water refilled without having to ask and our waiters were knowledgeable and friendly.I’m definitely putting this place to my to-go list for Indian food and can recommend it for cosy dining experience in SF downtown.

Amber India is a great fine dining restaurant for authentic Indian cuisine. I loved their food and  their ambience. The waiter serving us was very sweet and took good care of us. I loved their garlic naans, tandoori chicken and paneer dishes. The drinks were sweet and perfectly balanced. At the end, they also got a birthday cake as a complete surprise as it was my birthday(despite none of us ordering it) One of the sweetest things ever.Lots of love and can’t wait to be here again

Came here randomly on a day when they had brunch on a Saturday. It’s lunch foods plus bottomless mimosas. They had a very wide selection of foods that were made very well. Everyone in your group will find something they like. Also the fresh naan is amazing ! The food was high quality and tasty. They had both vegetarian and meat options. They also had lots of desserts and chai as well. The environment feels upscale but relaxed. The service is great. Servers check on you frequently but in a subtle and slick way, not overbearing or annoying.

Excellent on all levels! Definitely not your average Indian restaurant. Above average prices from that perspective but lives up to it in delivering an exceptionally above average experience with the quality food, service, and atmosphere! Portion sizes are big and shareable!  Highly recommend the Dum Biryani - we ordered lamb - which was delicious, so many flavors to even count, the lamb was cooked to perfection! Can’t go wrong with any of the dishes really! Excellent wine offerings to pair with the menu! Bravo!

Amber Restaurant exceeded all my expectations! The food was absolutely delicious. We had the tandoori sampler, kale kofta, and the garlic naan—each dish was the best I've ever had. Velington provided top-tier service, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend this place to anyone. I came here for the SF half marathon, and after this fantastic meal, I feel energized and excited for the race tomorrow. It’s also dog friendly seating outside if you have a behaved dog.

Ok so the food was good. It’s Indian so you can never say it’s traditional because someone will disagree and argue.Atmosphere here was ok it felt like a modern 80’s restaurant.
