Ok food for the price. I typically go for chicken teriyaki because it's around $10 to get meat, boiled veggies, and rice.I wouldn't really recommend anything else because the food quality isn't that good for the other stuff. Though it's not bad - my first order was a beef bento and I'll never order that again!You can ask for more veggies vs rice. You can also ask for more sauce once you get your order. It's the same sauce for everything.They cook all the meat on one side of the grill and the rest of the food on another grill. The sushi is made in the kitchen/behind the cashier.Depending on when you get your food, you may need to wait a while (~20 mins) until they cook a batch of chicken - even though you may spot some cooked chicken on standby to be placed on a tray.The waiting line is like an assembly line - you order & pay and roughly follow your tray on the bar holder above the grill. They may or may not call your order # so I think it's better to roughly guess which tray is yours and follow it.

The red miso soup had excellent tofu - definitely NOT supermarket bought - a great first impression.  I ordered the Chirashi which came out to $23.98 after tax.  The portions were huge - 19 pieces of fish, enough for two people, but no tamago yaki.  The freshness was pretty good, probably due to good turnover at this restaurant.  The waitresses were quickly moving from table to table like busy bees.  Unfortunately, they gave me the same wrong bill, three times in a row 8^p. Overall, even though a bit expensive,  it's actually a good value at 4.5 stars, considering the portions and attention to quality (it appears to be a Korean-run restaurant).  I will be back to try their sashimi and nigiri.

Okay. It did take a little time but I love the boiled crawfish, potatoes, corn, etc. To me they are spicy but perfect. I don't have a high tolerance for spicy food so some people might think not enough seasoning.

The employees haven't been nice to me at all but the crawfish were so very good. I'm giving 5 stars because I'm judging on their good food alone. I suppose owner probably doesn't know his employees aren't nice to customers.

The food is great and the prices are decent.  Wish it was a tad lower.  You may have to wait for some boild items on slow days which is understandable.  The shrimp crabs and crafish are seasoned nicely.

Had the weekend to kill and was looking for where the locals eat. This is not a sitdown restaurant, what it is is a small seafood market that supplies restaurants around the area. They also do a boil for takeout only. I got the crawfish and some shrimp, with potatoes and corn. I was temped to try the crab, but I can only eat so much. The food was awesome. Robert the owner was super friendly and informative, Dallas and Lawrence who work there were friendly and courteous. Over all I would say it was a great experience.Great food, good prices and a friendly atmosphere.As a side note location provided on Google Maps is wrong. They are located between the hospital and the lake. A small building on the left headed out of town. Dont let looks deceive you, yes it is an old gas station but it is truly a diamond in the rough.
We got crawfish & crabs & they were delicious! Just enough spice to give it a good kick without setting your face on fire. The potatoes & corn were tasty & tender. We'll be back!
Best craws around. Sad t hey didn't have crabs.

We stumbled upon this restaurant and were fortunate to get in as reservations seem to be necessary even on a Monday. The food was exquisitely prepared and plated, a pleasure for sight, smell and taste. The restaurant is small, but the sound level is low and the decor is warm and welcoming.

Excellent bistro food.  I love the mussels and pomme frites.  Don't leave without trying the best tarte tatin in the free world.  Great place for meeting friends, birthdays or romantic evening with that special person.  (They will be impressed)  The candlelight, white table cloth and expert service make this a standout.
Although this is not the most sophisticated French bistro cuisine that I have had, I enjoyed the food.  The atmosphere is cozy, and the service that we received was friendly and attentive.
Delicious seasonal French brunch with a bottomless mimosa is hard to beat.   Try the L'assiette de Bisto for the best of all worlds breakfast.
A favorite--really reminds us of bistros in France. Food is consistently good--mussels, french fries with aoli, fish dishes (always good and varied).
Great weekend brunch place. Old style french bistro. Can get very busy. Bottomless mimosas!
The food here is acceptable but the service, at least on Sunday mornings, is so bad it's insulting. I give this place up.
wonderful small french restaurant,   3 blocks north of the downtown   berkeley bart.  the french onion   soup is worth the trip.

Update. "Welcome back," was how I was greeted before ordering the $7.99 Tuesday special, Teriyaki chicken with steamed rice and salad along with 'double meat.' Which made it a little over $10.00. Though I haven't been to Sarku Japan in approximately 2 years, I decided to give them another chance. Besides, I'm not 100% sure that, a meal from them gave me some stomach issues. That said, this visit was impressive. It was simply delicious. Check 'em out the next time you're in San Bruno.
Highly recommend the Teriyaki chicken over rice tastes good! Good service ! Nice people around here! Will be return back!Parking: A lot of parking space.

Unacceptable. Sarku Japan  was once, a mall food court restaurant I bragged to other's about. Nice portions if you order 'extra meat,' and good tasting grilled chicken on a bed of rice or with noodles. Wasn't crazy about their teriyaki beef plates.So what's unacceptable about Sarku Japan in the Tanforan Food court? The food. Over the months during the pandemic, I noticed a regression in the taste of the grilled chicken. Hey, there was a time when one had to wait in line here! Ok? The 'straw that broke the camel's back' for me happened when a lady who's usually on the register, in now on the grill! True, she gave good portions but I don't think the chicken she was grilling...was ready for consumption though she gestured, mines was ready. I ate my grilled chicken plate which brought about a tummy ache. Haven't been back since and that was approximately a couple of years ago. It's interesting, Panda Express hasn't upset my stomach yet. And they're opposite Sarku Japan.

Decent price for a filling meal! It’s a quick fix of proteins and carbs on a grill. When your looking for something different to grub on in the mall grab the teriyaki chicken and rice/noodles and add hot sauce.

I usually get the chicken teriyaki bento with rice, this time I switched up to the noodles and it was the best choice ever. The noodles are packed with flavor by all means, and the chicken is tender and marinated well. I always get filled up with the deliciousness

Great Japanese style fast food. Not a huge selection, but the basics are definitely included in their menu. Teriyaki Chicken, beef,veggies, shrimp, noodles and rice.. Simple Sushi assortment. Gyoza and salad come with their version of the Bento Box. Nothing too 'out of the ordinary' and exciting, but tasty and satisfying. And if quick and yummy is what you're looking for, then go to Sarku Japan. Located in the historic but now Millennial and upbeat Tanforan Mall in San Bruno.

I really enjoy this place, food tastes good and is fresh. Only thing I disliked about this location is they don't offer fried rice, other locations do. Overall I'd recommend eating here. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

5 stars, because when we’d said we’d like an extra plate to split a few dishes, they actually made two separate plates of food for us, so thoughtful! Thank you for such a kind gesture.Their scallops are delicious, their hanger steak (pictured) was excellent. Great wine, and even a cute bathroom setup.Loved their outside patio, though we ultimately chose to enjoy their indoor seating.Charming place, go see for yourself!

I can't believe that I haven't reviewed Sociale before. I ate there last night for the sixth time. The food is always delicious. Last night I had the seared scallops with tomato jam and finely sauced peas. The dish is beautiful to look at and tastes unbelievably delicious. The crab salad was fresh and fabulous. The olive oil cake is a perfect ending to a great meal.  Here's a June 2023 update: I ate at Sociale again last Saturday. I ordered a morel mushroom with Madeira sauce that was amazing. The sweet carmelized onions blended beautifully with the nuttiness of the sauce and umami of the mushrooms. My friends had the egg plant parmesan and the other, a vegan bolognese sauce over pasta. The service was as amazing as always.

A seemingly simple neighborhood Trattoria with fare that is clean, pure and soulful. The prices are very reasonable and I was pleasantly surprised by an amazing wine list with truly artisanal producers. Ask for Jim Kennedy who directs the wine program. Very humble and extremely knowledgeable. I WILL BE BACK! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 Recommended dishes
Fried Olives, Seared Scallops, Beet and Orange Salad, Smoked Trout Risotto, Game Hen

Recommendation for vegetarians
Somewhat recommend … More
Very cute spot but easy to miss it if you’re just walking by. Very light + yummy pappardelle, rigatoni and burrata. Chocolate oblivion cake was good but the sea salt was a bit overpowering.

Had such a wonderful bday day w my man. Order the rack of lamb and braised duck. To start fried olives and Brussels. The bottle of Chianti was perfect. The ambiance and hospitality is divine. Best part of it all was Veronica our server, attentive, and thoughtful. Carried the evening with grace as our appetizers and meals were served. Highly recommend!! Thank you Veronica and team at Sociale! Made me feel special this bday!

Sociale has been a go to dinner destination for us for the past several years. Well prepared meals, excellent service, cozy indoor and outdoor seating options. Broad Italian wine selection (but not cheap!) Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Romantic place for a couple's night out but also good for business dinners. Took my coworkers out for dinner at Sociale and it was perfect for conversation on the outdoor covered patio. Food and wine service was also very friendly and patient with all our questions.Vegetarian options: Mushroom risotto & vegetable pasta

Visited this restaurant because acquaintance (a regular) highly recommended it. 3 1/2 stars to be exact. Truly feels that this restaurant is over-rated, based on the taste of the dishes.Staff was no doubt courteous and professional; atmosphere wasn't bad. Presentation of the dishes looked good. The Fried Olives was interesting. The Wagyu Braised Short Rib was excellent. But the other dishes, like the fish and pork, fell short of expectations. Also, wait time for the food was a bit too long.

Had a wonderful dinner at Sociale last week. We ordered the following appetizers (all 5*)- burrata, soup, fig salad, and fried olives. Olives were a little too salty for my liking but others in my party enjoyed them. Main course- artichoke ravioli, pici bolognese, rigatoni, and pappardelle with braised duck. While all of them were delicious, braised duck pasta was the best!Their beautiful patio coupled with top notch service was a treat. They are also taking required precautions during this pandemic.

Excellent location, broad menu and deep wine list.  Definitely coming back.  Eggplant Parm spectacular Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Fried Olives, Blood Orange Panna Cotta … More

The tacos here were delicious and definitely worth trying. I believe you won’t be disappointed with the food. However, the cleanliness of the place was a bit disappointing. While the restaurant itself looks beautiful, there were a lot of flies around while we were eating, which took away from the experience. If the place were kept cleaner, it would definitely be an added advantage.

Solid Mexican food from tacos to menudo. I had menudo which was very authentic and good. The meat was perfect and they included my favorite cuts. It’s pretty greasy though. The tacos are also very good. The aguas frescas are not that great. Service is pretty basic but fast. The eating area is open air but is covered. The only thing I don’t like about this place is when there are dodgers fans. lol! They’re not my cup of tea and they ruin LA traffic. Baseball is boring and the team displaced hardworking citizens from Chavez Ravine long ago. Parking is usually not an issue because they have a lot in the rear. Meter parking and free street parking also available.

The Original Carnitas Michoacan provides a reliable option for dining anytime, offering hearty portions at reasonable prices. While their salsa selection is limited and there are no restroom facilities available, their standout feature is their flavorful Carnitas tacos. These tacos pack a punch with their bold spices, catering to those who enjoy a bit of heat in their food. Overall, despite some minor inconveniences, it's a place worth considering, especially for its satisfying portions and flavorful dishes.

I work a few blocks away & stop here maybe once a week my go to item is the cabeza tacos juicy melt in your mouth & full of flavor. The salsa is good too & the tripas tacos are also fire. I always go b4 work which is early morning so no lines & the dudes working there are cool with me. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

1 of my 2 favorite 24/7 excellent every time Mexican food joints in LA.I took a friend who'd returned from living in Mexico - it's their favorite too.Parking: The parking lot is small, but well laid out.It and the street fill quick at lunch and dinner rush most days,Wheelchair accessibility: Window ordering, but everything is flat.

These are Ok tacos. The carnitas are good but dry and you don't get a lime with your order.Good tacos are defined by their salsas and they only have one type here and ration it.The palace is dirty, when someone leaves a table you take theirs without getting cleaned

First time visit 😊It was easy to order as the menu had many options with good price. I got two large drinks, a combination carnitas plate, 2 giant sopes de pollo and a green wet burrito for $48. The chipotle red hot sauce was fire 🔥 ! I do recommend this place to eat anytime. Will be back…..

I had the Carnitas tacos....the sauce on it was particularly spicy for light weights.. so beware....but if you're a daredevil it was magnificent....and you can get more sauce to liven it up even more.....I would definitely visit them again on my next California trip...
There might be better nachos out there but we drive 30 min to get nachos here! Good portions and the Sopes are huge. Pretty good and 24 hours. Service is hit or miss but overall has been worth it.

We were craving sushi and came here due to reviews having great things to say.We had about a ten minute wait before we were seated.The menu is HUGE with tons of options. It was a nice touch that you can view the options on their website, but they don’t have photos of all the rolls which sucks.I really like how they have many cucumber wrapped options.I LOVED the heart attack roll so much. Everything else was fresh and tasty as well. The mochi was perfect after.Staff was friendly and attentive. Price was good for quality. Decor and vibe was on point also.Lots of parking as it’s located in a strip mall.Would return.

Numerous fresh and delectable options! New head chef Joe possesses exceptional skill and is bringing innovative Japanese techniques to St. George, making it an ideal weekly destination for any sushi hustler. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Citrus Mistress Roll

Came in for a lovely early dinner and had exceptional service from Milo (unsure of spelling). He went above and beyond to make our dinner experience special. The flavor and entire course was perfection. Highly recommend!!!!! I forgot to take a picture before eating... but the picture attached is still filled with beauty. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

We decided to visit St George, UT this weekend because he wanted to experience Japanese culture and cuisine. To our dismay, very few Japanese people live in St George. This restaurant made us feel at home again, thanks Kabuto! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Miso Soup, Spicy Garlic Edamame, Roll, Fried Rice … More

Update 4 years later: we still love Kabuto sushi and think they have really great food but we were recently in the area on vacation and noticed that they have jacked up their prices to an average of $20+ per roll. This is just not reasonable for us, and so we have had to take our sushi loving selves elsewhere this trip.  I hope they can cut their prices so that we can enjoy them in the future but if not we will not be back unfortunately.Original review 4 years ago: The best sushi I have ever eaten. I thought that I knew sushi, but this put every other experience to shame! Kabuto sushi has only been open for two days, and I can already tell they are going to be very successful. Our server Hunter was very attentive and caring, and all of the staff were happy and friendly. The presentation of the sushi was far above anything I have experienced. Everything tasted so fresh, and you could really taste every ingredient and the flavors combined to be so delicious! My only complaint is that I live five hours away and have nothing nearby that comes close to what I just experienced!

Very very impressed, and we are big sushi fans!!!! Came in for lunch, and our daughter recommended it. We got 8 rolls and were super happy with each other. The variety of rolls is quite large and a good mix of styles. Everyone left happy and with full tummy’s. We will stop by next time we are in St George. We got a side booth and loved the privacy we felt. Love the atmosphere and everyone was very kind.

Update 2 (8/2024)- New ownership. We haven't been yet but prices have jumped up and coincidentally enough on the most popular dishes. Both our favorite sushi rolls are over $20 each and it's just not worth it to order here. $12-15 a roll, maybe a tad higher for a good sushi roll... but $20 a roll for sushi in the desert? Better off going to Vegas and getting much better options for lower prices. Sad to type this up as we love the rolls but it just isn't worth that much to us. Review bumped from 5 to 4 stars for affordability and overall value. Food is definitely good but comes at a very high cost.UPDATE (1/2022)- The hours of the restaurant seem to fluctuate, and sometimes they close early or won't allow take-out. Reaching them via phone can be difficult as well too, so just a heads up!BUT.....It's great sushi. One of the best in town. It's a newer restaurant in but has made some waves already for its unique and high quality food.Updated Visit - 8/20 - The Love Me Tender roll is insanely good. I had to get it twice to really appreciate all of the flavors and the complexity of the roll. There is so much going on in the roll (and that it is baked), but wow! This is their best roll IMO.Also try the Garlic Edamame - TASTY! A recent favorite roll as well is the Volcano, so good! My wife's favorite is the Put Your Hand Up roll. It's a good roll, not too fishy, but still sushi and flavorful.Previous Visit - We ordered dinner to-go and got a mix of 4 sushi rolls and a short rib to try a few things on the menu. Unfortunately the short rib meal was not included in our to-go bag, so we'll have to try that again soon. After calling in, the owner was great to make it right and we'll be trying it soon.The sushi rolls we ordered were the Linda, No Pain No Gain, Jackpot, and a California. All of the rolls brought their own uniqueness to the table but there wasn't one roll that really stood out. I would recommend both the No Pain and the Jackpot. The No Pain is a more creative roll with stuffed ingredients and also a mixed ingredient on top. It's labeled as spicy but was mild, in Mt opinion. The sauce was excellent. The Jackpot was a great middle-of-the-road roll. Not too much fish, great presentation, but also a really tasty roll. I'd recommend this roll for someone who likes a more neutral sushi roll and who wants a great flavor as well. This would definitely be a great roll for a beginner to try out.All in all, we were impressed with the presentation of the sushi as well as the quality. They were definitely busy and have some things to work out on the customer service and restaurant management side of things, but they are still learning the ropes so I can't hold that against them, but do expect longer waiting and prep times in the upcoming weeks of their opening in town. We will definitely be back as the menu is quite extensive!

Get this in your mouth! I eat here once a week! Service is excellent and the food is out of this world. A gem in St. George and great drink prices. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

This is the second time in 4 days we've been here, and both times it was TOP NOTCH!!! Please forgive me for the half eaten photos. I usually do better. Both times our party was 6 or more. The waiter, who was the same both times, took our order by memory and nailed it! By far the best sushi I've had since moving here a year ago. I love the atmosphere, with the Japanese backdrop and the cool light fixtures. Quick, efficient, and attentive service. I moved from a big city with great options for sushi... this is right up there with the best!

Been here a couple times now without reservations. We were lucky that there were seats available. We weren’t hungry this time so only ordered an appetizer and drinks. Our dinner companions ordered pizza and salmon. Both came very quickly and were delicious. Food : 4/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 Recommended dishes
Calamari and Shrimp … More

We Arrived without a reservation and were graciously seated outside, under a heat lamp.The food was good. I loved the beets we ordered to start. They were delicious. The margarita pizza was good, but there wasn’t much sauce or toppings. The crust was the star of the pizza- soft and delicious. For dinner we tried the gnocchi which was good, but not very flavorful. I love a rich red sauce but this one just didn’t pop. (To be fair, the waiter recommended the ravioli over the gnocchi, but I was trying to avoid cream sauce.)We also had the Ox Tail pasta- my husband loved it.The staff was gracious and very nice, but since we were the only ones outside, after waiting quite some time, I had to go in and ask to order. Once our order was in, things progressed well.No time for dessert, but we will be back for more beets, pizza, the ravioli, and to try some happy hour treats.

Five of us had dinner on a Wednesday night. We had a reservation and were seated immediately and the staff were great. The food came fast and was excellent. We ordered a third pizza after we eating the first two and it also came out quickly. The pizza crust is uniquely light and fluffy and soft. Just magic in your mouth. The flavors were great. The calamari and shrimp appetizer was excellent. The octopus flavor was good but was much too tough. Lemon cake is excellent.  Tiramisu was excellent. Great meal.

It's a great place to eat. Every dish we tried was delicious. The servers are nice. Cocktails are good. One of our go-to places for coworkers birthdays. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Scrumptious Tiramisu, Truffle French Fries, Calamari and Shrimp … More

My mother and I came here for dinner after attending a musical at the Orpheum theater. The restaurant was on the corner in a nice neighborhood. It was very good quality food. To start, we had the Polpo Alla Griglia (grilled octopus), the croquettes and the broccolini. The octopus was very chewy and a bit over cooked, but good flavor.Then on the main course, I ordered the Fettucine oxtail and my mother ordered the Spaghetti Cacio & Pepe. The size of the portions was perfect. I didn't feel as if I had eaten too much afterward. Then for dessert, we shared a Limoncello cake which was heavenly and creamy.I would definitely eat here again.

Our crispy artichoke starter (carciofi fritti) was delicious sprinkled with parmesan and served with a zingy lemon aioli. We both opted for gnocchi for our mains, with eggplant, fried basil, garlic, crushed cherry tomatoes, and straciatella cheese. Each element offered bright flavor and quality ingredients, but I would have liked them to complement each other more when eaten together.I cannot remember my cocktail, but my friend had the golden negroni with saffron syrup and surprise extra bling from gold foil. I'd definitely go back when I'm in the mood to try their pizza, which seemed to be the most popular choice on the menu.Parking: Street parking, which is meters until evening, unless you park 5+ blocks away.

Very lively, amazing pizza, the dough is very light and soft, just perfect. The 2 pizza men are Italian! I heard talking to each other (I am Italian born). Very nice service. Just worth a 5 star review Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Doppio Zero Pizza … More

Very high quality Italian pizzas. Love that thin crust where the Margarita sauce and crust just melds together. Cocktails are also well made. Service at the bar was great. Watched the pizzas bake and they’re made so quickly. One thing though, didn’t enjoy the second pizza we had which was the crazy pizza special as much, but it was still really well made and was great with their chili oil. Will come back to try their 4-6pm HH.

This place deserves more love than it gets! Walked in on a Friday night and was able to get a table by the bar, near the kitchen - which could’ve been terrible with all the movement of people, but I was already happy to have a seat.The experience ended up being great, staff was very friendly, good value for the money wine options, food being served super fast.Salad as a starter had a fantastic dressing and was very fresh. I noticed the pizzas were not my style (i like it very cheesy) so i went for the pasta and zero regrets. It was loud and busy in a good way - good energy if that’s what you’re looking for in a fun night out.

I had always seen Doppio Zero in the neighborhood but had no idea what a culinary delight it was until I joined a group meal there. I felt transported to Tuscany. Everything was so fresh, fragrant, and delicious! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

The flavors of this place are decent. The prices are better. The ambiance is great. There's lots of tables and seating. The customer service is really nice. I came with kids and they brought kid friendly cups of mango lassi for us. It was a great place to stop on college ave. They forgot two things from our order and I couldn't tell if they charged us but because they didnt give and itemized receipt but ..you know ... I'll be back. A great place to have lunch or dinner. The Malai kofta was such a treat. Oh apparently they have mozzarella stuffed naan lol. Yum

loved the staff, so friendly and accommodating. The food was pretty good. Not the best indian food i’ve ever had so probably wouldn’t specifically return but I wouldn’t mind eating here again as it was good. Lots of siting space and many options. Recommended dishes
Garlic Naan and Chicken Tikka Masala … More

Yes, of course you can get a fresh and perfectly flaky and beautifully stuffed samosa… why stop there? Order the goat tikka masala! Or goat biryani! Or any number of chicken, lam and veggie options. This location is the newest and it’s perfect! BTW I live in East Oakland, trust me, it’s worth driving into Berkeley

Really great briyani and that's coming from someone who has eaten quite a lot of briyani in their life. They use basmati rice and cooks it with different spices, making it really flavorful. Prefer the goat biryani over the chicken one as its slightly more tender and moist. Also, a big fan of the garlic naan!! It's my 2nd or 3rd time eating this but def recommend dining in as the food tastes like a warm hug when its served to your table.

We ordered chicken tikka masala, vindaloo lamb, tandoori chicken and garlic naan. Everything tasted freshly cooked, and the portions were filling. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Garlic Naan and Chicken Tikka Masala, Naan … More

Really straight forward Desi food mix of tikkas, karahi and tandooris, and obviously biryani and naan. You get your own plates, utensils and glasses from the front. They also have complimentary chai at the front which you can help yourself to. We ordered chicken biryani and Tikka which did the job for us, though I wish it was a tad bit spicier. Great for people who like milder Indian food.

Pretty okay good here. Ordered a chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and a regular naan. The food came out piping hot and smelling so good. The garlic naan was tasty but could have used a bit more salt to enhance the taste. There chicken masala sauce was good but the chicken was kind of tasteless. It was basically just a hunk of meat in the tasty sauce.
A local favorite for curries in the busy retail area of Elmwood. Curries can be accompanied with fragrant rice or naan.

The food was really good. We had a variety from pizza to salmon to sliders. The service however left a lot to be desired. They close at midnight we arrived around 10.20pm and stood at the hostess station unacknowledged for 10 minutes as the wait staff walked by side eyeing our party as if they hoped we’d disappear. I had to ask if there was a host available before one waitress finally addressed us and tried to find a table. The restaurant had about 10 patrons I total. Our waitress was kind but there were several issues. Our orders were taken incorrectly as in she brought out the complete wrong item. She didn’t bring out the additional sides that were ordered and they still ended up on the bill. Overall the service wasn’t great but it was our only option at that hour.

My friends and I are regulars at this place because it's close to our work and open late. We normally request for Wendy to wait on us and she does a great job. I've tried many different things off the menu. My favorites for appetizers are the fried couscous Mac n Cheese balls and the soft pretzel, but my friends really like the chicken pot stickers as well. For entrees I really love the smokehouse burger and chicken parm, but the fish & chips and pizzas aren't very good. The pizookies are always delicious, especially the cinnamon rolls and brownie baked one. Prices can be expensive.

Let me start off by saying the guy(had a black shirt with Shamrock)that was at the door and seated us was very nice and knowledgeable, went over the menu. The place looks good inside and out. The lemon pepper wings were well seasoned and good. The Bj's Smokehouse burger was great and had a grill taste. The fries were okay, nothing special. The macaroni bites were good because of the sauce it came with. By itself, it had no flavor. Our waitress Kelly was great and attentive. I do recommend this place.

Came here to try the food and saw some cool menu items. The appetizers were pretty good but the wait for the main food was a little long, the service was super good but on the other hand the pizza was not worth 20$ for how small it is. The fries weren’t too good and the Alfredo was very minimal. For the price it wasn’t worth it to me. Food : 3/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 Recommended dishes
Avocado Egg Rolls

A friend introduced us to this restaurant a few years ago (down river location). We really enjoyed it and we were happy to find an establishment closer to home. I do miss the meatball appetizer, that was my favorite since it doesn't take much to fill me up. The food isn't bad, prices can be so-so, but what hasn't gone up these days? We like to go on Tuesday's when their Pizookies are 4 bucks.  It depends on the day but it seems like when it's slow, it takes forever to get your food. You go when it's busy & it's out so quick.

BJHistory:I went to a BJ’s in California and it was “ok”. The burger was tasteless and bland. It left a bad taste in my mouth and I was turned away! Really!Then corporate contacted me and offered me a second try. I was very hesitant and turned off. After a few months, I decided to give BJ’s one last try. This would be it. All or nothing. If they failed again, I would never return. I’m a good restaurant eater and a good tipper.Today:2023Wow! I finally got to try their Prime Rib! I had my usual medium rare! Wow. Excellent! Juicy and cooked to perfection. Seriously. I was impressed. All the fat melted in my mouth. This really was good. The au jus was delicious and complimented the prime rib perfectly. When cooked for a long time, it should be soft like butter and it should melt in your mouth. This prime rib was a major HIT. Wow. Don’t miss this.I will definitely be back for more Prime Rib. Wow.2024Came back. Still good. They updated their menu too. They have shrimp now and onion rings now. Great food. They open till 12 every day now.Highly recommended

I ordered a smokehouse BBQ burger, was very good, ordered medium and came out perfect. Laura our server noticed our table was not completely clean, she apologized and cleaned it again. Laura checked on us often. I will be going back. My business colleague had a bacon cheese burger and said it was very good and prepared perfectly. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

You can have great food and great atmosphere but you cannot have a great restaurant without an amazing server! Our server Allison was awesome-attentive without making us feel pressure, knew details of food and drink menu, checked on us constantly, was very pleasant! She went over and above just taking our order and serving our meal. She made our night out really memorable! We will come back because of her personality and her service.

It’s been over a year since my husband dined at BJ’s and we to say this has been the best experience for us here. Larry the host was amazing going over the menu and specials with us. What hosts does that? It certainly was refreshing. Amber M was kind and patient and made our dining room experience even better. We will be back again soon!

I ordered takeout without realizing this was a ghost kitchen. They put the pizza on its side in a locker for pickup, which resulted in the toppings on half the pizza sliding off. For a $40 pizza, I expected better. Food : 3/5 | Service : 3/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 … More

This is Amici's NEW North Oakland Cloudkitchen! I love that more and more cloudkitchens are popping up because it makes it suuuper quick and easy to order for pick up or delivery. I placed my order online and it was all packed up and ready to go when I arrived!They have a variety of specialty pizzas including a CLAM AND BACON pizza which is honestly a fave of mine! We had to keep with the clam theme and also ordered their fettuccine with pesto and clam which came with breadsticks. A little squeeze of lemon (which they do include) makes it even better. We also had their flame roasted lemon chicken wings and if you dip it in ranch, it's perfect. Pizza and chicken wings are a superior combo in my opinion!

I ordered for pickup at this location. They had my order ready to go when I arrived. Parking was fairly easy nearby as well.The menu is pretty large. There’s pizza, pasta, sandwiches, soup, wings, desserts, and more, so you can easily order for your whole family.I got the Philly pizza and Amici’s Combo pizza, the bbq chicken wings, and fettuccine with pesto and clams.My favorites are the Amici’s Combo pizza and the fettuccine pesto with clams. The pizza was tasty and I liked that they don’t skimp on the ingredients. The best part would probably be the homemade Italian sausage.

Definitely worth checking out Amici's for sharing with family and friends. If you're craving for pasta, pizza, chicken wings -- they have it all!So easy to order using their website and choose the Oakland location to place your order for pick up!What we got:- BBQ Chicken Pizza- New Haven White Clam Pizza- Linguine with Pesto- Flame Roasted Lemon Chicken Wings

Are you team unique pizza toppings or traditional pizza toppings? Luckily Amici's has both! My first time seeing a white clam pizza outside of Connecticut so I knew I had to try. Thank you for the seamless pick up and gracious staff at the new cloud kitchen location!I got:• New Haven White Clam - clams, garlic, seasonings, olive oil, bacon• One Step Beyond - mozzarella, housemade Beyond Meat sausage, roasted red bell peppers, red onions, wild baby arugula• Kale & Quinoa Salad• Garlic Bread

I called to ask about ingredients before ordering. The person I spoke to actually called me back to correct the info they gave me! The food is good, nothing exceptional but good enough. The customer service is absolutely outstanding! Give that employee a raise! Will definitely order again just because of this attention to detail!Dietary restrictions: See review.

Had east coast white clam pizza. I requested crispy crust that’s well blistered and burnt in places. Came exactly as I requested. Unfortunately, dough was way over salted!! I am a huge fan of the other Amici's locations, but this was my first time trying this specific one and it was so delicious! It was a breeze to order my food and pick it up!I ordered the kale and sausage pizza, an absolute FAVORITE of mine. I love how thin and crunchy the crust was. I also tried a new one - the impossible meat pizza and WOW I couldn't even tell it wasn't meat!

My new favorite pizza joint in the East Bay!  I can’t believe it’s taken me this long to discover Amici’s. I lived in New Haven, CT, back in the ‘90s, and Amici’s rivals the revered East Coast pizza parlors. So glad you guys are here in Oakland, CA.  THE BEST!

Great cafe/restaurant with some good vegetarian options. They make a great latte too!Very welcoming, with a lovely relaxed atmosphere.I really enjoyed my vegetarian pizza, and would definitely return here again.Highly recommended.

The soup had a slightly thick texture, which made it very satisfying and comforting.The pie with mixed cheese was equally delicious. The crust was flaky and golden-brown, and the filling was loaded with a variety of cheeses that melted together beautifully. Each bite was bursting with cheesy goodness and the overall combination of flavors was outstanding.The service at this restaurant was also fantastic. The staff were friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, making for a pleasant dining experience.Overall, I highly recommend trying the lentil soup and pie with mixed cheese at this restaurant. It's clear that the chef takes great care in selecting high-quality ingredients and preparing each dish with precision and care. This is definitely a restaurant worth visiting!The noise level was high, making it difficult to hold a conversation without raising your voice.

We went here for lunch and dinner on two separate days and the food was great! We had the fukharat vegetable (served at least 2 in size), manaqeesh with cheese and thyme, fattoush salad (also massive portion) and kofta with tahini. All were really delicious! Service was a little bit average and it was mostly quiet when we went both times. All over a good place to eat in Madaba, and well priced!

The best bar in Haasrode area. If you are working in an industrial area of Leuven you should know this bar. Good menu, always fresh food and good prices. The staff is very friendly and always helpful. You can order by email or phone and pick it up or they will deliver food to you (if you order in the morning). Also they have meeting room and can organize special events for you. 100% Recommend.

Helas geen foto kunnen maken maar...Fajitas was mega lekker, en meer dan genoeg !Heel vriendelijk menssen en we hebben niet lang moeten wachten, altans was het druk.Zeker gaan ! En wij komen zeker terug.Bedankt.

Afgelopen zondag hebben we broodjes van Bar Tartine geserveerd op onze babyborrel. En het was een absolute topper!  Vanaf het eerste contact tot aan de levering verliep alles soepel en professioneel.De broodjes zelf waren vers en rijkelijk belegd. De gasten hadden volop keuze: van klassieke belegde broodjes tot wat meer bijzondere varianten zoals wraps en sandwiches. Ook waren er heerlijke vegetarische opties. Er was echt aandacht besteed aan de versheid van de ingrediënten en de presentatie.De broodjes werden op tijd geleverd, mooi gepresenteerd in handige mandjes en voorzien van duidelijke beschrijvingen, wat het voor de gasten makkelijk maakte om te kiezen.Bar Tartine is zeker een aanrader voor iedereen die een feestje organiseert en op zoek is naar heerlijke, kwalitatieve broodjes!

Cozy restaurant in the Haasrode industrial estate. Delicious dishes, also takeaway possible. Very friendly and fast, correct service. I like to visit here. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
Nice, attractive restaurant in the Haasrode industrial estate. Tasty sandwiches, fresh salads,...Smooth service, very friendly staff. Parking in front of the door.Highly recommended!
Very tasty sandwiches and salad.Very friendly people and a very neat place.A nice detail is the candy with the sandwich!

Almost missed this place, I had to drive by a couple of times.I went here with about eight friends for a birthday dinner and was shocked on many levels. The food was diverse and incredible.So many different flavors and the quality was off the charts. My friends who had been there a couple of times did all the ordering so I really have no specific recommendation on dishes. However every single one of the dishes we ordered was excellent.The portions or slightly small but perfect for the group.The servers and service can only be described as five star excellence. They took the time to explain the dishes, how they paired with our drinks and in what order we should order them going from Sweet to savory too spicy.Mixologist  or bartenders or on point with creative and delicious drinks.This is not a quick in and quick out cost-effective option for dinner. This is fine dining with an international flair and expect to pay for that.I can’t afford to go to restaurants like this every week but it’s definitely my spot for the special occasion in San Francisco.

August 1 Five was a phenomenal experience. A bit overpriced for the portion size but this is great place to spoil yourself or enjoy dinner for a special occasion. My personal favorite was the lamb chops. And the toffee cake was so so amazing. May come back just for that!

August 1 Five, like it's name which represents India's Independence Day August 15, attempts to provide freedom to the Indian food from its traditional recipe, taste and presentation. The place feels upscale and modern with subtle hints of tradition and royalty. The cocktails are carefully crafted to compliment the food really well. The food itself is innovative, tasty, flavorful and presented with lot of art. All this doesn't come cheap though and you would end up spending about $75 per person or more. Overall, it's a great place for you to visit on special occasions!
Fun cocktails, fusion of Indian and Californian cuisine (that's how it was explained to us), yummy desserts. Very attentive service. Multiple gluten free choices. Will visit again!

My first experience of Indian fusion--at least that's how my good friend described our experience. Delicious starters. Cocktails were aesthetically pleasing and yummy. The main was especially filling and made for hefty leftovers. Service was exceptional!

Might be one of the best Indian meals I've had in a restaurant - the food was amazing and the service was greatFor our appetizers course, we ordered shammi kababs, chicken kababs, dahi kababs, and paneer kababs. All were amazing except the chicken which was just ok. I'd strongly recommend trying all the rest.For our main course, we had the lamb chops and the biryani. The lamb chops were hands down the best I've had in my life, having been to many places in India as well. The biryani was also spectacular.In terms of dessert, the toffee pudding was astounding, and the tapioca kheer was just ok.Drinks wise, the Tata Sour was a great cocktail and the mango lassie was really good.Keep in mind that this meal was for 4 of us, and we felt pretty full after this. The appetizers are really small, and you should make tapas style assumptions about the portions.

The ambiance and service was good, food can be hit or miss depending on what you order. Lot of vegetarian options. Expect to pay higher than usual for this upscale ambiance, and get your fancy clothes out as people are usually dressed up. 3.5 stars overall!I'd booked a table in advance for a Wednesday evening, and to my surprise the place did get crowded so highly recommend a reservation. Slightly disappointing since I'd asked for a special table / booth for a friend's birthday celebration, but the host didn't accommodate for that.[Food] Tried the paneer kebab in appetizers which was great. Paneer was soft and extremely flavourful. For mains, we went with the server recommendation of spinach paneer which seems to be their popular veg dish, but I found it to be average. Definitely go for the bread basket, for only $10 you have three choices of bread (plain naan, cheese tomato naan and one more), which is served with chutneys (Indian sauces).[Drinks] Lot of cocktail selections on the menu and I'd love to go back to try more of these. The Patiala Peg was a nice strong bourbon drink and most cocktails seemed to have an Indian twist.

Overall good place, I wouldn’t say it was the best.Food:Gol Gappa: This was really good! Must try.Chicken Tandoori: Chicken was tender but was really warm. Lacked flavor a little.Tandoori Prawns: These were king size prawns and taste was really good.Bison Keema: My favorite dish of the night was keema. It was served with 4 buns.Palak Paneer: This was not good, there was no panner, it was more like indian veggie lasagna, too bland.Fish: Fish was really good, sauce was in the form of foam and tasted amazing.Drinks:Mango Lassi: I would probably come here again for mango lassi. It was the best I’ve had in bay area.Love Potion: Decent drink, it has golden fizz! Fancy !Desserts:Malai Kulfi: Complete flop, there was no taste of malai and cinnamon flavor was very dominant.Gajar Halwa: Complete flop. There was no taste of gajar halwa and was very very sweet. It was topped with whipped cream instead vanilla ice cream would have been good.Altogether, this was decent place, service was quick. Booking recommended.

Indian fusion food.  They are fairly well executed western food with Indian tastes.  Even the mocktail I had, tasted like I am drinking curry.  I personally would prefer to eat more traditional Indian food.

Brunch here is damn good. They serve Indian food with an interesting take. The Pani for Pani Puri is served in little carafes. Highly recommend the lotus and taro root salad, not something you find often on the menu in Indian restaurants. They have added little touches to Indian food which sets it apart from usual Indian food. Like the fried onion on top of the  aloo kut or green pea stuffing in the Puri. There's limited things to order from, the portions are small and kinda pricey. But it's worth the price.

I stopped here for a desperate bite to eat on NYE after a nearby wine tasting at Buena Vista.  There weren't many food options in the area.  The owner  was cooking on the grill and he was not having a good day...at all. He seemed to pass the blame on the two kind neighbors/friends that came to rescue him and help him run the diner. The place was full of hungry people and food options were low. I'm not sure what happened prior to us arriving but we should have left. This diner is known for smoked meats and rubs. I didn't realize until later that it was showcases on Guy Fieri Food Network show. I'm not trying to slam the place ...It smelled delicious but the food lacked salt. We both ended up having the smoked chicken. The portion was enough for two but the flavor was lacking. We dis buy a delicious peanut butter chocolate brownie. It was amazing. We bought two. Matt the owner apologized for the fiasco and offered at 20% coupon for our next visit. I'm from LA and probably won't be back anytime soon. Best of luck to ya Matt. Great job to Bob and the cute young waitress for helping you out. They kept a positive attitude in spite of the calamity.

Just an OK BBQ joint hidden away off the highway. Our brunch spot had an hour wait so we went here instead which was no wait. Only one cook and one waitress which was a bit slow for the holiday. The lunch menu is mainly sandwiches and BBQ around $15-20 per plate. The 10 hour pulled pork sandwich was decent. Our friends liked the brisket. The water tasted terrible, I think it's stored in a metal container. I couldn't drink it. Overall a decent experience but wouldn't recommend or go back. If you have time, go to Gott's or the Sonoma square instead!

Don’t miss out on this place!!  I really respect small restaurants that keep their menu small and focus on quality. Just the right amount of smoke and spice. The owner is fun and entertaining!  The coleslaw is awesome!

We loved the local beer on tap, friendly and knowledgeable staff, the food was awesome- cleaned our plates. I thought the homemade potato salad was the best as a side! Eating alongside local farmers was a kick to listen to while we ate 😄

If you are into DDD like I am it's a must do. The owner is great. Smoker out of Ennis, TX and education from Taylor, TX. This gentleman knows his BBQ. Slaw with a horse radish edge and great tri tip sandwich. Onion rings done to perfection.

We just stumbled upon this establishment our first night in Sonoma. The food was good, we had the smoked ribs and they were fall off the bone great! The staff was very friendly and service was awesome. Definitely a spot I would visit the next time we are in Sonoma.
Yummy food grilled cheese w/ 12 hour pulled pork is bomb!! 😁

We stopped by happenstance... so thankful we did! What a wonderful place for lunch. Good service, friendly and reasonable. We sat outside. I had the grilled cheese with tomatoes and pesto... outstanding! Hubby had the pulled pork grilled cheese... also outstanding! The slaw was homemade and amazing! Highly recommended from these two Hoosiers!

Amazing food and the owner was very friendly. I ordered the bbq pulled pork grilled cheese and it was so tender, juicy, and delicious I wish I had another in front of me right now. He is located near all the good wineries so it is a perfect place to go before or after tasting wines. The next time we come back we will definitely be eating at Schellville!

The fries were really great and all of our entrees were flavorful and well prepared. Dining area is a bit shabby-chic for my taste, but comfortable and clean. Staff was a bit scattered but adequate service.
Food is resonably price.. goid size portions, (BUTTER CHICKEN COULD HAVE BEEN LARGER) packaged well and delivered promptly. The duck was so crispy. I will use again...

Been going here for many many years! Great place for chaat, very deep menu of chaats as well as entrees. Entrees are a good selection of daals, paneer, etc. The rotis and parathas are good too but note they don't have naans. The service is decent, reasonably attentive staff. Place serves ONLY VEGETARIAN food so don't go there expecting otherwise. One of the best chaat places in Mountain view, Los Altos and Cupertino areas; possibly top 5-6 chaat in the Bay Area.

YOU NEED THIS FOOD! Not only was every dish perfect, but they kindly included extra pickles and sauces in our order. The service was so friendly at the restaurant, and the smell was amazing. My sister just moved to the area and I can’t wait to visit her to keep coming to this restaurant.

Ok food for the price. I typically go for chicken teriyaki because it's around $10 to get meat, boiled veggies, and rice.I wouldn't really recommend anything else because the food quality isn't that good for the other stuff. Though it's not bad - my first order was a beef bento and I'll never order that again!You can ask for more veggies vs rice. You can also ask for more sauce once you get your order. It's the same sauce for everything.They cook all the meat on one side of the grill and the rest of the food on another grill. The sushi is made in the kitchen/behind the cashier.Depending on when you get your food, you may need to wait a while (~20 mins) until they cook a batch of chicken - even though you may spot some cooked chicken on standby to be placed on a tray.The waiting line is like an assembly line - you order & pay and roughly follow your tray on the bar holder above the grill. They may or may not call your order # so I think it's better to roughly guess which tray is yours and follow it.

All orders are pick only. Im very happy to have found this spot. Finding authentic food in the north bay is so hard. I've lived in Tiburon for 2 years now and it's been difficult to find quality, authentic ethnic food. It's tasty and super fast service. I ordered the Sweet & Spicy garlic chicken, green bean beef and garlic noodle. The noodles were pretty bland but the other dishes had a bit of sauce so I drizzled it over the noodles and all the flavors balanced out. The chicken was piping hot (which I love) there was lots of flavor and big chunky pieces of chicken. The green beans still had a nice crunch --soggy veggies are the worst.

The lady is friendly but impatient sometimes only because she needs some help. I think the cook does too, especially with the noodle dishes. I eat here often to avoid going all the way to San Rafael. The sweet & spicy chicken wings are excellent, the onion pancakes great, the crab Rangoon are very good, the chicken or beef chow fun are tasty when I think the chef is not overwhelmed with orders. They have fell flat on flavor twice. I also have had better calamari from here too. Overall, the food is good to me, the prices are reasonable and the service is okay. Shang Hai Kitchen is worth a try and I'm still going to be a customer. I appreciate their great food, service when very busy, their location & reasonable prices.💯😋

We’ve been going to this place since 2001. Many life events have been celebrated here, with friends and family. So we’ve seen this place in its ups and downs. Yet despite that, it ands its staff have always provided with best dishes. Price have understandably rose since then, but the servings and quality have been not a disappointment either. Highly recommended place compared to other Asian food establishments in the area.
Friendly people. The Chow Mein portions are big. Big enough for 2 people. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 … More
Good food. I love the MuShu Food : 4/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 … More
Thank you for being open when you say you're going to be open. Unlike willow garden in rodeo.
A little pricey but fresh meats you can taste abide others around
Great food, efficient take out. They now have online ordering, but one still needs to pay when picking up the food. Portions are huge. Food : 5/5 … More

When I’m missing my friends in Lithuania this makes me feel as close as I can be there. Beer is some of the best and the food is just like being there. Staff is friendly and food is quick. If you want some filling good tasting food you must try.

Came here when visiting SF last week. Yum! The waitress was very sweet. We ordered as much as we could since originally I’m from Lithuania and my boyfriend is Italian so he wanted to try all the goodies too. Everything was great except for garlic bread because it was soggy and wasn’t fresh( it’s supposed to be hot and crisp). And then KIBINAI was really weird. Not my taste. But hot beet soup was great, chicken cutlet was great, CePelinai was great and dumplings were great. Šviturys beer was good on tap!🍻🍲🥘💪🏼🇱🇹🇱🇹🇱🇹

Oh man! I always love exploring ethnic restaurants where the flavors are unique, especially when they are as rare as this place, apparently the only one on the West Coast! Even the host was very sweet and pleasant (and actually speaks Lithuanian!), giving good recommendations on what to get! The flavors were homey and you can definitely tell they made everything with love! Definitely try the beer here with your food. The patio in the back was a nice experience, so you don’t have to do only takeout!

I've never had Lithuanian food before, and seeing this restaurant on Gmaps peaked my curiosity. I am extremely glad I followed my interest into Mama Papa. The food is delicious, humble, and deeply satisfying.  I ordered more things than one meal required because I was so interested. I wasn't disappointed, each dish was incredibly tasty. I took my leftovers home and am enjoying them now as I write this review. I couldn't recommend this place any more highly.  The chilled summer borscht particularly hits the spot for me. It makes gazpacho (which I like) seem weak and pathetic. My Mom ordered a Lithuanian beer and said it was delicious, she liked it enough to make note of the brand so she could acquire more. My only problem or issue was the chairs, they're heavy and over built and I kept banging my legs into them. Could be a tall person issue. The staff was really friendly and welcoming.  They answered all my dumb questions about the food and the country and seemed pleased to do so. Really, everything about this place was great. I don't live in Alameda, but I'll still be coming back. It's worth the drive for food, service, and atmosphere as fantastic as Mama Papa has. 11/10

Excellent service and food. Feels like eating at home. Everything freshly looked in a cozy ambience. Service was also fabulous. The food took a a little while to come but the taste was so authentic; the wait was worth it. Good selection of beers, appetizers and desserts.

I have been coming back to this place for the past five years. Everyone I have brought here has always enjoyed the comforting and homie but exotic food.Even better that food and services is improving with every visit. Will be back more frequently!

Great food and great service! I came here for lunch and enjoyed everything we ordered. The chicken goulash was awesome, and so were the potato pancakes. I definitely plan on coming back so I can try more of their dishes.

Amazing Alameda restaurant. We came for lunch and had the lunchtime offering which is the half portion entree for half price. The rye bread was perfect with the house draft beer. The stuffed cabbage rolls and potato pancakes were delicious and prepared to perfection.
Absolutely outstanding. My sister in law remembered a profile on this restaurant from PBS and tonight is the time we got to try it out. Loved the entire experience.
We loved this place.  The goulash was so flavorful.  I love it even more that they have an outdoor area so we could bring our dog.

I ordered takeout without realizing this was a ghost kitchen. They put the pizza on its side in a locker for pickup, which resulted in the toppings on half the pizza sliding off. For a $40 pizza, I expected better. Food : 3/5 | Service : 3/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 … More

This is Amici's NEW North Oakland Cloudkitchen! I love that more and more cloudkitchens are popping up because it makes it suuuper quick and easy to order for pick up or delivery. I placed my order online and it was all packed up and ready to go when I arrived!They have a variety of specialty pizzas including a CLAM AND BACON pizza which is honestly a fave of mine! We had to keep with the clam theme and also ordered their fettuccine with pesto and clam which came with breadsticks. A little squeeze of lemon (which they do include) makes it even better. We also had their flame roasted lemon chicken wings and if you dip it in ranch, it's perfect. Pizza and chicken wings are a superior combo in my opinion!

I ordered for pickup at this location. They had my order ready to go when I arrived. Parking was fairly easy nearby as well.The menu is pretty large. There’s pizza, pasta, sandwiches, soup, wings, desserts, and more, so you can easily order for your whole family.I got the Philly pizza and Amici’s Combo pizza, the bbq chicken wings, and fettuccine with pesto and clams.My favorites are the Amici’s Combo pizza and the fettuccine pesto with clams. The pizza was tasty and I liked that they don’t skimp on the ingredients. The best part would probably be the homemade Italian sausage.

Definitely worth checking out Amici's for sharing with family and friends. If you're craving for pasta, pizza, chicken wings -- they have it all!So easy to order using their website and choose the Oakland location to place your order for pick up!What we got:- BBQ Chicken Pizza- New Haven White Clam Pizza- Linguine with Pesto- Flame Roasted Lemon Chicken Wings

Are you team unique pizza toppings or traditional pizza toppings? Luckily Amici's has both! My first time seeing a white clam pizza outside of Connecticut so I knew I had to try. Thank you for the seamless pick up and gracious staff at the new cloud kitchen location!I got:• New Haven White Clam - clams, garlic, seasonings, olive oil, bacon• One Step Beyond - mozzarella, housemade Beyond Meat sausage, roasted red bell peppers, red onions, wild baby arugula• Kale & Quinoa Salad• Garlic Bread

I called to ask about ingredients before ordering. The person I spoke to actually called me back to correct the info they gave me! The food is good, nothing exceptional but good enough. The customer service is absolutely outstanding! Give that employee a raise! Will definitely order again just because of this attention to detail!Dietary restrictions: See review.

Had east coast white clam pizza. I requested crispy crust that’s well blistered and burnt in places. Came exactly as I requested. Unfortunately, dough was way over salted!! I won’t order again, unless they offer a much less salty crust! Food : 3/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Pizza … More

I am a huge fan of the other Amici's locations, but this was my first time trying this specific one and it was so delicious! It was a breeze to order my food and pick it up!I ordered the kale and sausage pizza, an absolute FAVORITE of mine. I love how thin and crunchy the crust was. I also tried a new one - the impossible meat pizza and WOW I couldn't even tell it wasn't meat!

My new favorite pizza joint in the East Bay!  I can’t believe it’s taken me this long to discover Amici’s. I lived in New Haven, CT, back in the ‘90s, and Amici’s rivals the revered East Coast pizza parlors. So glad you guys are here in Oakland, CA.  THE BEST!
Good food with fair prices.Easy to stop from 238 and lots of parking in the back.Will return to try more dishes.

4/18/24 ThursdayAaloo ka paratha, veg biryani,  malai kofta, white rice, lamb biryani only 5pcs rest green peas n yellow rice, goat curry only small 7 pcs. All taste alright n portion of food was good except pieces of lamb n goat which is too bad.Will try more menu items next visit.

I was there for the dinner buffet. They had different types of biryani rice, some chicken curries, some vegetable ones, and tandoori chicken, which was probably the best thing I tried. I had a preference for the butter chicken cause the sauce went with the Naan bread. I was hoping and waiting for a while for them to bring out a fresh batch of tandoori chicken, but I wasn't going to stay that long. The food itself wasn't boldly spiced, like I usually expect. However, to get that, I imagine you have to order something from the regular menu. A little on the expensive side, but then again, this is California.

Came here for the Friday night buffet. Food quality for a buffet wasn't bad although price was a bit high in my opinion. I'd probably try regular entrees next time instead of the buffet.The inside of the restaurant is very modern and clean. They've done a nice job to make it look nice.Service was also excellent. Recommended.

Yes! We have been coming here for more than 10 years now. I found this place when I was going to school at Cal State Hayward, aka Cal State East Bay!Prior to the pandemic, we always come here for their awesome lunch buffet, which they dont have anymore.. except Friday/Saturday dinner buffet (I think).Generous portions,delicious food and friendly service is all I need.
Restaurant offers a variety of classic Indian dishes and a lunch buffet on weekdays. Has a simple and inviting setting.

Wonderful restaurant, good food, nicely cooked, served with kind and welcome greets from staff. What I like the most in this restaurant is the buffet on weekends. Absolutely perfect for families. Good spicy and tasty food. Main plates, salad, desert are served well here. Good competitive prices! I would definitely recommend this restaurant for families and friends or any group who want to eat good food and have fun gathering together.

I recently visited Red Bear Brewing Co. and was blown away by their delicious chicken fingers and tasty craft beer selection. The chicken fingers were crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and perfectly seasoned. They paired wonderfully with the craft beer I tried—each sip was a burst of flavor.The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, making it a great spot to relax with friends or enjoy a casual night out. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring a great experience. I'll definitely be back!

A good place for large parties with recommendable ciders and bites!I came with a party of 8, easily found seating, and got served pretty quickly! One of the bartenders seemed a bit hard to approach but all of us we were able to put our orders in without a problem.The food arrived quickly and the wings were tasty (especially Thai chili) but a bit chewy and cheese curds were crispy and had great sauce, but there were so many flies around us that kept approaching our food that made it hard for us to eat our food without swatting our hands around.I loved how open the atmosphere felt 🏳️‍🌈 and I’d love to come back to see what drag bingo is like!

Great food and beer selections.  The food was actually really delicious.  I had the salad and added chicken.  My husband hada burger and fries. My bous had the jumbo wings. Everything was great and fresh.  They don't do table service.  You order at the bar and pick up at the counter when your beeper goes off. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

This was my first time coming to Red Bear and it was for a Drag Brunch. The event was so much fun, well planned and had a great atmosphere! I don't drink so I was surprised to not see many non alcoholic options besides juice/soda. I ordered their French toast on their limited menu for the event, the food was good enough where I'd come back to grab a bite. They also host many different events, trivia, drag shows, etc. that's worth checking out! Overall I had a good experience and would love to come back!

Saw a recommendation in the nudge that this place had yummy hot chocolate (optional to get it spiked) so came for a date night! It’s so much bigger inside than I expected. I’ve been by here so many times. So glad we came! My only complaint is that is was SO loud (on a Tuesday night) from bingo in the back room that it was difficult to carry a conversation, however the overall vibe of this place is amazing! Love seeing queer bars in the city. Oh, and the hot chocolate was delicious!

Great food, decent beer and average service. Let’s start with the good. Food was amazing! Above par when it comes to bar food. Some of the biggest wings and chicken strips I’ve ever seen. I’m not a big fan of chicken strips. They are usually too dry and don’t have the best crunch, but these were different. Like eating really good fried chicken without the bones. Great flavors too. Wing sauces are a bit confusing and really not a lot of help based on their on line ordering. Some of the crew would stop by and ask if we needed anything, but others really didn’t do much or were down right rude. The beers were ok. Good enough to wash down the food, but none really stood out enough to recall. Definitely a place to try for the food and maybe the beer rotation will get better

Very close to a metro stop and filled with thoughtful design, delicious drinks, and a curated board game selection. Only had beer and cocktails but was very happy with the entire experience. If I lived closer I would be here all the time meeting people, playing board games, and drinking from the big drink selection. So many small cool touches in how they decorated and designed the space!

The food was awful! OMG, we ate here back in May of this year - the food was amazing then, so we honestly couldn't wait to go back, but this time the food was so bad! I ordered the loaded potato skins, which were covered in some green hot sauce (not listed on the menu), so they were soggy. The fried pickles were amazing, and that is why they got 2 stars, but then someone ordered the cake pops, which tastes like soapy water. It was a shame because we honestly loved this place. The drag queen bingo was a hoot so go have fun with this.

Went to Red Bear Brewing for dinner and drinks last night. They've created a great outdoor space with fire pit tables, and heat lamps. Started out with a flight of their beers, and some appetizers. Loved it! They have a new ordering system so you can put in what you want, add your table number, and your items will quickly come out, very efficient!!We got the cheese curds (amazing), the compliance pizza bagels (those were promptly devoured), wings (special price on Wednesdays, so much flavor), and for our mains, a German sausage and burger with waffle fries.It was an excellent experience! The staff was very friendly, accommodating, and professional. Went inside to use the restroom, and loved the decor! They've put a lot of thought into the small details and it shows!I will definitely return next time I visit DC!
We absolutely loved this place. Super friendly and felt very inclusive, the staff were great.Bar snacks were really good (fried pickles and sliders), and the beers were pretty good.
The service was great, the Mac n cheese had no flavor. The shrimp scampi was okay I have had better.  I think next time I will get a pizza.Dietary restrictions: Gluten and vegetarian options

one of the best Skipolini's pizzas I've ever had.   "All meat" is just a masterpiece.  vlVery rich meat flavor and crispy crust.  Caesar salad was a good addition (you can choose your preferred sauce).  We grabbedb our order to go, as the restaurant was full.  (many tables were reserved, too).  Despite this, the atmosphere inside and outside is really nice

Didn't know what to expect from this place.  Wife and I almost walked out after being there only 5 minutes.  Our server was great! She fixed me an Old Fashioned. She recommended the Cajun pasta, which is a terrific dish by the way and the combination pizza.  Not the best pizza I've ever had but, it is definitely one of the best in the area.  Overall, a very good dining experience.  We'll definitely come back soon!!

Mackenzie was our waitress today for our first time eating here. The friendly service made the food and experience that much better! She was attentive and offered recommendations as well as got us a soda refill to go without us even asking. She really went above and beyond. The food was excellent, one of the best BBQ chicken salads I've ever had. The garlic fries were spectacular and you can't beat a $6 dollar monster slice of pizza during the lunch hour menu. Will definitely be back and tell our friends and family.

We had great service at the bar from our bartender Courtney. We also had a pizza and the pizzas here are great! They are a bit different than others around which I like, good to switch it up. Over all I had a 5 star experience. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 … More

Held a 11 year olds B-Day party there, staff was amazing. Book for 15 but about 25 people showed up. The staff didn't blink, added additional tables as unexpected guest arrived. The patio seating was perfect and the play area kept the kids busy and the ice cream bar was another hit. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Customer service was great the pizza I had was good too. A little pricey but it was worth it. The prego pizza was bomb loaded with 5 different types of meats and mushrooms and all that good stuff. I also had the garlic bread I loved them cause they were in the shape of a little pizza. Atmosphere was  dark and comfortable. And I loved the way the guy came out with my pizza. I will be coming back.

One of the best dim sum places I ever had. You can find innovative flavors beyond the traditional standard dim sums. The 肠粉 is the best of the best. The roasted duck very worth the price and delicious. Everything we had was very good and delicately made. The portions were decent. The service was just okay because it is always busy. Make sure you go early or make reservation by app. We had to wait for 40 min on Saturday noon.

I had never been to Koi Palace before and was really impressed with the design and decor of this very large restaurant. I wish I could tell you what I ate but we came in a group and thankfully everything was picked out for us. We ate shrimp, lobster, pork, taro and heaven knows what else but it was all good! It wasn't the absolute best Dim sum I've ever had in my life but it was very good and the entire sum of all things (excuse the pun) adds up to a great place to go, especially with groups.

Around noon on the weekend is a busy time for Dimsum at this restaurant.   Wait time is around 20 min.   Lot more parking spaces are available at the side lot.   Expect to pay an average $50/pp for 10 different dishes.     Would not recommend Xiaolongbao as they were not juicy as expected.   All other dishes were tasty.Wheelchair accessibility: Elevator and Escalator are available

Came for dim sum on a Sunday around 11am. Was seated quickly, but when we left around 12 was very crowded. The best dim sum we have had in the Bay Area! Soup dumpling assortment was great. Highly recommend. Fast and efficient service. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

Koi is our go to Chinese seafood restaurant for large group gatherings.  We have made friends with the manager over the years and most of the dishes we had were special ordered.  It was full house the night we went and there were a few large bday parties so it was a little loud, but as expected in a Chinese restaurant. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

We came here for dim sum, and everything was delicious. The service was extremely quick and attentive. We did have to wait to get a table despite already having made a reservation, but the wait was much shorter compared to if we hadn’t made a reservation at all. This dim sum place is one of the best we’ve found in the states, and we definitely will be back when we’re back in the Bay Area!

Made reservations for lunch and was seated right away.  There was a very small line around noon on Sunday.   The food was delicious.  All on point and this is someone who is Chinese and have lived in Hong Kong.  Prob one of the most authentic dim sum places in the bay. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
Really good dim sum! Can’t go wrong 😍The 🌈 xlbs kinda all tasted the same though.. but not complaining cause it taste great 😍 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

For a table for two that spent 80 bucks, it is disappointing no table cloth and the table is stained and aged. Cutting cost on linen is a bad move. Everything was very tasty, delicious and fresh. New lights and plant decor added value to the place. Clean restrooms.  Our server Lorna was outstanding, friendly, and funny. All the staff seem happy working here. Very positive energy when we came.  Mgr. Dennis is as pleasant and as accommodating as always..  BIGGER glass for halo halo, please. It's always a wonderful dining experience here for us. I highly recommend this place. Comfort food. Keep up the great job!

We had a best time in Gerry’s! Claudia, our server, was very attentive and friendly. They have a lunch special going from 12noon to 3pm and we got the sisig. We also got the beef salpicao. Everything was delicious! Their manager, Liz, was also very nice and accommodating. We’ll definitely come back! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

I recently dined at Gerry's Grill in Chinatown, and it's undoubtedly one of the best Filipino restaurants in town. The restaraunt  is spacious, with separate sections for private parties and the main hall, providing ample seating.The restaurant boasts a variety of authentic Filipino dishes, including the sizzling pork sisig, my personal favorite. a silky and milky traditional Filipino tea, and stir fried rice noodle dish. One other highlight for me was their delicious fried eggroll; it was so good that we couldn't resist but to order extra one. The stir-fry noodle was so  impressive and it's the first dish that we finished.Gerry's Grill caters to all ages, offering a diverse menu for both children and adults. The full bar adds to the overall experience. What sets this Filipino restaurant apart is that you can experience the best of Filipino cuisine with great ambiance  without leaving Houston.Additionally, the weekend nights come alive with a live band, we all enjoyed the popular songs they performed and the lovely  atmosphere they created. It's a fantastic place for a great night out, filled with excellent food, lively music, and an inviting ambiance. Service was excellent also.

We enjoyed delicious karkare, chicken adobo, lomi noodles, shanghai spring rolls, and pork barbecue skewers! The strawberry milk ice treat, and mango smoothie were amazing desserts. Great, fancy restaurant! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

This is a nice Filipino restaurant. They have a variety of traditional Filipino dishes. It is more fun if you come on an evening where they have live music. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

The service was awesome. Place was good and clean, the food could've been 5 stars except for the pork bbq skewers, meat was kinda tough... if it was kinda tender like their inihaw belly, it would've been 5stars all the way.Parking: Parking was convenient and free!!!

We had three great dishes between the two of us for dinner. Lorna was an excellent waitress and recommended her favorite Pancit (Palaboc). We visited on Saturday evening and they had a live, local band. Great atmosphere. Recommend! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Parking space

Liz was our waitress and she is awesome! Gerry's grill is a great restaurant. Look for Liz next time you visit the place. Food is incredible just like the service. 👍🏾 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
