We always have a great time whenever we visit and eat at Gerry's grill. We noticed the beautiful decor and added plants in their chandeliers that made the place look more classy.. we like the new tables and set up more. The restrooms are also clean. Food is always appetizing,  delicious and fresh. We loved the Crispy Pata very crunchy and seasoned well, meat was really tender. But the sauce was kinda too sweet for us. We like more vinegar with it. We enjoyed the grilled pork with fresh tuna. It was our favorite. The sauce paired well with our crispy pork knuckles and pancit canton. We also had a bangus sisig carry out but its not as yummy as i expected, it was just ok. Might need a little improvement to taste better. Lastly, the superstars of desserts, of course, the shaved iced that's super creamy in halo halo and iced gulaman to beat the summer heat. That super tasty pinipig crunch and ube ice cream was heavenly.. I just wished they put halo halo in a bigger, taller glass like the gulaman. It felt too crammed in a regular drinking glass. But it's still very yummy. Pricing was just right. Our server Lorna was accomodating,  friendly and funny, attentive and courteous.  She even offered us info about the latest happenings, shows and events which is awesome. The Manager, Mr.Dennis was also extraordinary as always. Making guests feel welcome and at home. It's like having a get together at your family's place for Sunday feels. It was definitely a good place to go to for comfort food. I Highly recommend this place. We will surely come back.  Great place for parties and events too.Parking: Large parking space in front of the restaurant

Gerry’s Grill was a pleasant surprise for us! It is a Filipino restaurant we did not realize as we came in. It’s in Asia town. But wow so much good food!!! 😋😋😋 we had garlic adobo shreds, crispy pata (deep fried pork knuckles), grilled squid, bangoong rice, and mixed veggies chopsuey. It was all great and there was this garnish made from pickled papaya and carrot that was great! My sister and kept asking for more 😂 Then to top it off they had a band playing at about 8:30pm  which we got to listen to as we let the food settle.Lastly, JJ our waiter was fantastic! Patient and friendly! We loved him!
Its delicious I came on a Monday for Happy hour I ordered...Shrimp Tempura, Salmon Nigiri, Baked Mussels and Salmon Tataki Sahimi soo fresh!!Nice people work here!

I came here with my family on Mother’s Day, it was a last minute decision but our party of 8 was seated quickly, and they even accommodated our preference for outdoor seating. Our sever, Cherish, made the experience worth it, she was fun and energetic even though we could see her managing a lot of tables. She took her time explaining the menu and recommended the chicken teriyaki and California roll, the choice was great. The food came out quickly and my entire family enjoyed our experience. Definitely coming again!

The interior was a bit dark, we couldn't read menus, but the sashimi were good. Food : 5/5 | Service : 3/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 Recommended dishes

Very good service. They come and help you at all times. The food was okay. The best thing was the Saba shioyaki for the bento box lunch. The Arnold Palmer I got was a unique flavor. The California roll didn’t have any taste so I added soy sauce and ginger. Overall, a relaxing place off the main strip of downtown Burlingame.I used to live in Japan so my standards are higher as well.

Pros: Good prices, delicious food, lots of parking nearby, fast serviceCons: not enough outdoor seating :)Love sushi and miso soup? This is the place. They are conveniently located right by Burlingame Ave so you can stop by real quick and then carry on exploring what Burlingame Ave has to offer. My favorite is the veggie Gyoza (something I haven't seen at other Japanese restaurants yet). Maybe I have to keep exploring and I'll find it. My wife had the chicken katsu bento box and she loved it. The salad has a dressing I've never had before but it was not overpowering or plain. Just simple and tasty. The California roll has a lot of crab meat which I thought most people would like, I prefer a little less but it was still good. Service was excellent both times I visited in the past three weeks so I will come here again!

Pretty decent Japanese restaurant. I liked the sushis and gyoza there. The baked sushi was really good. The staff was not as active and the ambiance is also a bit too dark. Overall an okayish place but good enough Japanese food so 5 stars for the food for sure
We tried this Sushi spot in Burlingame. We had the 49er roll, Power of love, and Best of the Best, Spicy Country. A good spot spot for Sushi.

Came in for lunch, service was slow out the gate, but we came an hour before close.  Once we sat and got our food everything was fresh and delicious.  Staff was friendly too Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
My family and I had a great time!! Their lunch options are great, and Shiso Fresh Sushi is so so so delicious!!!
Great artist, one of the few with a formal art background. Small and cosy, but very clean. And the guy knows how to put you at your ease.
JUST THE BETTER INK STUDIO , HERE IN MILAN !!!! THANKS TO DAVIDE & LUKINO !!!

Ho fatto il mio primo tatuaggio e mi sono trovato benissimo come tra amici. E' stata un'esperienza significativa e condivisa. Mi è stato spiegato tutto passo per passo con molta attenzione all'igiene e alle procedure corrette. Abbiamo lavorato assieme anche alla ricerca dei simboli corretti e del loro significato.Luca è riuscito a interpretare e realizzare alla perfezione ciò di cui avevo bisogno, anche trovando nuove soluzioni rispetto all'idea iniziale.

Poco da dire, Luca è un giovane e talentuoso tatuatore, linee meravigliose, attento ai dettagli e a comprendere al volo le esigenze del cliente, uno dei 3 tattoo che mi ha fatto è stato disegnato da lui direttamente sul corpo, senza alcuna stampa, un artista.Attrezzature sempre nuove e fatte controllare al cliente prima della loro apertura, lo studio è "vecchio stile"🤟Grande Luca!!!

Mi sono trovata benissimo. Era la prima volta che mi facevo un tatuaggio e l’ambiente in cui mi sono trovata mi ha fatta subito stare a mio agio. Ho portato la mia idea che è stata pure migliorata e il tutto viene fatto nella più assoluta pulizia e sterilità, infatti il tatuatore (nel mio caso Luca) mi ha anche fatto vedere la data di scadenza di tutto ciò che utilizza. Molto probabilmente tornerò a farne altri, dato che quello che ho chiesto di farmi fare mi piace molto, sta guarendo bene e in generale sono davvero soddisfatta. Grazie!

Ho iniziato il mio apprendistato presso lo Zero 7 Linea Tattoo Studio circa un anno fa e sono estremamente contento dell'esperienza che ho potuto acquisire con loro. Lo staff è estremamente gentile e disponibile, creando un ambiente familiare che ti mette a tuo agio sin da subito. Durante questo anno di apprendistato, ho potuto migliorare le mie abilità tecniche e artistiche grazie al supporto di Luca e Davide, esperti nel settore. L'attenzione ai dettagli e la precisione con cui lavorano sono impressionanti. Consiglio vivamente lo studio a chiunque stia cercando un luogo professionale gestito da esperti che siano in grado di guidarti in tutte le fasi del tatuaggio, dalla progettazione del disegno all'esecuzione di quest'ultimo, fornendo consigli per la cura.

Studio molto professionale, Luca e Davide due professionisti nel campo del tattoo, danno sempre consigli sulle scelte dei lavori e si arriva sempre all'esecuzione perfetta del pezzo scelto.Ormai sono anni che vado da loro e non sono mai uscito dallo studio non soddisfatto anzi ogni volta esco sempre più contento per i loro consigli e modifiche del soggetto.

Luca is very nice and approachable, very scrupulous in detail and above all he is keen to make you participate and involve you in the process, as well as being available and really good. Very satisfied, I will definitely come back for the next tattoo! Services

This is Amici's NEW North Oakland Cloudkitchen! I love that more and more cloudkitchens are popping up because it makes it suuuper quick and easy to order for pick up or delivery. We had to keep with the clam theme and also ordered their fettuccine with pesto and clam which came with breadsticks. A little squeeze of lemon (which they do include) makes it even better. I ordered for pickup at this location. They had my order ready to go when I arrived. Parking was fairly easy nearby as well.The menu is pretty large. We went there for the Happy Hour.  Good choice for drinks and tacos.  We ended up ordering other items in the main menu.   The drinks are strong.   The oysters are awesome.  The chili shallot malonette has a strong kick but it’s awesome.   The fish tacos taste really good.   The popcorn chickens are one of the best.  Overall, a very satisfying culinary experience.

Tried this place to the curious similarities to another restaurant I love. The chips and salsa are fresh, flavorful while not being too spicy. The popcorn chicken was an experience; it was too sweet on its own while the mango habanero salsa was too spicy but when combined together the flavor fireworks start popping and it's amazing. The enchiladas were some of the best I've ever had being super moist, tender, and just delicious. The shrimp tacos are huge, crispy, and absolutely scrumptious. In speaking with the manager I was pleased to hear the my suspicions were correct; Bar César is related to César and lives up to the name.
Excellent service. Generous pitcher of sangria. Guac was a little salty. Tempura avocado and chicken tacos were 🔥.

Excellent carnitas tacos for lunch. My friend suggested meeting there for lunch, and it was well worth it. They weren't that busy, so it was the perfect place for conversation. The appetizer was a chunky, well-balanced guacamole served with what I think were homemade chips. Both were quite fresh and tasty. I ordered the carnitas tacos, and service was quick. The meat was beautifully flavored and incredibly tender, just melting in my mouth, served on street corn tortillas. This came with a side salad of fresh greens and tomatoes. Very tasty.

It's overpriced for what it is. Small tacos are 2x~12, and they are definitely not worth $6 per taco.I grew up in Mexico, eating real Mexican food, and I think the Enchiladas and flautas where good, tacos where meh, and guacamole was not good (it wasn't spoiled but it just wasn't appetizing).Drinks where good, and cost about $12 each.Dinner for 2 with a couple drinks each was about $100.

We were lucky. As the only patrons on a Thursday evening, we received the pick of the tables and doting service.We really enjoyed the Iranian food here. Having ordered exclusively vegetarian items everything was delightful.Recommend the following:dolmasMast-o-khiar (thick yogurt whipped w herbs & raisins)Sabzi - bread w/herbs, turkish feta & walnuts ( worked well with the khiar )Ghormeh-sabzi (vegan) which is apparently a 2000 year old dish…made fresh of course.Also, the pomegranate lemonade was fantastic! Will come back!

Nice place, especially the patio in front of the park. The service was awfully slow (although nice), but the food was rather good, especially the lamb, which was delicious, and the baklava, quite atypical (served hot, very fresh, homemade).

I feel this falls between 3.5-4 stars!We had been meaning to try out Bacheesos and so happy we finally had the chance today!Place is really big with ample indoor seating, bar area as well as few tables outside!Staff is super friendly and helpful - kudos! Place itself is nice but could be bit cleaner.Food was really good, wouldn't say spectacular but really good food for the portions and price. Can't beat $15 per head for buffet!We tried almost everything starting with their salad bar and then main course. Loved the tzatziki, dolma and cabbage salad. From the main course would give high scores to the chicken, lamb, rice and chickpeas though I believe their buffet changes every week. I wish they had better dessert choices though...Overall pretty good experience and great place to have in the neighbourhood when in the mood for buffet!

I enjoyed walking around the Marché Aux Fleurs on Cours Saleya in Nice. Lots of fresh produce and goods. Established in the 19th century, this vibrant flower market bursts with color and fragrance. The variety of flowers and local produce is impressive, though it can be very crowded. It's a must-visit for a true taste of Nice's charm.

Marché Aux Fleurs - Cours Saleya in Nice, France, is a vibrant and enchanting market that embodies the charm and lively spirit of the French Riviera. Nestled in the heart of the Old Town, this bustling market is a delightful destination that attracts both locals and visitors, making it a must-visit spot during your time in Nice.As you approach the market, the first thing that strikes you is the explosion of colors. The stalls are brimming with a stunning variety of fresh flowers, from radiant sunflowers and elegant tulips to exotic orchids and fragrant lavender. Each vendor showcases their blooms with care, creating a picturesque scene that feels like a painting come to life. The visual appeal alone is enough to make your visit worthwhile, as you can’t help but stop and admire the beauty on display.The atmosphere is lively and inviting, filled with the sounds of vendors engaging with customers, laughter, and the occasional strumming of a guitar from a nearby street performer. The market is not just a place to shop but a vibrant hub of activity where the local community comes together. You’ll often find families strolling through, couples selecting flowers, and groups of friends enjoying the ambiance.In addition to the breathtaking flowers, Marché Aux Fleurs offers a diverse array of fresh produce and local delicacies. Stalls overflowing with seasonal fruits and vegetables invite you to sample the best of the Mediterranean harvest. From juicy tomatoes and crisp cucumbers to succulent peaches and citrus fruits, the quality is exceptional, showcasing the region's agricultural bounty. Many vendors are more than happy to let you taste their wares, enhancing your shopping experience.One of the highlights of the market is the opportunity to indulge in local culinary delights. You’ll find artisanal products such as olive oils, tapenades, and a variety of cheeses that are perfect for a picnic or to take back to your accommodations. The scent of freshly baked bread and pastries wafts through the air, tempting you to stop by a nearby bakery for a treat. Don't miss the chance to try a slice of the famous Socca, a local chickpea pancake, from one of the food stalls, or grab a fresh produce basket to enjoy later by the beach.The market is also a fantastic place to connect with the local culture. Many of the vendors are passionate about their products and are eager to share stories about their origins and the best ways to enjoy them. Engaging with these friendly locals adds a personal touch to your experience and gives you a deeper appreciation for the region.Visiting Marché Aux Fleurs is not just about shopping; it’s an immersive experience that allows you to soak up the lively atmosphere and the essence of Nice. The market is open every day, but it’s particularly lively on Mondays, when it transforms into a flea market, offering an eclectic mix of antiques and vintage treasures.Overall, Marché Aux Fleurs - Cours Saleya is a charming and dynamic market that showcases the beauty and flavors of Nice. It's a sensory delight that offers a true taste of the local lifestyle, making it an essential stop on your Nice itinerary. Whether you’re looking for the perfect bouquet, fresh ingredients for a picnic, or simply a delightful place to wander and absorb the local culture, this market has something for everyone. A visit here is sure to leave you with lasting memories and perhaps even a bouquet of beautiful flowers to take home. Highly recommended!

In the old town of Nice "Vieille Ville", one block behind the Promenade des Anglais, is this beautiful market of flowers and fresh products, which is open every day except Monday and from 09.00 to 13.00. The popular market operating daily since 1816.The market sells fresh products, soaps, local delicacies such as socca pie (which is a thin chickpea crepe) made in the area and flowers from the Provence and Alpes-Maritimes countryside. Many sellers will tempt you with free samples, which is an effective way to buy. The flower stalls stay open most of the day, until 17:30.This particular market is a point of reference and of increased tourist interest. During peak hours it is full of people.

Its a big market with flowers,herbs,food and drinks. I bought a traditional nice food. The pizza with caramelised onions,an olive and anchovy. Tasted good. If you dont like anchovy there is the option without it also. 2.30 euro for a piece. Should try if in nice.

We came as part of ocean cruise which docked in Marseille. Visit was super especially due to the early Apr weather. We got to wander around the market and other parts of city. If in the area be sure to stop by to enjoy the market, buy stuff and see how the residents shop.

In the old town of  Nice . Monday antiques and bric a  brac , flowers  rest of the week and cafe/ restaurant at night. Don't miss the street food in the market. There's a pancake called Socca made out of chickpeas. It's fabulous

I did buy some plants    and Postcard and  Lion Wooden handcrafted..and love everything at 5he Market, welcome to Nice ,Je suis Thailand..l live in Phuket and have the Motobike for rent ,,,+66870977759...Mr.Ya Yah !!!!

This place is so lively. The flower vendors were very friendly locals. Variety was huge. But price was on the upper side. So many options of fruit, vegetable and souvenirs to shop for. Absolutely worth a visit. I had one of the best croissant here in this place.
Cours Saleya in Old Town Nice was very extensive and beautiful! Full of flowers, fresh vegetables, fruit and olives as well as the Nicoise specialties, such as Socca.  A must-see while in town.

Some of the best Indian food I have ever had. Lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka, roti and samosa were to die for. Owner was very sweet. Lowkey counter service place in the heart of Berkeley, close to UC campus. Highly recommend. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Popped in here on a whim with my daughters for a quick dinner before record shopping across the street wasn’t expecting much considering the location and sure enough the atmosphere was bright fluorescent lights and sticky tables and a locked bathroom and piles of who knows what in the corner, the quintessential definition of a hole in the wall restaurant. But the gentleman at the front counter was super friendly and gregarious and didn’t make us use the ordering kiosk and brought us out several dishes of surprisingly flavorful and quite spicy food which the three of us liked a lot. He even let me come back an hour later and use the bathroom which I thought was nice. Overall, don’t expect much as far as atmosphere, considering it’s a pretty rough and tumble part of town, but the food was plentiful and spicy and generally that’s all I care about.

We went here looking at the reviews. The place was pretty empty for a Sunday evening.We ordered Chicken Tikka Masala, Shahi Paneer and 3 Punjabi Parathas. The gravy for both Tikka Masala & Paneer was the same. Additionally, there was no Tikka in the Tikka Masala. All it had was chicken chunks. This is not how the Chicken Tikka Masala is meant to be.We also caught a piece of Aluminum foil with the paratha. This makes me wonder if they don't make Parathas fresh and that they are just heated on order.Frankly, I will not come back again - though I was tempted to try out their unlimited buffet.

Simply amazing food, I had the pleasure of enjoying this fine food with some cohorts from work. We all ordered separately and shared to enjoy as many flavors as we could. Not a single complaint from anyone except we could not stop eating! Full is an understatement, will be back when in California!

Lunch Buffet is finally back, and you just can’t beat the food or price! Always an amazing food experience at one of our favorite Indian food restaurants in the Bay Area. Food is always top quality home cooked here at Sansar, and the staff is very friendly as well.So glad they were able to Finally bring the buffet back

We went in a little late for dinner. We were served with decent flavorful Indian dishes without much waiting. The restaurant manager was very nice and didn’t rush us though it was a but late. Food was full of good flavors. I found the quantity of food like saag paneer a little less than we generally see, for the price we pay. Veg biryani was yum. Special veg rice tasted good but my only issue was that the rice was a bit dry and not soft. Loved mango lassi and their yogurt.

Another first time.  I have been passing by this place for the last 3 months so decided to try it. Ordered Chicken Saag and Garlic Nan for pickup. Their ordering app was great and when I picked up the food, it was hot and fresh. As I was leaving I realized there was no rice! Whaaat? I have never been to an Indian restaurant were I had to order rice separately with a dish like Saag. I asked the gentleman there and he informed me and made a order of rice for me. He was nice enough not to charge me being my first time but I still think rice should be part of the meal which costs near $14.  The Saag itself was delicious with the right amount of heat and a very generous portion. The garlic naan was nicely cooked and delicious too. Rice was plain white with some kind of a spice but basically plain. So to wrap up, flavors and portions were good but rice should be free.

Great buffet and fairly priced for those who only eat a single plate🙂. Limited dessert options but they are not too sweet and tasty. Chai was also not very sweet which is perfect. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

This place is the very definition of overrated. I had a 3 hours drive from SAN Francisco and found this as a recommendation. Since I travel very often, I religiously follow google and yelp guidelines when it comes to picking food, places to visit, hotel...first thing that bothered me is extremely common in that area, they do not respect the scheduled hours they dispose online. After a 15-20 minutes detour, I was excised to finally eat, it was 4 pm, I hadn’t even eat lunch because I wanted to try on the menu. I got there and it’s closed from 3pm to 4h30 pm apparently while on google it stated that it was open until 10. I decide to stop by an ice cream place across the street that’s supposedly open according to google, and it’s close as well, same thing with the other Indian restaurant nearby. I finally spot an employee at 4h25 pm and he tells me to come back in 10 min. I get back and place my order. I ask the waiter about the menu preferences and I order 2 appetizers and 1 meal that was around 14$. I get my appetizer and they were good, but that’s it. Not exceptional whatsoever, just basic Indian food. When I get my main plate, I realize that they didn’t give me my order, but a tandoori mixed grill that’s 20.95$. I barely had service and had to aske for water refill. Moral of the story is that service is not that great and food is just borderline ok. Don’t get there with high hopes.

Venturing into a new dining spot that caters to your dietary preferences can be a pleasant surprise. Intrigued by its vegetarian options for Italian cuisine, you decided to give it a try. Beginning your culinary journey with garlic knots, you were met with a burst of flavor, although slightly oily and buttery, they left a satisfying taste. Moving on to the main course, you opted for two customized pasta dishes: penne pesto with cream and veggies, and ravioli with vodka sauce. Each dish surpassed expectations, boasting perfectly cooked pasta enveloped in creamy sauces that tantalized your taste buds. The service, swift and attentive, added to the overall positive experience, while the reasonable pricing made it a value-for-money proposition. In conclusion, if you're seeking delectable Italian fare at an affordable price point, this establishment comes highly recommended. Its flavorful offerings and accommodating menu options ensure a delightful dining experience for all.Vegetarian options: You can customize the pasta and you have pizza options tooParking: Free parking
I highly recommend the bruschetta. I just had some at a way more expensive Italian place, and this blew it out of the water. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

I was here with my friend to celebrate her birthday. We decided to come here so that after dinner we can go and watch a movie at AMC. We were seated at the booth which we asked for. Since the time was limited we decided to give our order - brussel sprouts, for appetizers, salmon fry as main entree and chocolate tiramisu for dessert. Before all that we ordered red wine. After selecting between two samples the Pinot tasted good. The service is great and I was surprised when the salmon came with fresh cheese grated on top of it. I do not like cheese and hence I had to tell the server. He was nice and took it and got me the order without cheese. Lessons learned, don't assume and call it out at the beginning itself to be safe. We enjoyed our dinner, the brussel sprouts was delicious and with dry fruits and dried cranberries it tasted awesome. The tiramisu cake was so delicious we both finished it quickly in no time. The vibe was cool and quiet inside the restaurant. It seemed like other servers were busy packing takeout food items. It was good to experience here. I will recommend this place for sure.

Food was OK even though I've had better Italian food. Some dishes were better than others. Bruschetta was fine same as pizza both were from Happy Hour menu. The spaghetti with pesto sauce was flavorless. Salmon plate was fine but salmon was tasteless so I looked for salt and pepper to add but there were none. Service was prompt and nice although at one point waiter forgot my inquiry of coffee. Overall it was a pleasant experience and would probably give them a second chance, hopefully food would taste better.

Tomatina is a huge favourite of mine. We had the garlic rolls, which are, quite frankly legendary and the create your own pasta. We had penne with creamy pesto and sun-dried tomatoes, which was some of the best pasta I've ever had! They've transitioned to fully online for menu, ordering and payment but the staff is still around to serve. Glad to know that this place still maintains the high quality food from 5 years ago!

Great Italian food, plenty of foods to choose from and great variety of styles! Also many menu items cane with gluten free option as well!Their portions were generous and you could ask for more cheese as well!We are eager to go try more of their menu too! They have this great thing that you’d use to order and pay using your phone which was interesting, no more waiting for some one to showup! Totally recommend their salads!Food: greatParking: plentifulSeating : indoor and outdoor, booth and tables as well as bar seatingMenu diversity : diverseCleanness: pretty cleanPrice: puts Olive Garden to shame!Portion size: generousPeople: very niceNoise: not noisyLighting: average lighting

Just an absolute must for any food enthusiast and who enjoys a nice experience with their meal. From the staff to the surroundings, we had the opportunity to try the private room for a family lunch, it was just awesome. Fancy food but served by competent and friendly staff that make all the difference during the entire process. It was a great lunch and hope to go there again sometime

We went to celebrate a hallmark birthday and had booked 2 weeks in advance. We were given literally the best table, an intimate corner with a large window overlooking the street, and it was very cozy.The service was great, never over hovering but just the right kind of attention as needed. The food was wonderful. We ordered a red from the Alentejo region.  We chose 2 starters and 3 Mains plus extra bread and obe dessert. The goulash was my absolute favorite. It was very kind of the team to offer us an additional dessert for the celebration.Vegetarian options: There were optionsKid-friendliness: Staff is absolutely adorable and I am sure they are capable of Taking care

Bistro 100 Maneiras very much lives up to its hype. The bistro proper and the cocktail bar both serve exquisite food and drinks (I recommend getting a drink at the bar before the meal). The spicy octopus cooked with honey is so rich and decadent. The beef stew croquettes are very hearty. Coming to ambience, the interior is low key glamorous. I do wish that they would space out the tables a bit more, but that’s nitpicking. The only real con is the service: which while not exactly bad, was rather slow at times.

Had a deliciously rich dinner here. I highly recommend the croquettes and the spinach burek. The yogurt sauce on the burek was a really wonderful combination. The loin tataki was rich and delicious. It’s on the heavier side, so keep that in mind for what you’re looking for. The octopuff was delicious, though I’d prefer the side to be something a bit more neutral to balance the sweetness of the dish vs. the sweet potato puree which was also very sweet, though impressively smooth—so much so that it coats your mouth and tongue wonderfully as you eat it. The service was good and I really loved our window seat on the second floor looking out onto the city. It was super cosy. The space generally is quite nice and intimate.

Absolutely amazing experience. The service and atmosphere was only surpassed by the quality and taste of the dishes. The best restaurant in Lisbon in my humble opinion. 5 stars! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

Absolutely stunning space that has a good atmosphere. The menu is interesting and has a good variety. The risotto was delicious and the appetizers were yummy. The margarita wasn’t that tasty. The service was professional and on par with the prices. However, our server rushed us at the beginning and wasn’t very warm. He was quite condescending at times so makes me not want to go back.I am giving this 5 stars because the decor, the menu and the concept is unique and well thought through. But… it was not cheap and the food was good but not amazing.

It’s crazy to think that I’ve just found this place. No one recommended to me, I haven’t found it on any guides or anything. Just walked by and was lucky enough to get a table without a reservation.What a breath of fresh air it was to go to a proper restaurant, serving great product, with proper service, at a proper price. Truly this experience checked all the boxes. Nothing significant to complain about. Just all around a solid food experience.Also the cocktails were great. Easily one of the best spots in the city to get a creative, well balanced, and exceptional cocktail.This place is a must visit as it will become a regular in our roster for recommendations and visits.
The meals here are delicious. Whenever I'm in Lisbon wanting succulent food, Bistro 100 Maneiras is my first choice. I highly recommend. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

My wife and I had dinner here on our trip to Lisbon. The food was very good and interesting but the service is horrible. The wine steward showed up at our table wearing a T-shirt asking me if I spoke English. He was in a hurry and impolite. After we decided on wine, he began to pour in the bottle was almost empty leaving this half a glass short then waited over 30 minutes for him to come back. He never came so we had to ask the waitress and she finally brought the bottle over and poured us, barely a glass.  We honestly not sure if it was the same wine. From this point on the service was even slower and the table was right next to the kitchen, which was loud and hot. In the end, it was not a great experience. We went there because of high publicity and great reviews. I also discovered that the owner was not there that night and probably that is why the service was horrible.  When we are back in Lisbon we will definitely not come back to this restaurant.

Pretty good fish tacos.  The employees were nice and provided quick service. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 Recommended dishes

The food was very good and authentic but everyone behind the counter was very young and unsupervised and not very disciplined with hygiene.   There was HUGE spill on the floor by the counter and I had to notify the girl at the counter to clean up before someone fell.  The salsa bar was not maintained and BOTH trash areas were overflowing.  Great food so it’s a shame that there is nobody in there to hold standards higher.

I have not been here in years, but once again I was not disappointed in their fish tacos. Yummy, the best. Upon ordering I was greeted with a smile and great customer service.  I ordered the shrimp bacon burrito and it was delicious! 😋! My burrito did come cut in half by the kitchen..why would you cut a burrito in half??The chips were crispy, and the salsa was fresh. There was plenty of tables for seating. Everything was neat and clean.I look forward to going back 😀

Purchased the California bowls this evening that we have loved for years.  Totally disappointed!   In the bowls we counted about 4 LITTLE pieces of chicken.   On the website you make it look like there is at least 10 chucks of chicken….used to be now it’s really a rice bowl.  We will try your store one more time.  If we receive the same measly chicken, you will lose a GOOD customer!   This store has mostly young people that are fooling around behind the counter and are unorganized and don’t seem to care.  We’ll see what happens next time.

Saw this online as one of the hottest new restaurants in SF and it's New Orleans style food. I had to come and try it! Just be aware that the brunch menu is different than dinner. They do not have the gumbo and jambalaya.The prosThe charbroiled oysters were great! It was buttery, cheesy and barely cooked. Definitely use the sliced bread to sop up the butter sauce. The Boudin Benedict was really good too. The poached egg was perfectly executed, runny yolks as you cut into it. The crawfish omelet had the right sauce, it was crispy outside and creamy eggy inside.Why the 3 star review? The service and execution. We arrived at 11:15, received our oysters 5 minutes after we ordered then waited over 30 minutes for our entrees. There were people who came at noon that received their food before us. I inquired at 12:15 and they said they will check on it. Found out that they delivered our food to another table that came after us. The manager did come and apologized and offered us each a glass of bubbly. Kudos to management to keep the guests happy. I heard that this is their first few weekends for brunch, but the kitchen and food expediter needs to get their acts together.I'm willing to give them another shot and come back for dinner to try the New Orleans classics, jambalaya and gumbo. Not coming back for brunch until they figure it out.

Excellent! The prawns and rabbit sausage are a must. If you are looking for a quiet place to talk, this is not it. The bar and dining area are both lively and loud. I would definitely come back to try more dishes.

This place is in the heart of Mission in a refurbished (I think) church. In fact half of our seating was a pew, lol! Go for their 90mins all-you-can-eat brunch and drinks. Great food, drinks, perfect for birthdays, large groups or a date (if you don't mind the noise).

Good but not great.  Went for the second time on New Year's Eve for brunch and they had ran out of multiple items 2 hours before brunch ended (simple things like pancakes and egg bakes).  The breakfast sandwich was again good but 100% impossible to eat without fully deconstructing.  I would go again if everywhere around was closed but wouldn't go out of my way to go again.

E X C E LL E N T!!!!!!! Absolutely the best service,drinks, and the food... was phenomenal!!! I’ve tasted some awesomecreole food but what I Experienced tonite was nothing short of amazing. First time in Cali, and after a long day of sighting seeing we made the best decision coming here for dinner. The boudin balls “party in the mouth” good, bbq shrimp..an on!! Thanks for  the brilliant service and unforgettable food

Absolutely lovely spot.Small bites are great to share, everything is filling.Ambience is lovely, as if you're sitting outside on a balmy Southern evening.Full bar, good neighborhood...not much more you can ask for!BE HERE.

It was Sunday brunch time and Paulo Luis, the bartender, was great!  The baked eggs with grits and eggplant was delicious, as was the chicken/sausage jambalaya. Paulo Luis made a fantastic Old Fashioned with Bourbon and the Smirnoff Bloody Mary was good and spicy. We sat at the bar and enjoyed the live music with drums, bass player and vocalist. Clean, handicapped accessible/gender neutral restrooms in the back of restaurant. Busy place with a small wait line after 12:00 noon. Great Cajun food and atmosphere!
Worth checking out this vibrant place! Good food and great accommodation! The brunch with all you can drink and eat plus a band playing is a must do!

I love this cute little place , the food was yummy you have to try they’re char grilled fanny oysters top with herbed butter and Romano cheese ...Mmm so good love it, all the staff were very welcoming and me and my friend we both enjoyed our time at Alba Ray’s.

Cool space- drinks are on the expensive side but if you come early to events you don’t pay. They present books and have interesting talks. Plus they have all these plants in the patio so it looks pretty
A very cool space!
Incredible
The place to be
I was there for a party. It is a very versatile and welcoming place.Isolated and therefore suitable for musical events!

A nice multipurpose place, run by young and smart minds. It looks like a former industrial building, where the association rents desks to colorful creatives. Occasionally they organize themed parties and/or meetings, which can be accessed with their membership card.

A hotbed of talent from the world of design, architecture and art. A place open to the city and the neighborhood in which it stands. After? it is a constantly moving gem that offers a cultural proposal of the highest quality! I highly recommend keeping up to date with the program.

Among the places of my heart, Dopo Space is not just a coworking but an inclusive, innovative and stimulating space. Run by super heroes, young Italians working in different cultural fields, united by the desire to create a new sincere social, cultural and political network, I recommend it to everyone!!!
AFTER? A beautiful place both to work and to meet people during the various evening parties. A mix of creatives who welcome you in an industrial courtyard. Approved!
Beautiful innovative coworking space where they also organize interesting events and evenings. Excellently managed by young people.

We went here on a friend's recommendation and was not disappointed. The food was very good. We ordered off both the authentic Chinese and the American-Chinese menus. Food arrived quick, the waiter was friendly, and the place clean.  Will for sure come here again when I'm in the area. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Really really good food... which, is of course the most important thing for a restaurant.  They have an extensive menu that is both traditional and 'Americanized'.  Everyone will find something they love for sure.Sometimes they only have one wait person for the entire restaurant.  That's happened 2 or 3 times when I've eaten there... so you'll need some patience.  I mostly get things to go which is great because they have a drive-up window.
Good authentic Chinese food.  I alway order the spicy squid.  The dim sum is a different story.  The chicken feet is dry and weird looking.  Just stick to the dishes and avoid the dim sum.

So. Delicious. The quality of the food is authentic, fresh, and tasty, AND you can't go wrong with the price. The place is well kept and the bathrooms are clean. Enough tables for a single, double or a group of people. The ONLY reason why 1 star is missing is because they could work on their customer service. English speaking or not, anyone knows whether or not they're welcomed. Stop by here if you are in Milwaukee and have a craving for Chinese Food. Super yummy.. but don't say I didn't warn you about the service 😘

fortune is my favorite restaurant, the food and service is so so amazing. coming here is such a fun experience thanks to all the wonderful chefs and waiters (shout-out to our waiter Andy,  tysm🙏) would definitely recommend to everyone!! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Fantastic dumplings, excellent crabmeat rangoons, and my favorite chicken in the world. Try the black bean sauced fish and tofu - it's incredible. Order family style so you can have more deliciousness on your plate.

This is one of my family's favorite restaurants. They have have two menus: one for more authentic Chinese food and the general Chinese food. The general one has you typical sweet n sour chicken, general tsos, etc... The authentic menu has more delicacoes like roast duck, different veggies, crispy pork intestines, and the family meals. The food isn't too salty like most "Americanized" Chinese restaurants. It's definitely a good place to take a large group of people. And even better if that group takes forever to pick their food and/or are indecisive. Just get the family for two,three, etc... Meals.

Best Italian? Maybe not, but still a great restaurant with high quality food for reasonable (Seattle area adjusted) prices. We were a little unfortunate to arrive when only the bar was open, so the menu was limited, but even with a smaller selection we had an awesome time enjoying some food and wine. Phenomenal bread to accompany the pastas!

This is a favorite spot of one of my friends and I see why! I am impressed with the old world Tuscan theme seen throughout the restaurant, love the atmosphere. This place is much larger than I expected, there is abundant indoor seating and also outdoor seating. They make their own sausages and pepperonis. There was no bartender on duty so the owner took extra care in making our cocktails which came out nice. The customer service was great! However every dish my friends and I had was way over cooked including the appetizers. Maybe the cook was having a bad day? Overall it’s not a bad place to come for brunch, I will be visiting again in hopes that the food will be better.

Seated in a large booth, water and water bottle brought right away, drinks order taken, attentive service and friendly. The wedge salad was amazing with many different olives, and balsamic dressing, the calamari was good and crispy with marinara, the bruschetta was way to crispy and hard the bread was tough and hard to eat, the main entrees were good. However the pizza had very little prosciutto on it and was not filling for my spouse. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the dishes flavorful, the waffle-banana was amazing and my daughter loved it. The price was high. Not a place we would eat at regularly but a nice place to celebrate an event or holiday.

I loved eating here. This is one of the best outings I’ve had at a restaurant. Our server was even better (I don’t know how to spell his name but starts with an M). Excellent authentic Italian restaurant on the Eastside. All the food items are pretty tasty, high quality and the right quantity for the price. I personally loved penne vodka pasta and Tiramisu. Kids loved Alfredo Fettuccine.Vegetarian options: Penne vodka, Alfredo Fettuccine, Ravioli and a couple more pastas, few starters, vegetarian pizzas and deserts.Kid-friendliness: Kids menu with a couple of good options, good atmosphere, drawing sheet with crayons.

2 AppetizerS, 2 main meal, 2 deserts and 2 glasses of wine for $100 c’mon, seriously? I am glad I live less than 5min away! My friend and I got there at 2pm and not a soul around, we spent 2 great hours catching up and eating this delicious food. The place is charming and the staff super friendly. I highly recommend!!Updating my review, a friend of mine wanted to eat some pasta so I knew exactly where to take her and they didn’t disappoint! Whole bottle of wine for $18 on Wednesday and he had a blast, my food was incredibly tasty and urgh I just wish I had more.. I tried the salmone and I am not sure if I will be trying anything else. My friend had pollo parmigiana and I will add pictures. I can’t forget to praise the service, I was really happy with my experience. An easy choice for Italian, with pasta made in house, along with aged steaks and sausages.We went for a quick & basic meal of pasta and pizza. The sauces were very flavorful. The meatballs on my spaghetti made for a hearty meal. The Caesar salad included anchovies! 👍The next time I'm craving meat I'll go in for a steak and a glass of Chianti.

Went to Enzo’s for the first time with my 3 daughters, son in law and 7 month granddaughter. It was the 1st time all of us had been together for almost 2 years. The atmosphere, service and food were all amazing. And knowing our “reunion” the owner Grant came to our table and offered us complimentary desserts. Would highly recommend Enzo’s for any occasion. Will definitely be going back.

First time visiting this Enzo's restaurant. This building was formerly known as Pogacha Restaurant & Bar. We ordered the New York steak and salmon. Both were okay. My partner commented that the salmon was bland. We also had Tiramisu for dessert. Sadly, one of the two had too much liquor in it that overpowered the taste. 😒 The service is great and the staff is friendly. The atmosphere (furniture, lighting, and decors) is warm and cozy.

The slightly more wealthy can afford to eat a little bit more healthy, and Pacific Catch that is located in the fairly new live, work, shop, dine complex off 101 is no exception.Seafood options are not as expansive as a traditional seafood restaurant like Market Broiler or Kings Fish house,but what they do they do well.  Most everything is light, fresh, and well prepared. The prepared salads are particularly good. Service and staff are friendly.Prices are on the higher side, but Pacific Catch targets more upscale areas. Prices reflect the buying power of the local demographic.On a sunny afternoon, snag a seat in the outside dining area, grab a salad and a glass of wine, and enjoy the Silicon Valley   vibe. Bright, airy, and casual , the venue is a good first date restaurant,in my opinion. The relaxed yet festive atmosphere lends itself to casual conversation, and, perhaps a 2nd date.

We celebrated my grandniece’s 27th birthday. The food was excellent and the service was generous. Special thanks to waiters Laura and Juan for their professionalism. On a Monday early afternoon, we were craving some ceviche and immediately thought of Pacific Catch. It's always our go-to when we want great seafood. We started with the ceviche trio of tuna, shrimp, and hamachi, which just hit the spot. Then, another trio dish came—fish and shrimp tacos, crude of fries, and the house special beans with a smoky aroma that makes you want more! The service is always great; it's always been a pleasure dining here.

Nice upscale seafood bar and hang out spot. The atmosphere is chill, the staff is super friendly. I got the fish and chips with an old fashioned to drink. The food was flavorful, the fish was fried perfectly, it was not over cooked like other spots. The fish itself was fluffy and soft. It also came with some coleslaw as well. The cocktail was good. Decent pour, just the average amount of bourbon. Overall I would definitely recommend this place if you got a group of family or friends just wanting a chill spot to hangs out and have good seafood!

I dined at this place on a Wednesday evening with my wife and my toddler daughter. Just to be safe, we got ourselves a reservation around 7:30. There's no dedicated parking area for this restaurant but there are enough spots around the location. We ordered the Elote corn as a side dish and the Mexican grilled Chile lime shrimp bowl and the Latin Chimichurri Kanpachi bowl, both small sized. The food came relatively fast, within around 10 minutes. The corn was absolutely delicious and highly recommended. Both the bowls had quite decent portion sizes and the shrimp and tuna tasted absolutely delicious. The only complaint was that the cauliflower florets in the Kanpachi bowl didn't taste good and were quite stiff and bland.Overall, this is a standard Pacific Catch location with good seafood choices.

Went for a quick bite and drinks. We had the calamari and sticky ribs with the Hawaiian Butterfly and Guava Margaritas. It was a great combination, and I highly recommend the sticky ribs. This place was good without all the hype that comes with more popular places. The big advantage of this is that you can come in and get seated immediately for dinner or weekday lunch and have attentive service. Highly recommend if you want some good Korean BBQ without the wait.

My favorite place for Korean BBQ. Unlike the other place down the road, this place has no wait, quiet so that you dont have to get loud to communicate within your own table, has awesome service, quick refills on everything. They have lettuce instead of chopped salad from making ssam and excellent quality meats. The beef short ribs can be a little too sweet for me but that's the only meat my daughter will eat.
One of the better Korean BBQ restaurants in the bay area. Tasty food with fair pricing. Early evening mid week is good time to come with few other guests. Never get tired of "nine varieties."

Came in on Friday for lunch, restaurant is not full with 4 servers but it's hard to get them come over right away even when they acknowledge you with eye contacts and a nod.  Overall the food tastes great with the exception that seafood pancake came without any seafood.  Took two servers to resolve the issue, we were offered for a remake or a discount.  We opted for discount but it was not honored when we went over to the counter to pay (it's hard to get the bill from any server) because someone else was manning the register.

We gave this place a try because they started to serve Korean style AYCE like Gen. Good thing is that there is no wait as the store is pretty good. However, the selection of AYCE is quite limited although it covers most common items you'll order. There aren't anything extra like beef tongue or intestine..etc.The service is also a bit slow as I don't think they want to give you a lot of meats at once.There is a yelp check-in bonus for small seafood pizza but during my visit the server was too busy to remember that.
Ordered for take out today and we love everything. Beef bolgugi, seafood tofu and four of the side dishes. Our new favorite Korean restaurant. Would definitely come back.

We drove down from Fort Bragg to celebrate my husband's birthday. We heard about this place from some traveling customers of ours. My family and I went here for the restaurant. From the outside, it seems like an unassuming building by the water but the inside was very nice and tidy. They have a full bar and nicely decorated, plenty of tables inside and outside. You can order via QR code if you prefer.The service was great. The staff came by our table several times and our waitress even took note of our hungry cranky toddler that she made sure we got the kid's food first before ours.The food was amazing. The oysters were probably the best I've ever had. I got the halibut which was delicious and served with plenty of vegetables, and my wife had the cioppino. The little bit of octopus my wife gave me was great, well seasoned and soft.The cocktails were amazing, so the bar definitely wasn't only for show. We ordered four different cocktails and if we lived closer, it would be a great spot just to get drinks.Overall, we would definitely come back here in the future.

If you find yourself at Nicks, good times are at hand. Fun atmosphere with the special flare only found in the Point Reyes region. And THANK YOU to the staff who polishes the silverware 🍴 I noticed immediately and thought I had new cutlery. Well done all around.

We found another great spot on our travels. We try and always keep it local when traveling through a new area. We were overnighting west of OK City in Yukon Ok. A hidden gem!  Normally a small out-of-the-way brewery is a guessing game whether it’s going to have good beer or a reasonable ambiance. Well, come to Republic to strike it rich (yes, lame pun.)!!!  The beer is cold and fantastic while the service is warm and very welcoming. We waited an hour for this place to open and after having tried the beer, I’d have waited way more than that!

Nice, small town brewery. Plenty of seating… although if it is colder outside, wouldn’t sit in the back unless you want to be right next to a heating stove.No food options available here, but they do let you bring in outside food.
Great brewery here in Republic. Love the assortment of brews here. Never tried the pineapple cider. It was the bomb!! Recommend you come and try it. Super friendly staff.

The flight let's you try all their beers, so start there. Honestly, we enjoyed all the beers. The staff was always checking in and sociable. Not a lot of indoor seating. Tables for the outside front benches would be nice. Lots of friendly locals and people that have returned yearly. Family owned and operated. Will return whenever we are headed through the area.

Super cozy atmosphere inside, and put back is a beautiful little deck/patio area. Beers were all good, they have flights so you can sample everything on tap, service was good and friendly, definitely worth a visit!!

We came upon the place while on a road trip through the area in the summertime. The relaxed, friendly environment invited us in to check it out with some friends. No food is served and the business suggested be bring in our own. It was a great place for some afternoon ales, good food and good conversation.

Fantastic pub. We had a great time there. They have live music pretty much every Saturday in the summer. The beer was great, the service was excellent, and it was a very kid friendly place with lots of friendly people.

Stopped in during a visit to this quaint little washington town.  A big selection of beers for a small area and that was good to see. Had the Kolsch and it was light and refreshing. Locals seem to congregate there due to the amount of mugs hanging from everywhere.  Good beer, good people.

Finishing up a roadtrip from Vancouver, BC down to Yellowstone National Park and back and this is one of the best breweries I've found along the way (and I've tried a lot). Great atmosphere, super friendly staff, and delicious beer. The widow maker IPA is fantastic!

Everything about RBC is five star. The beers were excellent, all clean, bright and balanced. Both IPA’s were really great, the Saison was a winner too. Great staff, ambience, warm fire, friendly locals and comfy couches. I would be spending way too much time here if I lived in Republic. Highly recommend.

With its slightly worn out red carpet, revolving trays, and pictures of celebs hanging throughout the place, Yang Chow leans into its old school appeal,  but maintains focus on the food and service.The main draw is the slippery shrimp, and while I'm not a big fan of shrimp dishes, this is not one you'll want to skip.  The shrimp are slightly crispy, sweet and salty without that overly shrimpy taste.  Fantastic!We also ordered the Kung Pao chicken, Moo Shu pork with pancakes, green bean with pork, pan fried noodle with beef, and veggie fried rice.  All were great, but we all agreed the pan fried noodles were a bit bland.The staff and service were great and the food was served quickly and hot.

I searched around and found this old restaurant apparently with many celebrities coming here throughout the years. Definitely make reservations as there will be a line!We ordered a bunch of appetizers and main dishes for a group of 9 and had plenty of leftovers. The taste on average is tailored to Americans and less genuine for typical Chinese.  All my white friends LOVE the food though! Our server Benny is FANTASTIC and kept everyone entertained throughout the meal.Appetizers:- Spicy wonton soup: The most popular dish with the crowd in a dark garlic spicy soup that is like a French onion soup.-  Spring rolls: Hot fried rolls with chopped Napa cabbage. Really tasty.- Steamed soup dumplings: basically XLB which is ok. Serve with vinegar.Main dishes:- Slippery shrimp: Apparently a signature dish everyone gets. Cooked in a thick orange/lemon tangy sauce. Feels ok and not super impressive to my Chinese palette.- Kung Pao shrimp: More flavorful version with peanuts and chopped veggies. My preferred way to cook shrimp.- Mongolian beef with scallions:  Good.- Lamb with asparagus: Good.- Veggie fried rice: A bit plain.- Beef Lo Mein: Semi soupy soft noodle. It cooks with pork on the menu but you can substitute for beef. Good.Overall pretty good choice for semi authentic Chinese food. The service and vibe was excellent and they serve food fast, which I appreciate.

The restaurant is somewhat small, but well distributed. It can accommodate small and large parties. We went Father's Day Sunday, and were able to get a table for five after about 20 minutes of waiting.The food was amazing! My son got chicken chow mein, with no vegetables. Considering there was a lack of vegetables, it was still delicious.I got the Three Musketeers lomein and was very pleased. It had a nice balance between the meats and veggies. We got the chicken wings- eat them with the sauce! Having said that, they are spicy, if you don't like spicy, maybe get the sauce of the side. The portions are shareable size! We didn't know and we each got a plate and had plenty to take back to the hotel.The customer service is great. Can't wait to come back to California, and est there again.Parking: There is parking behind the restaurant, however, it's a small alley that you will miss unless you know it's there. Across the street there is also a parking garage which you will also miss unless the entrance is there. There is parking in other locations, but you will have to do some walking.

Little pricey for what there is. But add the views and you'll get over it. Tough to keep a pier rest open for decades. Just went to buffet brunch. Only review is for non-Holiday attendance.Shrimp was not fresh, agreed on all in party of 5.Updating slowly. Restroom plumbing needs helpHard workers there trying to make it work.Mushroom gravy was used for morning biscuits and gravy. Had some Hispanic and Asian to please all to add to the American expected fare.They did even the last two hours add more clean plates and kept up with all items in heated buffet style servers. Server waitress was happy to inform for first timers and serve Mimosas.Enough staff and mgmt on a Sunday to take address to any issues. Pretty shrimp cocktails.Plenty of differe t items including bbq ribs.Even a slow carving station of ham, roast beef (almost prime rib style), and turkey (kinda dried out), but awaiting staff to make cook to order omelet station and waffle as well to order.As any buffet, the servers working don't do anything but give initial drinks and/or water.But you can't expect much gratuity when the customer serves self everything else, wrongplace to work for tips. You don't even have to order drinks with your table assignment server, you can choose between three juices on ice AND 3 coffees including on our visit Irish Cream pre sweetened coffee with fresh whipped creme along side (keep in mind, it was St. Party's Day weekend), around thirty nine for each and @62 senior discount was given with ID. Go once, if local Richmond Berkeley close to State's and faces south westerly. Events happen on the catering side 50-75 or so on the other side larger older building. Silverware setup already in place and is nice linen on tabletop.You may or may not be returning. They try.We could of bought the same with tip for 2 for just under a hundred for seafood and steak@ SCOMAS OF SF at another pier with the rest. Owned boat that pulls up with fresher seafood outside your window for less for 2 in party.

Let's be honest, you're really paying for the view with this place. The interior is dated and a bit drabby, the bathrooms were not clean, but the views are spectacular.  The food itself was not bad, but nothing really stood out to me.
So many choices it's amazing!! and the view is stunning! Our waitress was great as well, so nice!

One of my favorite Sunday buffets. It's a little pricey, but the selection is the largest I've seen.  Including made to order omelettes, and sushi.  They also have a whole room dedicated to deserts.  If you're a champagne drinker, the bottomless mimosas will keep you happy.
I went to HS Lordship for mother's day. The service, food, and atmosphere was amazing. Their brunch buffet on the weekends is to die for. Definitely will return!!!!!!!
Very quaint. Out of the way, SF place to go. Great views.

Le coeur bat vraiment Beirut chez Becky’s. The manouche will make you feel you are in a traditional saj in Beirut. We had the zaatar fromage and soujouk fromage, they were truly to die for. Whether it’s the smell of zaatar, the crunchiness of the dough or the nostalgic lebanese songs playing in the background, it’s the perfect place to grab a snack.

Good wraps in Paris. It is a business family running by the sister and her brothers. Such good thing to see family working together.The food is delicious, the dough is fluffy and filled with chicken or meat. I tried different chicken wraps and my favourite is the garlic mayonnaise chicken. Decoration is cozy and it is a bit pricey but worth it.I recommend it if you are nearby.

1- Expectations ✔️I discovered the place on tiktok. I had high expectations and it's safe to say it lived up to the hype.The food was amazing and perfect for a night meal because it wasn't too heavy. You can tell the ratio of the ingredients was well thought of.2- Recommendations 📝I got to share a bunch of different items and I liked everything I had but the halloumi basil wrap was a personal favorite !If you would rather play it safe, I also recommend the famous mixed zaatar and cheese man2ouche, a classic that never fails you.3- Details   Well packaged, survived the heavy rain, and the basics were there: ketchup, mayo, napkins. Everything was already cut in half, making it more practical for sharing. A kind "bon appétit" message on the delivery bag, making the food more heartwarming.-> Overall great experience on all levels. This time ordered it at home with friends but I will definitely be coming back to taste it live !

This is one of the best places to eat manakish at Paris.The place is small and owned by a family of Lebanese entrepreneurs who succeeded in introducing Paris to our majestic manouche.We tried a zaatar/cheese manouche which had a nostalgic effect especially with the bonjus haram. The pesto chicken was amazing and do was the one with sojok.We didn't have time to take pictures as we couldn't resist the smell and dived in.

The garlic chicken mayo was amazing. The girl on the after-noon shift is so sweet. I enjoyed the calm atmosphere and the music, feels like home. Thank you Becky's Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

A man’ouchi that really tastes like home! I loved the lemonade as well! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

Words are not enough to describe this exquisite Lebanese restaurant. Do not miss this traditional cuisine. It is perfect for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner, and it truly has the feeling of home. We have tried the Soujouk et Fromage, Zaatar, and Labné, all of which were delightful. Thank you Victoria for the warm welcome and your lovely service. We’ll be seeing you soon.

So I've tried a lot of Lebanese street food restaurants in Paris, and this one is by far the best one of them all. This family owned restaurant took me back (or "Bake me back" as they say it) to when i was in Lebanon, the taste of the manouche is the same authentic one, it's made with a delicious fluffy dough, not overcooked but also not undercooked just the right amount of time in the oven. Everything is homemade, even sauces and meat seasonings. Even though they haven't officially opened yet, the restaurant is always full. The service is fast and very friendly. I recommend the soujouk wrap, and the fromage zaatar manouche 😋

First time here and what a fantastic gem of a restaurant this is! The Man’ouché tastes like it was just presented to you steaming hot and delicious by your favorite restaurant in Beirut. Try it; you’ll be delighted!
Such a friendly service and yummy bite. Home reminiscing 🇱🇧 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

It is a beer 🍺 pub located on the market square of versailles. They have a good selection of beer and gin . It lacked identity in my opinion and no music was playing which is such a shame . They do basic international cocktails . I had a gin tonic on their outside terrace . Did not try their food . Prices are fine . They have a happy hour prices . They seemed to have regular customers .

Great service, good food, and family friendly. Had a fantastic server, Sebastian, who was so great with my two kids. The kids portions are large and reasonably priced. I had the burger and it was very flavorful and filling. The waffle with pork belly was wonderful and even my daughter like it.

I decided to eat here due to it being at my hotel. I made the right choice. When you walk in, you’ll notice a hipster atmosphere. It’s not bad or anything, but you might not expect it. The menu might also come of as strange for people who aren’t used to very hipster style food. Luckily, I’m used to it. I ordered the 8 hour bolognese. When they slow cook tagliatelle for 8 hours, you know that it’s gonna be good! It was surprisingly one of the best pasta dishes I’ve ever had! Plus, the fries are OUTSTANDING (I tried my dad’s fries). However, DO NOT SKIP DESSERT! All of them are incredible. I got the Coconut-Guava Roche. It’s basically coconut and guava mousse with bits of tapioca and gelatine. It was AWESOME! So was my brother’s S’mores Sundae (marshmallow flavoured ice cream with toasted marshmallows and graham crackers) and my parents’ Carrot Cake (not what you’d expect a carrot cake to look like, but don’t let it fool you!)! I will have to recommend Urban Tavern to everyone I know. You’ll love it!

Great spot if you're dining alone. Varied menu, and my waiter suggested some side dishes to make my soup and salad dinner very special. Try the mocktails, try the milk bread, definitely wish I'd tried this spot earlier in my trip. Great for kids too!
Stopped in for flight of beer. Ended up getting the grilled octopus and smashed potato appetizers. They were both delicious.

Good place to grab a drink and bite. Food quality is good, but it's pricey for the portions served. Stays pretty busy since it's part of the Hilton. Good service too, would recommend for a casual night or dinner with colleagues.

Really enjoyed my meal here! We had a group of 6 and we were able to get a table. We shared some appetizers: a chorizo dish, an octopus dish, and one with pimento cheese and crackers. All were pretty good. I ended up choosing the bibimbap which was good but not traditional as it wasn't crispy on the bottom. My boyfriend got the chicken dish and you get such a great serving size!

Lively atmosphere (although borderline raucous), typical of a weekday upscale bar spot. Best deal in the house is definitely the 4-beer flight for $11.Highly recommend the Aged Pimento Cheese with Shrimp Crackers and Bolognese. The Steak was unfortunately tough despite being done medium rare.

KJ killed it with fast and humorous customer service. Best burger I and companion have had in YEARS! Friend had wine; excellent cab sauv and my draft beer was fresh and flavorful. Dessert was a tad expensive but presentation was lovely. All in all, a real boon after a 5 hr flight from Toronto.

What an unexpected surprise.  Entered with the intent of a quick bite.  Was treated to amazing food, the bass was out of this world,  served by knowledablge and attentive staff.  Like seriously one of the best meals I've had while dining out in quite some time.  I will be visiting again before I have to head back home.EDIT: I ate there three nights in a row and each meal was outstanding (could be a little more generous with portions, but I'm a fat Midwesterner).  Enjoy :)
The food is just amazing! A must for foodies. Definitly better then other restaurants I tried around in this range of price.

The scenery is so cool walking into this restaurant because of their western theme, it is very on brand for the area that it is in whenever I visit family.The fact that this restaurant will give you a menu and opening this up to see that there is even the option to have an all gluten free menu is the biggest thing that stuck out to me! Whenever I come to the valley I’m always a little hurt by the lack of options that I have when it comes to my food options. But this place made sure that I was not left out of having plenty of delicious options that were not only salads (like I usually find!)I ordered the marinated chicken and sweet potato that were delicious and the service was so attentive throughout our time here. I was so grateful to Christina during our stay and would love to make this a regular spot moving forward when I come to visit. Thank you all for making this menu and having so many options available! Cattlemen’s is a Bay Area jewel when it comes to eating good meats. Been coming for years and their flavor is consistent, always delicious. Love their salads and the ranch is amazing. Who can forget the warm bread served fresh and unlimited, hence why I only come on cheat days from my workout eating routine, bread so good you’ll most likely get diabetes from the high carb intake. Service is always friendly, unlike the lack of cellphone service you’ll have in the building itself but that only adds to enjoyment of eating when you don’t have to worry about anyone calling to disrupt you (unless of course if you have Verizon). I do like the ranch/barn/stable look of the restaurant with the dim lights and long mysterious hallways, always making it difficult to find where your family/party is sitting if arriving late, the plus is that it makes it more intimate for those special date nights. They have a banquet room for larger parties and a full bar with tables for those who do not want to wait to be seated, bar seating is first come first serve basis. When I do eat here I usually get the beef ribs, as it is very difficult to find restaurants that serve beef ribs. I also get the rib eye steak (cowboy steak). Always delicious selections. If you’re not the meat type they do have a really good pasta dish.

I recently had a delightful dining experience with a friend of mine. We opted for the porterhouse steak, cooked medium rare, and accompanied by baked potatoes. The steaks were prepared to perfection, reaching our table just as we had requested.Our meal was augmented by similar side dishes - a vibrant salad tossed with blue cheese, hot, fluffy baked potatoes, freshly baked sourdough bread, and a side of beans. For beverages, we had clear, refreshing glasses of water along with a robust and flavorful Kunde Cabernet wine.The food was indisputably mouth-watering, and the top-notch service further enhanced our dining experience. The ambience of the place was warm and inviting, contributing to a memorable meal. Given all these positive factors, I am certain that I will be dining here again!

When I'm in Northern California, I try to find an excuse to visit Cattlemen's.  I've been to several of there locations and have never been disappointed.  I am a "meat and potatoes" guy. Do not miss out on what I think is the steak capitol in either coast.

Came from San Mateo on Friday night (June 28)  for my birthday with my wife & my 4 year toddler, waited for 25 minutes to get a table after being told that wait time is about 10 minutes. Ordered gobhi Manchurian dry, beer and mango kesar as they don’t have mango lassi. Gobhi Manchurian was sour like other Indian restaurants in bay area coz they make it in tomato sauce here instead of soy sauce so I didn’t complain, mango kesar was quite good. While having appetizers , we ordered main course of dal Bukhara/Veg biryani & a garlic naan , we waited , waited & waited and informed our server about the delay as our toddler was hungry & getting restless , he went to check inside. Tables left & right to us were occupied later but got their orders before us , I think our food was served to table left to us who probably ordered similar options as there was some confusion , then we again ask our server who again went to kitchen and brings our food , probably good 25 minutes after we had ordered main course . Dal Bukhara was decent, not too creamy but kinda light in flavor but veg biryani was pretty underwhelming, it was full of semi-cooked carrots and lacking any kinda good flavor, garlic naan was good. I am usually not the one to complain but paying 16 bucks for such a bland pulao like biryani & 18 bucks for a simple dal bukhara makes you wonder your life choices, may be I should have sent the biryani back. My wife then told our main server that it was my birthday so he said he will check if he can get something but later on he did not come with any confirmation and just asked if we need anything else, I replied to him no. We wondered if they gonna get some dessert for us. My wife again asks another server about the same who then returns with a litchi dessert and tells us that please let us know in advance about any special occasion, we said okay and my wife pays the bill and adds around 25% tip , total of around a little under 100 bucks. In the end our main server comes and asks me how was the food , I told him honestly it was just okay , nothing special , I told him Yellow Chilli in Santa Clara has much tastier food with better quality. He apologized and gave excuse of it being a very busy night and to please visit again so that he can take good care next time and handed me a $10 off coupon on dine in for future use. I don’t think we will visit again as it wasn’t the worth the money & hype, at the end it was just a mehhh experience on a special day.PS: I didn’t click any pics as food had already got delayed and we were hungry.

Overall, it was an OK experience.  The service was excellent and friendly, but I was a little disappointed in the food and drink. I had the Cobb sandwich which was pretty much a chicken BLT with dry chicken. I also had the parmesan onion rings which were really just regular onion rings with a little bit of shredded Parmesan on top. I was expecting the breading of the onion rings to have at least a hint of Parmesan. My wife did like her clam chowder and baked potato. My Manhattan was really watered down to the point where it was almost see-through. Again, it was OK, I guess. Nothing to write home about, though.

I have gone to this location probably 10x in the last 6 months. My last 2 experiences have been exceptional, both times we had Vinny as our server. The food is good and my kids never complain and I haven’t tried anything I haven’t liked yet, but I usually get the steak and shrimp combo and the clam chowder is really good. After numerous attempts, I finally had the opportunity to visit this place that had been closed for various events on my previous visits. However, I remained determined and persistent, and my efforts paid off! Once I finally got there, I discovered that all my expectations were more than met. It truly is a great place with delicious food and excellent service.Being a calamari enthusiast, I always make it a point to order calamari whenever I visit a brewery. So, of course, I didn't miss the chance to try it here. I must say, the calamari was unbelievably delicious, especially when paired with the Hazy IPA that I ordered. The combination was a match made in heaven. Additionally, I decided to indulge in a pizza, opting for a half portion of "The Cats" pizza and half portion of "The Billy Jones" pizza. I appreciated that they accommodated my request, and both pizzas were truly delightful.One notable aspect of the restaurant is its size. It is incredibly spacious, with around ten tables inside and a significant area dedicated to Bocce game lines. Furthermore, there is a generous outdoor area, providing ample seating for guests to enjoy their meals in a comfortable setting.

What a place! I had never played bocce before but now I’m hooked. The games were fun, the people teaching us were great, and we had a blast.The food was also amazing.
