Right off the bat the place is lovely. Staffs are patience and helpful. Facility is clean and organize. The cats are clearly well taken care of; they're fit, clean and soft fur, and well socialized. Many cats are so relaxed they sleep with no care. Visitors are  limited to certain timeslot which is great. Honestly would come again.

Came here March 2024. Great cat cafe. Love the addition of the kitten room!! Very clean, lots of cats, kittens and toys. Cats are friendly and some may even sit with you. Definitely would come back. 😻

Very cute cat + kitten cafe experience!!! Some of them were shy, but opened up as soon as you start playing with them    All kitties are very well taken care of and are adoptable!!! Will definitely make plans to come back again 🐱

What a wonderful way to support cat adoption, socialize cats, and give folks a chance to play with cats!The cats were obviously so well-loved and the place was absolutely spotless and quite big. The staff were always around and making sure everyone was interacting with the cats safely, and it was just generally a wonderful afternoon. If you want, you can play with the super playful kittens or you can just lounge on chairs and huge beds with the bigger cats. And where else in west LA are you going to find super easy/free parking?! (The lot is just to the south of the building.)I can’t comment on the quality of their drinks—there was no pressure to buy any drinks though. Their gift shop seemed well stocked with fun items for a crazy cat person in your life. The price is super fair, and I felt good knowing it supported a good cause.

So, let me tell you all about my amazing experience at the cat cafe in Los Angeles. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm and cozy atmosphere. The cafe had a lovely ambiance with comfortable seating areas, the purrrrrrfect spot to unwind.Now, let's talk about the cats! They were absolutely adorable and friendly. It was so heartwarming to see them lounging around, playing with toys, and interacting with visitors. The staff did a fantastic job of ensuring the cats' well-being and making sure they were comfortable and happy.The service at the cat cafe was top-notch. The staff members were incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and passionate about the cats. They were more than happy to answer any questions I had.One thing that really stood out to me was the cleanliness of the cafe. Despite having several cats roaming around, the place was impeccably clean and well-maintained. It was evident that the staff put a lot of effort into keeping the environment hygienic and comfortable for both the cats and visitors.Another highlight of my visit was the variety of beverages available at the cafe. I enjoyed sipping on a cup of aromatic chai tea while petting the cats and soaking in the relaxing atmosphere.Overall, my time at the cat cafe was an unforgettable experience. If you're a cat lover like me, I highly recommend visiting this place. It's a wonderful opportunity to enjoy the company of adorable cats, support a great cause, and have a purrfectly relaxing time. Trust me, you won't be disappointed! 😺🌟

I’d move in. These cats are well taken care of, and it’s a real big space. There’s a large room, a kitten room, and a catio. Coffee is fresh and good, plus there’s extra snacks and treats and everything is really clean. Shout out to Dee!

I absolutely adored this place! We went for my friend’s birthday. Wasn’t crowded. The cafe is extremely clean, no bad smells, no spots and stains, it’s seriously beautiful. The cats are so well cared for and happy here. They have spaces they can hide out in if they don’t feel like hanging out with people, but there’s plenty of cats and kittens that are super friendly. I love all of the structures built for the cats to climb and play! Coffee was super yummy, cute little shop, overall a wonderful environment to spend some time in.

The place was great! We went for my mom's birthday, and although she really missed her cat, my family had an amazing time interacting with all the cats and kittens. They also helped us resolve a travel error in our scheduling. Really helpful and kind staff too.

I took my cat loving friend here for her birthday. It was really fun. CatCafe only permits a limited number of people in at a time so you need reservations, but the benefit is the cats aren’t stressed at all and ready for pets and play.  They get a spacious room, an covered outside area and a room they can access at any time away from the guests. There’s even a kitten room that you can hang in. And the drinks served at the cafe are pretty good as well. If you’re a cat lover or want to do something special for the cat lover in your life, this is the place to go

Had the most delicious lamb dish with crunchy libanese bread covered in sesame seeds. Most welcoming owners. Will definitely keep this resto as one of my favorite in Paris ❤️Vegetarian options: MoutabalDietary restrictions: Options for lactose and egg intolerant

Tasty crunchy Lebanese kaake with generous filling, we ordered the ham & cheese and the shawarma meat kaakes both were very very good 🤤The staff is friendly and the ambiance is warming.Recommended, we will go again.Vegetarian options: Healthy vegetarian option is: baked falafel

We loved this little restaurant with fresh Lebanese food and a friendly proprietor.  He was very helpful in identifying the gluten free foods on the menu, which were ample. The food was delicious. If we lived in Paris, we would eat here often. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Stumbled upon this lovely place as we got caught in the rain after going down from the Sacre Coeur. Ordered pastrami and shawarma kaake and falafel. The food was delicious and portions very generous. Nicolas, Lea, Karl and the team have taken this concept to another level. Only 6 months after they first opened Sesame (pun intended), the place is packed with gourmet Parisians and visitors who are eager to taste the real, homemade kaake. Do yourself a favor and go to Sesame to enjoy the stellar lamb, kafta or marinated chicken kaake. Have some knafeh for desert. Or just enjoy a cup of coffee in the very stylish cups bearing the restaurant’s mascot: a kaake hawker, to remind you that this lebanese street food can be revisited by one of Paris’s up-and-coming young bistros without losing its soul.

This place is a gem. The food is super delicious, and the service is amazing. I found myself dunking it in the spicy BBQ sauce to make it edible. It was also a bit on the cold side. Sides were great though! Would recommend the chili. That side was eons better than the meat.The portion size is decent for the price, not much to comment on there.Service is a mixed bag. Some friendly folk and some that look like they hate their job.Live music was ok, but doesn't really increase the appeal for this spot.Overall, a questionable experience. Nothing horrible, just nothing particular positive either.

Apparently, the establishment has been here for some hundred years!! Very interesting history. Plan to come back to check out the live music some other time.

The bean soup was pretty tasty. The Bavarian Chicken was big enough for 2 portions. The chicken was juicy with a nice crunch but also bland. The potato salad had more seasoning. A side of mushroom sauce was a nice addition to the chicken. My friend ordered the Jaeger Schnitzel. He finished the 2 patties and the cabbage, but wasnt a fan of the bland spaetzle. Hes been there a handful of times and said, "It used to be better." Disappointed to learn that dessert also isnt an option during the week.

The restaurant run by Czech immigrant serves authentic Czech, German, Austria comfort foods like Schnitzel, tripe soup, pork roast etc,. I know the most well known Schnitzel is made with Veal which is called Wiener Schnitzel. Also, tripe soup is very soothing, comforting. This reminds me of when i enjoyed eating Korean version of hangover soup like 해장국, 소머리국밥, etc,.Anyway, This was incredibly delicious!

DJ's is a nice German/Czech/Polish restaurant. Very authentic food. German food is rustic and filling. The portions are huge, you will definitely have leftovers. I would definitely come here again! Great place to try something different. Substitutions were allowed, so that's a plus.Dinner comes with soup or salad, the lentil soup w/ sausage was good.The Wienerschnitzel was delicious and fried to perfection. The spaetzle are great, but different than the usual boiled spaeztle. These seem to be pan fried with bacon. Dumplings aren't your usual type either, more bready, but also good.The Schweinebraten (roast pork) was good, and the sauerkraut is excellent.Food is cooked to order so might be slower than expected, but worth the wait. Table service is great. Bread/butter is available as well.Great german and czech beers on tap: Spaten, Pilsner-Urquell, others.

Authentic Euro food a long with a mainly Euro crowd. Never fails on quanity and quality of food. Before the pandemic it was a great date night place or just to grab a beer joint. But now more than ever we must support local business. Otherwise they won't be there when we need them. Jerry the owner is a good guy and he needs people to get the munchies and order take out food. Please do it and I promise you will not be disappointed

Monica was a delight!  Excellent service.Weiner Schnitzel was like I remember, missed so much.  Really good!  Nice beer selection.  Go for the strudel and have a latte.  Awe, so good.  Not icky sweet, just right.Thank you for a taste of home!  We will be back.

We were really looking forward to this place since we were from out of town. Decided to try this place but the food was quite bland and under seasoned. In comparison to Esthers German Bakery in MV, their schnitzel was not very flavorful and the breading was falling off too. The portion was very generous to feed two but not the best schnitzel I ever had.  Their food looks very photogenic though.

Stop by mother's day and tried the Bavarian meat roll, bean soup  with a very unique and tasty Forrest cake.Note : Forrest cake is available for special occasions; mothers day and Valentine's daySpatten beer on tap

Amazing, amazing food! The BEST dish was the Malai Kofta, it was so creamy and flavorful and filling! Get it!!! Seriously! You won't regret it!We also ordered the Mango Chicken curry, which was absolutely divine (perfect balance of sweet and spice). The Paneer Naan was amazingly flavorful, it's stuffed with cheese and a few extra flavorful veggie bits that made it so delicious (coming from traditionally a garlic naan lover). The servings matched the price, and my partner and I were stuffed (almost too full, except it was too yummy to stop eating).I will definitely be coming here again to try even more!

7.2/10A great meal for a great price!I'm currently attending a university around the area, and I was hungry for some Indian food. One of my classmates recommended this restaurant for its value and taste. Citing "Some of the best biryani, I've had in the US". But I didn't really trust this guy’s opinion because he doesn't like lamb, pork or fish (Most likely because he's from a vegetarian household). He only likes chicken (Guess what Biryani meat he ordered).But me being a trusting classmate decided to take up his statement of "Best Biryani I've had since coming to the US" and ordered the non-vegetarian thali deal. And my lord, was it amazing for the price! It came with some curry, appetizer, naan, gulab jamun (albeit only one), a drink (butter milk? didn't like) , and an amazing biryani. The biryani truly stood up to being some of the best biryani in the US. I am originally from Minnesota and the Indian food scene there is lacking to say the least. Nevertheless, Arka Indian cuisine had an amazing deal with some awesome taste.The curry was good, and the parotta (I think, Indian bread names are confusing) was nice and crispy. The only thing that disappointed me was the singular gulab jamun and the butter milk. The butter milk was understandable I didn't grow up drinking fermented dairy products, so I am unused to it. But ONLY ONE GULAB JAMUN WHAT IS THIS!!!Overall: Great price, great quantity and taste.Con: One gulab jamun... -.59.2/10

Would have liked to try but not wearing masks when I went in to place my order. I walked out.I am revising my one star review. I was at Domino's the other night and all working inside Arka were masked up. The owner took my review seriously and did something about it. I have not gotten to try the food yet, but now feel comfortable going in to do so. It is admirable that this change was made. I think that alone deserves the five stars.

Decided to try Arka as it just opened. Busy Sat night, looked like they still working out the kinks on everything, but a great sign at how busy it was. I ordered easily online, had a small (5 min) delay at pick up, but they have super comfortable chairs and sofas.   Ordered chicken tikki masala and aloo ghobi, garlic naan.  Pretty basic order for us, but a good baseline to measure against other restaurants.  Mild spice on the chicken, ordered medium on the aloo ghobi.   Was all fresh and delicious.  Aloo ghobi was a bit past medium spice for me, but lots fresh veggies and not overloaded with potatoes as I have had elsewhere.  Garlic naan was good, rice that came with entrees was plentiful and good quality.  At $36, was in range to slightly cheaper than other restaurants in the area. A good price for a good amount of food and great quality.  Give it a shot, it’s worth it.

So, I think it is hard to find Great Indian food but I wanted people who are in search of to know about Bollywood Cafe! This really is where you need to go! The food is amazing and we go at least once a week for lunch, other times we get delivery for about 15 of us but never have been disappointed. I really cannot pick any one dish because everything I try is so good! The owner is very nice and the service is great! You have to try it and you won’t be disappointed, it will quickly become one of your favorite spots too! You know when people talk about a little place that has great food, well you found it, you won't walk in and think amazing Indian atmosphere but you will leave thinking that's the best Indian food I've ever had!

The best Apollo fish I have had after staying one year in Boston. Good seafood options adn they taste really well. Portions could've been little more for the price that is listed. But just a friendly suggestion for the restaurant guys...Please do not add whipped cream to Falooda. It is FALOODA it's supposed to have any icecream on the top and not whipped cream guys please...I was hurt a little, very little but hurt.

Leckeres Sushi und toller LieferserviceIch habe diesen kleinen Sushi-Laden entdeckt und bin positiv überrascht! Das Sushi ist wirklich frisch und lecker, und man merkt, dass viel Wert auf die Qualität der Zutaten gelegt wird. Besonders die Auswahl an verschiedenen Sushi-Rollen, Nigiri und Sashimi hat mich überzeugt – es gibt sowohl Klassiker als auch kreative Eigenkreationen. Die Portionen sind gut bemessen, und man wird definitiv satt.Ein weiteres Highlight ist der Lieferservice. Die Bestellung kam pünktlich und war schön verpackt, sodass alles frisch und appetitlich ankam. Gerade, wenn man mal keine Zeit hat, ins Restaurant zu gehen, ist die Lieferoption super praktisch. Auch im Laden selbst ist die Atmosphäre angenehm und freundlich, wenn man vor Ort essen möchte.Der einzige kleine Kritikpunkt ist, dass die Auswahl an warmen Speisen etwas größer sein könnte. Abgesehen davon gibt es an Qualität und Geschmack nichts auszusetzen.Insgesamt ein toller Sushi-Laden mit gutem Service und einem zuverlässigen Lieferservice. Ich werde definitiv wieder hier bestellen!
Food: Tasty, but unfortunately it falls apart easily.Service: My delivery was an hour late, without any communication! (Order via Wolt)

Wir bestellen hier regelmäßig. Die Mitarbeiter sind immer nett und hilfsbereit. Die Lieferung kam auch immer recht schnell (allerdings wohnen wir auch im selben Stadtteil).Das Sushi ist immer lecker. Es ist nicht das non plus ultra Sushi, aber ein gutes "home style" Sushi das mit liebe zubereitet wird.Für uns das beste take away Sushi in der Area.

Price performance ratio great! The taste is simply good. However, long waiting times or delivery times on weekends are due to the limited staff. If you want sushi that matches the quality and price without going to an expensive restaurant, this is absolutely the right place for you.

Large selection & variety. Quality and price-performance very good! Very friendly and accommodating. I'm glad to have found a shop like this in Mainz. In terms of quality, Harumi Sushi and Niko Niko Tei are my two favorite shops for sushi in Mainz.

Really very good sushi and I've tried a lot. TOP price-performance ratio. Very nice staff, you often even get something for free. Above all, there is a huge selection so there is really something for everyone. Best sushi from Mainz with convenient ordering via the website.

Service was okay and food was so so ... no horseradish in the horseradish mashed potatoes.  Short ribs were more of an over cooked salty pot roast. The desserts were VERY yummy!

Tennis club mostly visited by elderly people. Worth a visit to take a beer in the outdoor terrace. It is a very chill experience to sit outdoor above the water, looking around one of the best areas in Marin area with boats and lots of nice little villas.

Cafe Tandoor is pretty solid as far as local Indian restaurants go. The food is quite tasty, especially (and perhaps unsurprisingly) the tandoor dishes. Gochi has been a longtime family favorite for Japanese fusion tapas.They have a really nice assortment of Japanese fusion pizzas, appetizers like kani cream korokke and other agemonos, and fresh sashimi.Their interior is traditional with tatami seating throughout the restaurant and will bring you back to Japan.Service is a hit or miss, as you can see plating is sometimes not the prettiest, which is something you would expect from a Japanese restaurant. And while the sashimi is fresh, if you’re used to going to non traditional Japanese restaurants, they do not provide large portions, which is normal in Japanese sushi restaurants.If you’d like to go on the weekend or with larger party, recommend making a reservation.

My favorite dish was the yuzu ceviche which oddly enough comes with these randomly giant potato chips. The tsukemono pickles were all nice though a bit liquid, I wish there were a few solid pickles too like radishes or cabbages. The hotate tomato looks impressive but I enjoyed eating the scallop and the tomato separately (beware the tomato is steaming hot inside). The green tea creme brulee was yummy, real sweet with a bit of a tea bitter after taste. Overall I'm really curious to explore more of the menu.

Taste :4.5/5Environment: 4.6/5Service：4.5/5A Delightful Fusion of Japanese and Italian CuisineNestled in the heart of Cupertino, Gochi offers a unique dining experience blends the delicate flavors of Japanese cuisine with elements of Italian cooking. This fusion creates the adventure that is both surprising and delightfulThe decor is a harmonious blend of modern and traditional elements, with sleek wooden furnishings, soft lighting, and subtle Japanese art adorning the walls.recommd⭐️Sake Sanshoku Don. What an experience! This was my husband and I’s first time here and didn’t know too much what to expect.The standout plates for us were the braised ribs and pizzas! We ordered 5 dishes, 1 dessert and a sake.We came in on a Saturday for dinner with no reservation. We initially were told we were going to be seated at the bar but ended up getting a regular table, which was great. It was pretty busy so we’ll do a reservation next time. Most of the seating is traditional where you take your shoes off. There were also a few private rooms.Staff was attentive and made great recommendations. The manager(possibly) came to check on us a few times, she was really sweet!Sure this place is a little pricey but you also get a fun experience. Would be a great place for celebrations and groups of friends. We can’t wait to come back and try more plates!

We went there for my friend birthday, it was an amazing evening, we took my mom, she makes the best ñoquis aka Gnocchis, so she is not to kin to eat out, but she was amazed on how good they were. We will come back, we order the calamari(ok, miss the tentacles, those are my fav, but they don't serve them anymore), we also got the artichokes , WOW, delish, and the birthday boy order the GOLFO, what an amazing place.We closed the night with a great teramisu and cappuchino.We will be back. Specially on the 29th as it is our custom to eat ñoqui aka Gnocchi on every 29th of the month.

one of my favorite old school Italian restaurants in the area.  good solid food and great service. I love my experience every time I go!  desserts are tasty too. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

A lovely, highly dog-friendly restaurant with outdoor (heated) patio and indoor (many small dog owners walked right in, pooches in arms) dining. Classic Italian fare, known for their veal. Competent seafood. Sauces are a bit bland and overly "mushy" (too much thickener and insufficient distinctive flavors) to make the food 5-star. Fried calamari was above average but still a bit chewy. The Antipasti Misto had too much cured meats and not enough veggies for my liking. Wish they continued to offer the toasted polenta (saw it in one of the menu photos). Spinach salad was good. Of the mains, the Lobster Ravioli was a bit fishy (tasted like defrosted seafood not fresh), the Scallopine alla Les (veal with brandy cream sauce) failed to let the brandy stand out in a smother of sauce - though the veal was very tender, as veal tend to be. The Specialita di Barbara (seafood on bed of salad) was very good. We had the Tiramisu & Vanilla Gelato. Both were very good and the combo was excellent. If I were to return, I'd lean in on seafood (but avoid any lobster), tomato sauces and salads. Would return just bc they're so relaxed about dogs! Service was prompt and attentive despite the pre Mother's Day crowd (place was packed).

Aldo's has been one of the landmark Italian restaurants in the San Jose area for decades (similar in that way to Il Fornaio).   They have a fantastic selection of food, fresh pasta and Gnocchi (I love the Bianca niece - aka Snow White gnocchi), veals fish and even a really tasty eggplant parmesan dish.   The service is always great and the location feels open and spacious yet also inviting.  They often have a number of specials so it is always a treat to try something new when you visit.  The bar has many options so when you come here please expect a full dinner experience.   Nowadays there are many great Italian options in the area, but this one has remained among my favorites.

Beautiful restaurant with wonderful homemade Italian food.  Been coming here for years.  Food is expensive but you are getting the finest quality of Italian food.  Marvelous atmosphere; it’s the best you can find, truly.

Aldo’s Ristorante has been in my top restaurants list for well over a decade. Serving delicious Italian main dishes, appetizers and desserts, Aldo and his staff cook some of the most amazing dishes I’ve tasted and a couple staples that just taste more tantalizing at Aldo’s. The calamari and Caesar salad for some reason tastes better at Aldo’s. I’d say it’s the dressing on the Caesar and the light and crispy coating on the calamari. The Sophia Special and Chicken Parmigiana are my favorite pasta meat dish. Aldo’s rib eye steak is delicious and sometimes when I want a good steak, I head to Aldo’s vs a steakhouse. Love the quality of meat and the way it’s prepared. So good. Desserts are yummy and don’t miss the limoncello. Full bar, beer and wine. Reservations by calling the restaurant. Outdoor and indoor seating. Clean restrooms.

Like so many restaurants the pandemic has hit them hard when it comes to employees. So expect a wait for food: However it was worth the wait the food and drinks were amazing. So yummy that we were sure to leave room for dessert. Everyone has to order there is no sharing dishes so come hungry and ready for takeout. Food : 5/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Lasagna, Caesar Salad, Fried Calamari, Bruschetta, Tortellini Alla Tommaso, Crepe, Basa Filet, Canolli, Cheese Ravioli with Marinara Sauce … More

Traditional Italian, comfortable decor, seatings were a bit tightly arranged, somewhat noisy also (or lively?), kind of hard to have a conversation across the table.  Service was great.  Prices were a bit on the high end, but good portions.  The mixed green had a light dressing which I liked.  The fried calamari was pretty good, lightly coated, tender.  The pastas were all quite decent, flavorful, not heavy with fresh ingredients!

Aldo's has really great Italian food, including off menu items. Their service is top notch 👌 and they have a variety of different seating options for every occasion.Aldo's is definitely one of my favorites for an Italian restaurant in the bay area.

They put good stuffs in the dishes in proper quantity: in Seafood, the numbers of clams, calamari were plenty (not just like few tokens like many other places). The smoked salmon had enough smoky flavor. The portion size was also satisfying.Also, they offer to sprinkle cheese on the dish.
We hired The Striped Pig to serve hog roast at our recent wedding. They were very professional and the service was superb. We had so many compliments about the quality of the food.

We had The Striped Pig come to cater for our small wedding at Holesfoot a few weekends ago. The food was AMAZING. They  were so accommodating and flexible throughout the whole booking and planning progress. The communication from their team has been fantastic and they just turned up on the day and cracked on! Everyone has said how tasty all 3 courses were, and the burgers in the evening were a perfect touch.100% recommend to anyone requiring catering for any occasion. Thanks so much again!

We’d been to a wedding previously where The Striped Kitchen catered and we were thrilled to discover that they were the caterers are venue used. The food was delicious, many of our guests were very complimentary and I’m so glad that we decided to have the feasting style menu as it really added to the family feel of the day. We were also very pleased at having a taster meal before hand at our venue to sample the food on offer, it really helped with our decision making. We would recommend The Striped Kitchen

We hired The Striped Pig for my Wife’s 40th Birthday,  we cannot recommend them enough, the communication when we booked, right up until the event has been fantastic, the service on the day was amazing and the food WOW, was absolutely delicious, all our guest’s raved about it, highly recommended, we hope to use you again in the future.

The striped kitchen 100% delivered on our vegan wedding breakfast! We were unsure how guests would react to a menu with no meat but we had so many people commenting on how delicious the food was, even the avid meat eaters were won over! The food was fresh, hot and served really efficiently. The canapes were a really good size and the sharing nature of the main meal was great. We went for the nachos in the evening and they looked and tasted delicious! Our band told us that they broke their own rule of not eating too much before preforming because the food was so good! Overall we were very happy with the food and service on the day and would recommend :)

Steve from Striped Pig came to serve up pulled pork at a big birthday party at our house. We used The Striped Pig at our Tractor Run Event on Sunday 12th May 2024 and they were absolutely fantastic. They served 200 people quickly and efficiently. They were on time, food was hot and fresh, very clean and tidy and every customer said how nice the food was. Would 100% recommend and will definitely use them again. Farmers can be very hard to please but the striped pig were excellent.

We have just had the Striped Pig Hog Roast for our wedding evening food last Saturday for 100 people and oh my god it was incredible. Our guests all raved about it, I wish I had got the gentleman’s name who came from the company but thank you!! Hot food, lots of options of bread and fillings, vegan options, absolutely delicious. Highly recommend

Guys.. I cannot thankyou enough for our wedding at Wyresdale on Thursday.. it really was the best day of our lives and made elite by you guys and the whole team. And also when it came to my last minute changes.. you dealt with them amazing..We will definitely be recommending you to others and just want to thank you all from the bottom of our heart ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ will tag in.more photos when we get more xx

Had an absolutely fabulous day for our garden party!! Service was both professional and friendly from start to finish. We had the BBQ, which was perfect for the event and cross section of ages, and all the guests complimented the food!!( even the "experts" ) Thank you so much. Anna

An elegant and incredible dining experience. The creativity, presentation, hospitality, and overall atmosphere was an absolute delight and left a memorable impression. I can’t wait to return! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

I really enjoyed the atmosphere at the 3 course bar tasting and hope to return for dinner in the dining room one day. The bar was quite interesting considering that it is a 3 Michelin star restaurant. I really wanted to love this experience but it was marred by one of our friends who wanted to drink wine which was quite good, but the cocktails seemed far more interesting as there were many handmade flavored liquors in evidence and the barkeep was very knowledgeable. I did enjoy the food, but again hypercritical comments marred this aspect as well. Great service and nice memoir food gift at the end. Hope to return in the future.

We had dinner inside the kitchen and got to see the disciplined team work and skilled chefs working side-by-side. The best part was perhaps actually engaging with the waiters and cooks as they were all stellar people with interesting backgrounds. We had fun conversations alongside excellent food.The atmosphere of having dinner inside the kitchen is special and I've only done this at Alexander Steakhouse before in the past when they were still doing it.Head and sous are also very involved with their craft, was totally involved the whole time with perfecting each dish...Would definitely recommend due to fine dining and service.

Oh my word!  My sweetheart got us a reservation at the Chef's Table in the Kitchen, and were we ever treated to every conceivable delight the restaurant has to offer!?  I'm really sorry I can't tell you much, as things were very rapid-fire as staff brought one thing and then another, and we were treated to bits of delightfulness that were "extra" of what went out to the tables in the dining room.  This place is worthy of the most special occasion, and I was extremely fortunate that my significant other wanted to share an evening with me, and The Restaurant at Meadowood.  Just look at these photos and try not to find your mouth watering!

One of the most beautiful dining rooms and kitchens I’ve ever had the pleasure dining in.The dining room faces out into the Forrest and you really get he feel for cuisine which focuses on foraging for ingredient in the area.Service was top notch, staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.Wine and cocktail list was extensive.The food however was lacking in my opinion.I can’t fault the execution or technique but the flavor combinations for many of he dishes we not to my liking. And the foraged ingredients....some should have stayed in a the forest. I do understand the philosophy and concept of foraging, but if the produce isn’t up to standard or unavailable from foraging, I’d rather source from farmers and producers instead of risk sticking to foraging for the sake of it.But then again this was my first time dining in a restaurant whose focus foraging and may have unreasonable expectations before coming here.

The definition of a 3-star Michelin is "exceptional cuisine that is worth a special journey". Unfortunately the Spring '19 menu did not meet this high bar, and it is with some consternation that I write this less-than-perfect review, because our experience here was quite wonderful.So let's begin with all that the Restaurant had done right -- the ambiance, the location, and especially the SERVICE. The Restaurant at Meadowood is itself nestled within the resort, up a short but scenic tree-lined drive. The gate man, the valet, the host were all very friendly and attentive, and we were promptly ushered into a calming and serene location -- exposed wood, solid stone, leather chairs, perfectly placed lighting, Zalto glasses, and even a faux tree. The service staff was superb, wonderful (but also appropriate) wine recommendations by the Somm, followed by a consistent and delicate dance of 6 plates hitting the table within 10 seconds during each of the 16+ times they were served and subsequently cleared -- mesmerizing to watch. Also important, taxes and gratuity are included (and the staff helpfully mentioned this again at the end of the meal), saves one from the anxiety and mental gymnastics of calculating a living wage subsidy, guilty of not doing it properly, or the regret of overdoing it.TL;DR: this place was fancy a-f, and tasteful at it.But alas, the crux of Michelin's guide (which navigated us here), is one based in cuisine, and the majority of the dishes left something to be desired. The theme, for the Spring '19 menu, is likely one rooted in ingredients, farm-to-table, hyper-local, [insert buzzword], there is no presentation, no flair, no frills, no pizzazz -- which is something we have grown accustomed to with Michelin "destinations" -- a Disneyland for your mouth; a Broadway play for your palate. This ... was much more simple. Perhaps zen?Prior to the meal, a basket of fresh vegetables was brought out -- perhaps the same that went into our dishes? We were not sure. On asking why the asparagus is white, the presenter just rehearsed the same line (but I Googled it -- it was because it was sun/chlorophyll deprived -- by growing completely submerged in soil or covering with a tarp, the result is a more fibrous and milder ... asparagus).The dishes were brought out one by one, properly spaced, interjected with the few bottles of aptly paired wines we had ordered. However, few were particularly memorable: 1. the salad roll tasted... green; 2. the baby potatoes tasted... like my garden potatoes; 3. the beignet chestnut had a good texture; 4. the miso oyster nasturtium (a perennial weed) was fresh; 5. the white asparagus was cooked and chilled to perfection, the pacific rock crab and wild onion flavorful; 6. the escabeche of broccoli clams tasted of al dente broccoli, and fine textured clams; 7. the caviar smoked tendon cultured butter sabayon was DELICIOUS, like a perfectly integrated red wine it just all melded together -- this was the single dish we probably came for; 8. abalone and cabbage, meh; 9. local sole cover crop, meh; 10. duck tea followed by pekin duck, had much better in Beijing, the risotto (specifically noted that it was made with CA rice! i.e. Cal-rose which accounts for more than 90% of rice consumed in the US?) was on the salty side and did not quite showcase the duck; 11. the slow cooked pork collar, interesting kohlrabi texture but taste was lacking; 12. black truffle veined blue cheese with beeswax pear and charter oak bread -- this screamed "lazy chef", the blue cheese completely overpowered any truffle aroma, olfactory or taste; 13. yogurt cultured with almond blossoms rhubarb sorrels - not sure what the almond flowers did for this dish, but the presentation was somewhat pretty, tasted like yogurt; 14. bay leaf ice cream with a chocolate ball over a bay leaf sprig - good and unique ice cream flavor, perfect texture; 15. last bites - cute box, but snacks were reminiscent of Asian grocery store knick knacks.In sum... good food? Yes. "Exceptional cuisine that is worth a special journey?" No.

Wholeheartedly deserves all three of its Michelin stars. Unlike other restaurants of this caliber that I have visited the restaurant at Meadowood focuses on presenting ingredients in their whole and nearly complete form. The creativity and effort that goes into each dish is stunning. Service operated like a highly coordinated and well-oiled machine. The parking can be a bit difficult if there is another event like a wedding taking place at the same time. Plus tax and tip a bit over $700 makes this a place that I will only visit once every decade or so but I'm glad that I came.

For our 20th anniversary we chose 20 of the best restaurants in the Bay Area. Meadowood is clearly one of the best, but not 5 stars for both of us. Meadowood is definitely at the top end of high-end restaurants, and the man at the gate assumed we were heading to the grill when we pulled up in our 15-year-old Minivan for dinner. Certainly that was a safe assumption considering the cost of a meal here.Meadowood is exactly what you expect from a top quality restaurant. Everything about the experience is polished. After the meal we were even invited to tour the amazing kitchen and found out that you can have a special meal in there!We had a huge variety of dishes, many of which were the best of their kind among all the great restaurants we have been to. Like others have mentioned in their reviews the desserts are not quite up to par with the rest of the meal. The Oil Oil Pudding we had was great, but the candied garden was not special.Why not 5 stars? Certainly the meal and experience at the restaurant were 5 star quality, however my wife had severe stomach issues after the meal. She often had stomach issues after these large tasting menus, but this was beyond that. I had no issues at all, and the meal had so many different items that impossible to know what the problem was.

I've been to the Meadowood twice and it continues to be a Yountville favorite. The restaurant focus on quality over quantity with thoughtful dishes driven by fresh ingredients. We attended one of their 12 days of Christmas holiday dinners featuring guest chefs. The meal was fabulous, integrating flavors from the guest chef with favorite Meadowood classics.

Attended their 12 Days of Christmas dinner on Day 7 with Chef Yoshi Takazawa from Japan. A fabulous Christmas gift to myself. Must try dinner experience if you are a foodie. Will definitely return to try their tasting menu. Some highlights below.

We stopped here when we were in town for a quick dinner, and were very satisfied with our choices. The service was nice and the restaurant had a great environment and was clean. The food was fantastic and we barely got any pictures of it before we started eating. The basil chicken, fried rice, and black noodles, and mango sticky rice were all fantastic.

Had take away but enjoyed the interior deco. The Spicy shrimp tempura is excellent with the tomyum sauce.Papaya salad is alright. Needs Kore Thai zing to it.Drunken noodle is deliciousBasil chicken is nothing great.Sweet sour prawn is just OK.Will be back to sit and dine in. Which should be a diff experiencre. Thanks

Outstanding food taste, very chill restaurant.I went on a weekday and the table was fully booked. You need to queue if you want if you walk in.I ordered the noodles and an appetizer, the taste was good, just to be sure you ate in hot condition.Do have a try when you visit this village area.

Went with the family to celebrate and for a couple of drinks. We took our own wine of course. The room was loud and felt I had to yell to have a conversation. Our waiter was great . Wow, pretty amazing place with a stunning decor of scoops of fishes and jellyfish of all kinds serving as lights, the food was excellent with the curry, pad Thai and rice being very tasty. This place is definitely worth its rating!The service was awesome! The food was served pretty fast! The food was super yummy!!!At first, I kinda doubted its high rating (at 4.6). I love this place because the food is amazing for dine in but also take out. I get take out all the time, especially the peanut noodle soup. Try the papaya salad, it’s delish. Also the tempura mushrooms. Delicious cocktails and service is always great. Thank you!

Wow! We are blown away and we wished we would have found this place much much sooner. The ceviche was fantastic, the pork belly flavorful, the fish beautifully seasoned and fried, and the lomo was delicious! Our server Kristen was fantastic and she made our first experience here memorable. The cocktails are also super good. Portions are really great. The music was a vibe.

One of the best restaurants in the East Bay for Peruvian cuisine. The food, service, and atmosphere were all very good for going out on a Saturday night. It's a lively and loud space, but it makes it fun and exciting to be in. The dining area has a dark and rustic look to it and is pretty clean, even for an extremely busy night. That being said, do make sure that you get a reservation before coming to the restaurant, as it is very popular. The place has some great quality food, which is a bit more of the pricey end, but you're paying for that quality. Make sure you try the chicken, as it is what they're known for. The drinks are also pretty good, although I felt that they did short me on the alcohol for the price. The bar itself has a wide selection of liquors and a pretty good beer and wine list. Overall, an exciting place to get some great Peruvian food.Parking: Pretty hard to find street parking, but there is a paid parking garage not too far away.Kid-friendliness: You can take kids here, but it has more of an adult-only feel.

This place was beyond my expectations food and ambience was magnificent.  Took my daughter to celebrate her bday.  Overall service was great except for a delayed on one of our plate order while others were almost done with their food.  I really recommend this restaurant. I think I will be going there again. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

We enjoyed a very fresh and tasty Peruvian late lunch here on Sunday, and though they didn't have my favorite Peruvian beers, they did have a locally brewed Peruvian style lager that was very tasty. The Arroz Con Mariscos were some of the best I've had in recent years, rice not overcooked, and Jalea was also crisp and fresh.  The Tres Leches for dessert and Peruvian coffee were in a word, perfect! Excellent staff!

The experience was just ok. The empanadas and the short rib were both good. The truffle Mac n cheese was not seasoned. We were a party of 8 and came early. Server took 20 minutes to even take our order for drinks. She just dropped off the waters and didn’t come back for 20 minutes. She took our drinks and food order at the same time and the drinks came out after the food. The entrees even came out before the appetizers. The gratuity for large parties is automatic which I believe could have been the cause of the slow service because she knew she’d get a 20 percent tip regardless. This is coming from a fellow waitress.

Great restaurant in the heart of Walnut Creek. This place gets busy and i do  recommend a reservation. The service is excellent, the hosting to the waiting staff with a cozy ambiance. . The Peruvian food is wonderful if you like to have a new flavor in your palette. You have seafood options and meat. The ceviche was one of my favorites with the full bar loved the smoked old fashion. Would definitely bring friends and family to this location.

One of my favorite places to take business partners, friends and family when they come to town. This place fires on all cylinders when it comes to impressing with a punch. Tradition french restaurant vibesFood was good and there’s a wide selection of oysters, seafood and other french dishes.The place was a little stuffy and we were not able to open the window.I ordered the coffee and miniatures desserts, slightly too sweet for me.Overall the vibe is lively and in a vibrant area, though nothing surprising.

I think this is one of the traditional french restaurants with a cozy decoration.The onion soup is wonderful, the sweetness from the onion and the soup is not salty.The mussel pot tastes brilliant. A simple way to cook lights up the freshness of the mussel.The sea bass is surprisingly well. Crunchy skin with a moist fish meat.

Went here for dinner my one night in Paris and it was amazing! The restaurant itself was so beautiful and the staff were very professional and friendly. My friend and I started with snails and oysters. They were both dishes I was trying for the first time and they were both so delicious and definitely things I’d have again. Then I got their duck with scalloped potato’s which was also very good. Everything was very well cooked and it was actually impressive how fast all the food came out. I’m so glad this was my first experience dining in Paris. Highly recommend and hope I’d get an opportunity to come back one day.

Food portions were decent size and tasted good but just a little mild on the seasoning (based on our taste buds). We initially had an entire room to ourselves upstairs (early dinner walk-in). Our server was very nice. Loved the little pig merengues that they gave us at the end. The theme inside was so cute. Note: not every dish has pork so if you don’t eat it it’s ok. You have other options.

D E L I C I O U S food! The French onion soup was SPOT ON ⭐ We got the steak and the duck (both very tasty, but that duck was 👌👌👌👌). The scallop potatoes with the duck were AMAZING, and the fries with steak with fresh fresh fresh. That creme brule was the cherry on top!They also have a great selection of wines 🍷Note: Europeans do not rush their food, so if you're in a rush, this is not the place to go. But if you do come here, you'll definitely remember these flavours!

Thank you for an amazing evening! The friendly service, authentic atmosphere, and delicious food made it unforgettable. The beef tartare is one of the best I've had so far—perfectly seasoned and beautifully presented. The attention to detail in every dish was impressive, and the staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable experience. The ambiance was warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a cozy night out. I can't wait to return and explore more of the menu!

Best restaurant in Paris .. Especially oysters and snails were very nice and fresh. Red meat was a bit tough, we changed it and preferred chicken. Creme brulee was delicious. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Ok food for the price. I typically go for chicken teriyaki because it's around $10 to get meat, boiled veggies, and rice.I wouldn't really recommend anything else because the food quality isn't that good for the other stuff. Though it's not bad - my first order was a beef bento and I'll never order that again!You can ask for more veggies vs rice. You can also ask for more sauce once you get your order. It's the same sauce for everything.They cook all the meat on one side of the grill and the rest of the food on another grill. The sushi is made in the kitchen/behind the cashier.Depending on when you get your food, you may need to wait a while (~20 mins) until they cook a batch of chicken - even though you may spot some cooked chicken on standby to be placed on a tray.The waiting line is like an assembly line - you order & pay and roughly follow your tray on the bar holder above the grill. They may or may not call your order # so I think it's better to roughly guess which tray is yours and follow it.

We had the just had the beef teriyaki and we really liked it. It was super tasty. Honestly I can comprehend the low rating. I would definitely eat here again! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 … More

My friend suggested this place for lunch about a month back and it's pricey but I would go back, preferably to dine in the next time. Since it was our first time we ordered a few things to share on the go. Beef satay which was good with a nice kick of flavor. There were between 5 or 6 of them and they were a good size. The shrimp dumplings and the vegetable dumplings were fresh and good and my friend preferred them more than I did but I'm not a dumpling person. I did try the vegetable dumplings and I did like them because the filling was awesome and had a nice crunch to them. For an entree we had the Hot Basil stir fry with beef, magnificent flavor, freshness, and seasonings. Nice kick of heat without being over powering. I would reorder that in a heartbeat.

Hot Basil has been a standby Thai Restaurant on New Park Ave for many years now. I had not visited this eatery for quite some time.  I was greeted by some happy young girls who were learning the ropes. I ordered a common Thom Khar soup with chicken and Pad Thai for a main dish.  The soup was not as rich in coconut as some, but had the lovely flavor and aroma with lemongrass.The pad Thai was a generous portion and very flavorful.Any time one has the craving for some good Thai food, this is the place to go.

The food was amazing. We ordered the Drunken Noodles and the Sriracha Pad Thai and would highly recommend both dishes! The girls at the front counter were very sweet, polite and professional! The other staff we interacted with was also very welcoming. The food was so fresh, we had a bit of a drive home and even once we were able to dig in, the food was still piping hot! The price was great as well. We ordered online for pick-up and were able to use a 25% off coupon! All in all a great experience and we will definitely be returning very soon.Parking: About 4 spots directly in front of the restaurant.

Got take out, it was great. They have a whole separate vegan menu. I got Drunken Noodles with Steamed Tofu. Nice cozy place for a date, great atmosphere,  friendly staff. I'll definitely be back, try more and will follow up here.Vegetarian options: Ask for the vegan menu, it has a great variety.

Absolutely delicious, and very fresh food! The lady who served us was extremely nice and very patient while we figured out what to order. Once we ordered, the food came out quite fast. I got Drunken noodles, which was spicy, but also flavorful, with perfectly cooked veggies. My date got the sweet chili salmon, which was cooked to perfection, with a crispy skin to die for! I absolutely plan on coming here again, whether it's for takeout or dining in.

Best pad Thai I've had in CT.  Great option if you're in the mood for Thai food. Crab Rangoons are solid too.  Overall the food is great, but there's a spice/vegetable that is in a few things that I could do without (tastes like spicy licorice). The price is a bit high too, but that may just be a function of inflation... Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 Recommended dishes

My food did not make it home! I enjoyed it to the fullest. I’m glad I did not listen to some of these reviews. I am satisfied! Inside was clean and cute. The girl who took my order was friendly and patient with me. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

I'm no stranger to Thai food. It's hot, it's sweet, it's sour and complex. But Hot Basil is one of the few places that gets it right! I came here today with my mom because I wanted something that would properly clear out my sinuses. The first thing that struck me was the decor. There were plants everywhere! Due to this, the air in the restaurant was crisp and fresh, and I didn't realize how much I appreciated that until I left. The place was cozy but not cramped at all and I enjoyed the quiet buzz of conversation from the other patrons. My mum got the Thai iced tea and it was yummy and fresh. We got the chicken satay for an app and the peanut sauce that it comes with is nothing short of f&$king delicious. The lunch combo comes with soup and spring rolls. I opted for the tom yum chicken soup, which was hot, sour, and loaded with fresh veggies and tender morsels of chicken. I ordered the drunken noodles with pork, and holy hot sauce, it was packed with flavor. You could tell that the veggies were fresh and that everything is hand selected. My meal was about $15 after everything was said and done. I'm definitely coming back

HBTC creates distinct excellent flavors for all its classic Thai dishes. The Coconut Chicken soup was citrusy delicious and intense as was the hot and sour shrimp soup which had a complex and rather spicy savory broth. The spicy wings were both crispy and delicate and even the spicy pork dumplings were a savory mouthful. The stir fry and coconut curry were excellent and again distinctive. Worth both a detour and a repeat visit!

Everything about this place was amazing! Small very quaint quiet with nice music in the background. No bar but it's a byob. The food was amazing I had salmon with a sweet chili sauce and it tasted just as amazing as it looked! The food was plated beautifully I felt like I was at a MasterChef restaurant we had chicken curry puffs and beef satay for appetizers and everything was fabulous... They seem to do a very good business there but the majority of it was take out. I will definitely be back..hope this was helpful..plz don't forget to hit  LIKE if it was

We love the vegan friendly options here, and Preeti, the server is a sweetheart. The vegan meat tikka masala tasted off this visit but everything else was perfect, the coconut mushroom curry is my favorite.Vegetarian options: Lots of vegan options much more important than "vegetarian"Kid-friendliness: My kid loves this place and the lassi.

To stretch a little bit and create a parallel, new deli cuisine is to Indian cuisine, what Parisian cuisine is to French cuisine. With more influences and cultures concentrated at the same table as opposed to more traditional fare.Nonetheless, Krishna, the owner here and Amin the chef, take what they do very seriously, and this neighborhood is blessed for it.I've been eating Indian food my entire life and this is among one of the greatest dining experiences I have ever had eating Indian food of any kind at a restaurant.I always start with something that is a staple of a restaurant. So I ordered the butter chicken and the korma curry with vegetables, some garlic naan and a mango lassie.Right away. When the items arrived at my table, I could smell the herbs, and spices, and upon first taste, I was very happy. There was no extra sugar, salt, or anything except real, natural flavor cooked by a Master Chef in each one of these dishes.The butter chicken was absolutely spectacular, and the korma curry deeper, and richer than any I have had before. The garlic naan was absolutely perfect, and the mango lasse, and not from a mix.Talking with Krishna who is a delightful host, she explained some of the principles of New Delhi cuisine to me, and how she had pride in her restaurant and her food, and it shows. This is a wonderful place, and it costs a little bit more, but it is worth every penny. I cannot recommend this place highly enough, and the atmosphere service and the people there in general are just divine.Vegetarian options: This restaurant has a wide variety of delicious vegetarian options

I often do delivery from here, and everything I've had has been excellent. Their channa masala is quite spicy, so I get medium at most on that but usually opt for spicy on everything else. Been eating their food for years now and it's always fantastic. The few times I've eaten in the restaurant it's been comfortable and quiet with great service. Love this place!

Really nice local Indian diner in Albany. We got papdi chaat, daal makhani, malai kofta, butter chicken, and uttapam with some sweet lassis and beers on the side. The group favorite was easily the malai kofta- super creamy and rich. In my opinion, the daal could use a bit more flavor/salt.Overall the food and ambiance was really good. Recommend for locals and perfect for Cal and other local students if they’re craving Indian food.

The food is good.The spicy calibration is set a little lower than what I'm accustomed to in the South Bay. The "hot" spicy level here equates to a South Bay "mild to medium".Recommend you give it a try. 😁

Dehli Diner serves delicious North and South Indian food in a beautiful, upscale setting. The colors of the decor and table settings are warm and inviting. You want to get a table and stay a while.I had the saag dosa (spinach), which comes with sambar and coconut chutney. Excellent! The dosa had just the right amount of spice for me. I asked for mild, which was enough to taste, but not overpowering. There are three dosas on the menu, all gluten free. There are other gluten free options too, including uttapam.Service was prompt and attentive. Note that there's no tipping here. The restaurant adds a service charge to your bill.Highly recommended! Can't wait to return.

Delicious halal traditional Afghani food.Our dishes were juicy and tender and we would frequent Kabul when we worked in the area.They accommodate large parties and it was nice to reserve for work events and celebrations as well.They also are accommodating for dietary restrictions.

Friendly, family-owned Afghan restaurant. They have consistently provided tasty traditional Afghan food for many years now. Salmon, lamb, beef, and chicken kebabs are all very well seasoned, and the rice is addictively good!  Large parking lot makes it easy to find parking. It’s a bit on the pricy side ($30+ for a dinner entree), but worth the splurge whenever you’re in the mood for Afghan food.

I’ve been here twice and both experiences were excellent! The staff is incredible and both dining rooms are lovely. Everything I’ve tried is delicious and the portions are pretty generous for an upscale restaurant like this. My favorites have been the carpaccio, the beet salad, the pork, and the short rib. The creme brûlée is solid and I loved the seasonal galette. Oh and the bread is amazing. I tried the salmon on my most recent visit and found the sauce to be pretty watery, but it was still good. My only wish is that they change the menu more from season to season. We went in February and again in July and most of the items on the menu were the same.

It is stuck away on 35, and the drive there is very scenic (however super dark when you leave late evening).The setting is just like inside a rustic old house, with super friendly staffs.   Wines are reasonably priced but some exclusive offerings as well.  But we ended up ordering their cocktail special which was bourbon with lemons and pineapple juice… very refreshing.For appetizer we ordered the sea scallops which were done perfectly, and stuffed quails which i preferred the skin to be a bit more crispy but overall not bad.  For main course I had the wide mushroom fettuccine and it was good.  We also had the pork loin  which I didn’t care too much about.  Maybe it was just overshadowed by the fettuccine.We end the night with a lemon tart and crème brûlée, but the highlight was a surprise bday chocolate cake by our friendly server.

Every mouth full was full of fabulous flavors. I have dietary restrictions and the staff and chef accommodated them easily and without making me feel like I was a problem.Between my husband and I we had scallops, quail, venison, and flourless chocolate cake. Would happily order it all again. The french syrah was a lovely accompaniment. - pictures include scallops, quail, venison, and my flourless chocolate cake without the cream.Dietary restrictions: tell them your restrictions when you reserve. talk with your waiter. they will talk with the chef and determine what accommodations are needed - if any. I didn't feel cheated in any way. each mouthful was wonderful.

We had a perfect evening at The Mountain House.  The food was memorable:  the venison was cooked and seasoned perfectly, accompanied by beautiful roasted and pureed sunchokes; the deboned and stuffed quailed was sublime; the corn soup with prawns was amazing; the peach and almond galette was crispy yet soft with an incredible creme fraiche ice cream.  But our favorite was the stunning and memorable Fettucine with chanterelle and mascarpone cream sauce.  I've had a lot of great pasta dishes in my life (flour & water and Cotogna in San Francisco, Piccola Cucina Estiatorio in New York, and the best places in Italy)... the Fettucine at Mountain House is the best pasta dish I've ever had, period.My Vieux Carre cocktail was perfectly diluted and mixed with care.  Really delicious.  The wine list is well crafted with a lot of great options and the wine markup is low  (they had a 1986 Mouton Rothschild that retails at $1000 for $1250).The atmosphere is remarkable.  The front room is fun and boisterous, filled with locals and tourists alike. The atrium room is gorgeous and romantic.  The decor, hand-picked by co-owner Will is nostalgic, whimsical, and fun.The service is very attentive and friendly.We loved our evening at the mountain house and can't wait to go back.

Good food and an amazing atmosphere combine for a magical experience.Nestled within the forested mountains adjacent to Silicon Valley, the Mountain House is a local institution. It's new owners have sustained it as a place worth the drive.Walking in from the redwood forest, you enter into the bar room, appointed in an immaculately rustic style. Custom and traditional cocktails await you. I was surprised to find a milk punch being served; the bartender and I chatted about the lengthy process one must go through to craft such a beverage. My wife enjoyed that libation while I drank their riff on the classic Churchill, with a burnt cinnamon stick in place of a cigar.If I wanted to take visitors to a scenic bar for a drink, the Mountain House has already justified its presence.However, the star attraction is dinner within the Forest Room. Elevated thirty feet from the forest floor, with walls and ceiling made of glass, one is treated to dining within the redwoods. I would recommend waiting up to an hour for a table within this very special environment.The food is good and the prix-fixe is at the lower end of a fine dining experience. We both enjoyed the roast quail starter -- truly, the star of our meal. My wife enjoyed the short ribs, while I had a decent venison rack. For desert, she enjoyed something off menu -- a wonderful fusion of pecan pie, chocolate cake, and tarte. Mine, a peach galette was just a mess of dense dough with little fruit.The service was nice, helpful, though inexperienced, with the exception of the bartenders. Without the atmosphere or location, this is probably a place you'd go to once, enjoy, but never make a return trip. But add those elements in, and you'll happily go back.

Came for valentine's dinner!Overall the cooking here is quite good. The meats especially were superb. The filet minion, duck breast, grilled quail, and foie gras were all excellent. The dishes in general were well constructed with an interesting mix of ingredients complementing the centerpieces well. The trend in utilizing some more local variations on mainstays added unique flair to each one.Drinks were pretty strong and fairly creative. It is worth getting a cocktail or two.If we may offer a critique: we felt the dessert course was a little weak. The Panna Cotta was bit overpowered by the passion fruit jelly topping, and the Hazelnut Tart while good, was not really outstanding in any way.We do plan on visiting again, overall the meal was compelling, so I'm pretty excited to explore their day to day menu.Edit Apr 2024:Had my family birthday dinner here with 8 and it was truly a memorable meal. Service was excellent. We were accidentally served sour wine but they of course quickly corrected this graciously. The food came out all fabulously. Personally I was fascinated by the stuffed quail made somehow boneless except for legs and wings. The rack of venison was uniquely herbaceous. My favorite dish I tried was the scallops, exceptionally fresh presented on a savory background of roasted onion. 😋Everyone was well impressed by the meal and I'm sure we'll all be back in the future.Vegetarian options: Decent options for vegetarians, but most of the selections involves meat or fish.Parking: A parking lot exists, but it is not well paved as it fits within the trees. It can get full during busy hours, you may need to park along the highwayKid-friendliness: Not meant for kids.

Update on their reserved back rooms with a pre set 3 course meal.....Delicious!  The quail and venison were my favorites : )Recent reopened under new ownership and doing the former legacy right.  Lovely mountain vibe and elevated elegance.   A destination restaurant with private parking which includes a Tesla home charging station and dedicated handicap parking.Excellent food and wonderful staff await your reserved table... be sure to book in advance during the busy weekends.  Full bar and a causal atmosphere which is very welcoming and inviting.  Enjoy : )Vegetarian options: AvailableParking: Off street gravel parking available

Celebrated a birthday dinner here for my brother and sister in law and the service was more delightful than I've experienced in any 5 star Bay Area restaurant in many years. Truly nice hostess, attentive, friendly (but not fake obsequious) helpful wait staff and the little extra touches were a lovely touch from what I'd thought was a bygone era. The food was delicious, every course, and my mom who is hard to please, ate every bite. The menu is varied but leans more towards traditional, however, the first courses have more modern offerings. A perfect choice when you're trying to find a fine dining restaurant that really delivers superb service and can deliver more traditional menu items with still enough choice for those who are less meat-centric.

Stumbled on this accidentally after a hike in the park, turns out there are several Michelin Star Chefs that own this place and are living their best lives, to the benefit of all of us!Food was incredible and a unique experience. It’s not often you get to experience quality plating at this level more casually.The staff were genuine, warm, and passionate. The kind of staff you only get from good owners/managers.The prices were shockingly low for what this is. This is a chef run kitchen with serious ingredients and plating.Portions are small because ingredients are expensive at this quality, as is the preparation.If you’re a fan of bread pudding, the pumpkin custard bread pudding is a genuine treat/experience! It’s subtle, but incredible on texture and moistness!Special thanks to Ally for being so accommodating and to Robin for being so competent and genuine. We’ve been to the best of the best around Half Moon Bay and felt the most special about our anniversary here!Keep living your dream, and compliments to the staff/kitchen!

One of the best dining experiences I’ve ever had! The food was delicious, with every bite full of flavor. The building itself was gorgeous with the main dining hall modeled after a log cabin and the Forest Room having glass walls and ceiling. It looked stunning in the afternoon sun! The service was also outstanding. We came without a reservation and asked to be seated in the Forest Room, and while they couldn’t at the moment we walked in, they checked in throughout our service to see if they could move us. All in all, it was an outstanding dining experience and I would certainly come again.

Taste :4.6/5Environment: 4.1/5Service：4.1/5Saigon Seafood Harbor at Sunnyvale is the real deal when it comes to authentic Dim Sum in NorCal., they have traditional Dim Sum carts rolling right up to your table for you to pick and choose from. Nice dim sums with traditional dim sum cart. Loved the gold lava buns, steamed chicken feet, steamed pork rib, soy mai, and Portuguese style egg tart.We have tried dim sum at here, H.L. Peninsula, Lei Garden, Grand Dynasty in south bay area, here by far has the most delicious dim sum in this neighbor.

I love pushcart dim sum restaurants, and this one doesn't disappoint. This place offers traditional dim sum dishes, albeit a bit pricey. Listen— if you don’t like the hustle and bustle of a place with family parties filled to the brim with carts runnin everywhere—🌞  move aside so I can have a seat because this is one of the best dim sum places I’ve ever been in the Bay— and there’s a lot of great places around!This place has ruined me forever— in the best way and ppl looking to order— don’t know where to start? Gurlll I gotchu:蛋挞Egg tart (the crust is flaky and light, with a delicious subtle sweet custard— coming together to melt in your mouth)芝麻包Seasame Bun (sweet hot runny seasame filling in a bun— so good. Wish I was in town for a winter day to enjoy it!)虾饺Har gow(shrimp dumplings, they are bigger than I thought they would be— and so yummy!)凤爪 Chicken feet (comes with like the most flavorful skin, tendons, and cartilage ever— for people who enjoy tendons and cartilage in meat dishes!)芥蓝 Gai-Lan (Chinese broccoli, the perfect veggie to pair with your meat focused dim sum!!)I also spotted puddin? In carts, uhhh those fried crispy taro dim sum, siumai/shaomai/shumai, uhhh tossed rick-cakes which were soo tasty, umm 排骨was really tasty too, there was also dumplings 三鲜（shrimp+chives) styleThis is a seafood centric place so they had options for tasty noodles plates with lobster or crab in em! (I can’t speak for how good they are cuz I am unable to eat crab-lobster) but they looked super delicious too.There are a million other dishes here! But don’t get intimidated :)) and if you just point to what you are interested in— the servers are pretty understanding and will bring it to you. I was here for the first time but they were super nice too!Also I think they do different tea options— I had the 菊花茶-chrysanthemum and it was tasty 👍 it was steeped just enough!

This place has been around for ages so I originally didn't feel the need to review. I loved this place as a kid and wanted to eat here for my birthday occasionally. Later on, my coworkers liked to come here for lunch. The food was going downhill at the time but the place was famous for their taro buns, which my boss usually tried to go for. The service is so slow here, he used to grab the plates and chopsticks from that wooden shelf himself.What I like about this place is that they have a dim sum menu that lists some platters that are not available on the carts, like the surfer clam mifen, xo rice cakes, fried turnip cakes, and some special desserts (fried almond pudding). All that is missing is a sticky rice chicken.The workers are pretty rude and they prefer you to order from their carts for obvious reasons. The managers are quite perfunctory as well. You know, the norm for dim sum places in the bay. But don't let that deter you because there is a great variety of dishes and it has been coming out hot the last two times I went.
Overall Food is averageA little priceyFried rice is nice

Excellent food and service !First time dining here.  We celebrated a special birthday with 11 people. Always 5 stars when I visit here. The pizza and pasta is always the best no matter what I order from them it’s always top notch. Unique and pretty tasty if a bit of a nickel and dime charges (no refill on drinks including tea). Good food with an all you can eat option. All you can eat includes meat (beef, pork, shrimp) but not unlimited broth (hot pot) and only two small servings of noodles. Service is hit and miss, but is fairly quick.

Duuuuuuude... I'd never been to a hot-pot place before. This was a pretty cool deal. Order some meat and veggies, order a pot of broth, have a cool dinner experience in a very conversation-conducive atmosphere. I really liked it. Sounds kind of silly, but it was a bit uncomfortable actually. Maybe if it wasn't a real cool evening that would have been different. Guess I'll just have to try it again!

This restaurant is consistently amazing!! It’s difficult to pick a favorite dish since their curries and noodle dishes are so spectacular (and I also highly recommend the mango fresh rolls). Ordered the fried tofu pad Thai and was very impressed that their prices on DoorDash are the exact same as the regular menu. I do wish they were on Uber eats though. The pad Thai itself had a good portion and was impressed that they included some carrots and lettuce as vegetable garnish alongside the standard bean sprouts. Wish they offered fried bean sprouts as a garnish option instead. The fried tofu was nice and crispy and creamy on the inside. Portion sizes are pretty good and the spicy option was perfect for my taste buds. Did wish there were some bolder traditional Thai flavors of sweet and sour.
Pad Thai and fresh roll were really tasty. Great price at lunch. Doordash pickup was super fast and owner was very friendly.

The ingredients used in the food and the fruits seemed fresh. We ordered medium and spicy dishes but even the spicy version wasn't as spicy as other Thai restaurants. The service was good with friendly servers. If you're looking for proper ambience then you'll be disappointed but if you don't mind the small Asian restaurant ambience then it'll be all good. On the whole, I was pleasantly impressed with the joint and would come back to the place.

I ordered the paradise dum biriyani and tandoori chicken, I must say, those two pair very well with each other. Now, plating was not of a fancy restaurant which I didn't expect it to be, but the portions were more than reasonable and both entrees tasted good. However, my favorite was the dessert, the Gajar ka halwa was delicious! A perfect dessert to indulge, a must try. I will be returning very soon!

Great place to have Indian food and they are in initial stage at the moment. The hospitality is really good and they take each order and make it so it would take time but you will get your food which tastes good. They also offer the Indian spice level which normally people say in other restaurants that we would have Indian spice but they taper down usually but here in this restaurant we can explicitly mention the hottest spice and they will cater to our requirement.Rumali roti , I am a big fan of this kind of bread but I could not find a proper place that serves this bread. This is the place where you get the 85% of the traditional taste of the bread variant. I would recommend this.I am a vegetarian and I like the taste here.My friend tried Goat Biryani and we taste a lot of food in the area nearby and he said this would be the best goat biryani in the surrounding area.Starters really shine with the proper spice and taste.Please mention your spice level appropriately when they ask as the Indian spice would be too hot but may be you can say them to make it mild or spicy based on your choice.The salt quantity could be also mentioned while ordering the food. As they tend to taper down the salt in the food to appeal to majority of people who are getting health conscious.Finally it’s a good placeVegetarian options: There is a decent selection of vegetarian options. And the good part is we can order catering and they follow the Indian tradition and cook accordingly is what I got the work from the person I spoke to.Parking: It is a typical restaurant and it has decent parking in the complex itself. This also shares the building with couple of other stores.

Eating here won't break the bank; it might just break your diet, but who cares when food is this deliciously affordable!

This is Amici's NEW North Oakland Cloudkitchen! I love that more and more cloudkitchens are popping up because it makes it suuuper quick and easy to order for pick up or delivery.
