It was a breeze to order my food and pick it up!I ordered the kale and sausage pizza, an absolute FAVORITE of mine. I love how thin and crunchy the crust was. I also tried a new one - the impossible meat pizza and WOW I couldn't even tell it wasn't meat!

My new favorite pizza joint in the East Bay!  I can’t believe it’s taken me this long to discover Amici’s. I lived in New Haven, CT, back in the ‘90s, and Amici’s rivals the revered East Coast pizza parlors. So glad you guys are here in Oakland, CA.  THE BEST!

Some of the best Detroit style pizza I’ve had in New Jersey! People say the Jersey shore doesn’t have a lot of good pizza, but they have not been to this place!I got pepperoni, plain, Burrata next time I will get something more adventures like the Buffalo chicken but my friend and I inhaled all the slices on the way to the car! Also Tried a single Patty Smashburger.

Really good Detroit style pizza with some type of Parmesan in the crust making it extra crispy, cheesy, and delicious. At least as good or better than other Detroit pizzas I’ve had outside of Michigan (e.g., Via 313, Emmy Squared) because the crust was so light. Pizza was ready for pickup 20 minutes after I called which was awesome, they were cranking out pizzas. Not sure if I would eat there as they don’t do slices and it’s kind of small/dark inside

Walked in and ordered, customer service was fantastic. They had only a few styles but we tried the pepperoni with hot honey and Four cheese. Both were amazing. The crust was light and bouncy and they was a cheese crust around the edge which was a great touch. Would absolutely come back again to try more styles. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Pepperoni Pizza … More

Stopped by to grab slices on our way home. It was our first time here, and the pizza was delicious!! Thick and airy, and we appreciated that there slices to let us try different kinds. The service was also great. Even with a broken hand, the young man who worked there was attentive and doing it all. Excited to return next time we are in Beach Haven.

Stopped in, not knowing what to expect.  These guys are doing a great job!!Like a Sicilian pizza but lighter.  They have great creative toppings.(Bacon OnionJam!!Burratta!!)Mushrooms were great.  (Sausage needs to be better) Small but nice.  Outdoor seatting.Owners are great and working hard!!Can’t wait till spring- they will be closed after September.

DO IT!! A must try! We were a little bit skeptical at the price tag but can safely say it’s more than worth it. As people who had never had Detroit style pizza we didn’t realize HOW GOOD it was going to be! Super high quality ingredients, kind owner/employees, and fun options for pies. We had the burrata with basil and are going to be craving it for a long time!!

If you’re looking for a good pizza, this place is awesome! A little pricey, but worth it. The dough is like focaccia and Sicilian combined, airy, fluffy, crunchy, and delicious. Ask about the specials too. Can’t go wrong ordering from here. 👍🏼 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

So happy Queen City Crust has a permanent location!! The best Detroit style pizza I’ve had. And their smash burgers are also delicious! QCC is a must get on the island! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Never had Detroit style before, was truly delicious! Usually a corner slice is last to be eaten,  but the Crust… so delicious. These pies are made with care and quality ingredients! Brought wine and sat outside, excellent Pepperoni , it was outstanding. We will be back!

This was amazing pizza. Crust was a delicious focaccia texture. Crispy, cheesy, goodness with fresh burrata and basil on top. Clearly made with consideration and love. Can’t wait to come back! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

First time here after many years of driving past this place. Was hesitant due to a 4.4 rating, but gave it a go. Food is about a 3.5-3.7, as I ordered Memphis ribs which were not tender and quite dry. I let the waitress know, but I decided to just eat what was on the plate not to waste that food. Collard greens were good, nothing stood out, stewed with tomatoes, Mac n cheese seemed bland to some degree. As others mentioned, the cornbread is the standout item. My waitress was exceptional and the vibe is cool. Not sure if I’d go back for ribs. Price is about on par with other bbq spots, $29 for the plate. Think my Dr Pepper was $4.50? That’s insane. The key lime pie was good $7.

The food is good, but the vibe is better and the service great! Even though the brisket is a bit dry, it is tasty. The beef rib is good, but the piece we got had a bit too much grease. Maybe you can tell the waiter to choose a less greasy one if you don’t fancy that. I would repeat the experience. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Heard this place was comparable to authentic Texas BBQ from a Texas friend. The portions, presentation and menu were promising of a bbq restaurant, however the overall quality and preparation of the dishes was a little disappointing. The tri-tip for example was dry and needed alot of bbq sauce to be saved. The Brisket was very fatty, mac cheese wasn't my fav style, and the fries were alittle too crispy. The corn bread alone saved the day, as well as the sauces offered at the table. Service was good, and the space is clean and simple.

Same delicious original recipes PLUS a entirely new innovative Plant Based BBQ Menu for all the Vegan and Vegetarians out there!!  I ordered the Country Fried Tofu sandwich which was GIGANTIC, so so delicious and completely filling. I am definitely returning to try the other plant based entrées! AMAZING! This is my new favorite vegan spot.Vegetarian options: New Plant Based Entrées and sidesDietary restrictions: Vegan , vegetarian, dairy freeKid-friendliness: Very kid friendly

Baby Blues in back and better than ever! We loved the new vegan barbecue options—the fried tofu sandwich is incredible and so flavorful and crispy. And we loved the old stalwarts—they have the best brisket on the west side!The redone space is bright and inviting and our server Anna was so attentive and helpful. I will be coming back soon!Vegetarian options: The vegan options are a great addition to the menu!Kid-friendliness: The staff was so helpful and kind with our two littles.

Squealed with delight when I saw Baby Blues BBQ had reopened!  The food is smokin' good - just like I remembered.  Delicious BBQ with fantastic sides and the friendliest service.  Rustic vibes and happy vibes all around!  So glad they're back! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Banana Pudding, BBQ Sauces, Baked Beans, Tri-Tip, BBQ, Mashed Potatoes, Potato Salad, Cornbread … More

It's 2 years since the fire. I so glad that it came back.It's like a phenix a beautiful bird that rose from the ashes of a fire.My wife and I enjoyed dinner today. She had Catfish with mashed potatoes and stewed spinach. I had the Blue Devil. It came with 4meats. I had fish, babyback ribs, Memphis ribs ,pulled pork. It came with 3 sides. I had the MacnCheese,BBQ Beans and corn. Plus a slice of Key lime pie.

Yeah yes! On this day I wanted to eat a kind of Southern food, which I love and I found this fantastic place in Venice.I talked to the owner and he told me that this restaurant has existed for 17 years in the same place, selling the same menu, which is a success in tradition.I ordered Suicide King Brisket, two Slices of our fresh baked cornbread topped with brisket, cotija cheese, a dab of remoulade, and BBQ sauce on the side. It was an amazing flavor. I recommend it.

My oh MY they know how to BBQ. I was born in Texas, and Baby Blues satisfies my cravings for real good barbecue. I always order more than I need to, but find myself licking the plate in the end.Their Mac n cheese as a side - get it. Also get their Cornbread, it’s perfectly sweet and salty and totally mealy. Crumbles at the touch.Usually I get the catfish sandwich, my husband gets the pulled pork sandwich, and we’ll share a rack of ribs with sides.They have a whole line of homemade sauces to add zest and spice, but honestly I eat the meat as it is served, because it’s perfect. Tender and juicy, I always want more.Eat with your whole family here or eat solo, they have a nice counter top area where you can watch chefs prepare the meals.

The atmosphere was super awesome. I was also able to meet the owner which he was super cool. The food was amazing and sides were great. Visiting from North Carolina made me feel right at home. That beef rib was fantastic. Definitely a place I will visit again when I travel back to Los Angeles California. Staff was great. Keep up the outstanding service.

We just attended our first show at City Winery.  We arrived early to have a bite.  The people and wait staff  are great and attentive.  Had a good meal and some City Winery wine (also good).  You have done a wonderful remodel for the venue and I think it is a great addition to Napa.  We had lots of fun.  We are locals and are looking forward to more events their.  The only negative I would say (and it is something to deffinatly consider) is the chairs you have are fine for dinner, but not good for watching a show.  My back was killing me and they are really slippery.  They look great but maybe something padded would be better for 3 to 4 hours of sitting. That said, hope to see you again.

What a cool music venue! Excellent sound (this is the old Opera House, so the vibe and acoustics are both very cool). And... delicious food! I had the salmon and also the arugula salad, and tried a bite of the cheeseburger my husband ordered (the zucchini fries that came with it were outstanding!!), sooo good, one of the best dinners I have ever had! Extra thanks to Toan and Heather for making us feel very welcome (I performed at City Winery Oct 2015 with Howard Jones).

Great venue I never knew was so close to home. Discovered them when one of my favorite bands quickly sold out a Bay Area venue and added a show to their tour here. Did not dine at their restaurant, but had friends who did and rated it favorably. We has front table seats off to the left and found the venue to be so intimate that it might have been even better a few tables back from the stage. We'll be back.

Great food and drinks. This is quickly becoming one of my favorite venues to watch shows in the area. The remodeled Opera House has incredible acoustics and feels very intimate. And it's right by the river in the middle of downtown Napa.

Discovered this place today while in Napa for Cesar Chavez Day celebrations. The staff was attentive, the appetizers were nice, and the wine was lovely. The variety of live shows offered makes me think this is a place I will visit again and again.

Great venue! Super friendly staff. Love the bar/restaurant downstairs and reserved cabaret seating for the show. And, most important, excellent sound system and line of sight viewing. They do it right. Exceptional date night venue.

The wine taps were very interesting and I enjoyed the wine I chose but did not appreciate the way I was treated by the bartender. I felt as though I was immediately dismissed because of my age and my trustworthiness was disregarded.
Excellent food and wines. Shame they are closing at the end of the year.
Excellent food, fantastic venue for music.
So lovely

Beautiful winery with tasty wine. The staff working with us was very courteous and helped explain their wines. They have great seating outside with large umbrellas to give you cover. I wish they served some small bites during the wine tasting.

I had high hopes for the experience here. Unfortunately, I would only rate it as a bit above average. We dined outside at the clubhouse grill and then ventured over to the tasting room. The grounds and lounges are lovely - not a bad view anywhere on the property. We had the pulled pork tacos which were delicious!I didn’t rate it too high due to the tasting room experience. Our server was very nice, and the wines were pretty good. However, the pours stuck strictly by the book and the tasting fee was not waved even though we purchased a few bottles.

The vineyard's stunning landscapes provided the perfect canvas for our couples photos and videos creating a backdrop that effortlessly blended natural beauty with timeless elegance.We LOVE shooting here! It's not our first time and can't wait to be back. If you're considering having your wedding here, do not hesitate- book it! We love shooting here and so does our team!
Great place with nice setting outdoor to relax and have a few (or more) wines. Wines tasted Good, fragrant and bold. This place is beautiful and sit next to a gorgeous golf course.

The Wente Vineyards event center is like Santa Barbara mission style in the Bay Area. So beautiful we didn't want to leave. Wonderful wines of course too. The gardens and grounds are impeccable, all surrounded by vineyards.

This is a beautiful tree-shaded oasis, an amazing place to spend a few hours sipping delicious wine. We came in the early afternoon right after lunch so we didn't try any food, but the complimentary breadsticks were tasty. Our server, Gina, did an awesome job of telling us about each wine and we honestly enjoyed them all. Highly recommended!

For us, this is like a winery in our backyard. We have been visiting this winery for the past many years and it is one of the best in the Livermore area. People here are generally super friendly in the tasting room. They have a generous amount of space in the outdoors for you to grab a bottle and enjoy the greens.I am taking one star away since we didn’t have such a good experience at their restaurant. We didn’t have a reservation and they made us wait 45 mins. Which we didn’t mind as we could grab a bottle of wine and enjoy that at the scenic patio overlooking the golf course while we waited for the table. But after waiting for that long, they told us they wouldn’t be able to get us a table, which is not acceptable by any standards.For wines, we can recommend morning fog in Chardonnay. And sparkling rose Grenache which is made of Pinot noir grapes. Both of these are not so dry. Riva ranch is their more popular Chardonnay but for my taste it’s bit on the drier side.

Vineyards located nestled in the hills of Livermore Valley for many years is quite popular due to Wine Tasting Lounge as well as for concerts. Their wines are famous and sold worldwide. We enjoyed their Wine Club Flight of Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Noir Rose, Zinfandel and Serenity. Our host Yeni who explained the specialties of each variety was helpful and great. The ambience of shady trees, greenery in the environment added to our happiness. Worth a visit.

Great experience!!!!! Everyone was super nice and helpful. Lourdes made our experience fun and entertaining. Mr. Brandon was great, we really enjoyed the cave tour with the barrel wine tasting. Beautiful grounds and great wine to enjoy with family and friends. Would totally come back.

We had eaten some dishes, all based on prawns from starter to second course, and they all were pretty good and tasty. We also have ordered a tiramisu dessert and even if tasty but a bit frozen in the middle; average prices. Food : 5/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Wow! You should be so patient here to receive the dishes that you've ordered!If you're "just" hungry, then Kirin is not the best place for you.But if you're interested to taste a "fresh", high quality sushi and you're "patient" enough, then you can give a shot to this japanese restaurant. Totally worth it!Kirin, is not just "sushi-sushi"place. It's where you will remember the taste of the food. The spaghetti wasn't that much good, though.One star less, for waiting too much there!
Great all you can eat sushi in Treviso suburb near airport. Staff friendly with some minor communication problems which were easily overcome.

Food is ok but when it's crowded is pure chaos. They have this bespoke system where you are in charge of writing down codes and you shall remember what you ordered in codes. Any item you are going to add later will bump your order on bottom of the list, so you are warned not to do it... kind of strange organization if you tell me :)
Amazing Sushi, walking distance if you are near the airport. Very nice staff and quality food. They have all you can eat option and many options to choose from.
Very well kept and organised Japanese restaurant. Prices are slightly above average and the stuff works professionally.
Good and fast Chinese food all can you eat or menu food ! I liked everything
Ottimo all you can eat,  però un po' costoso
Kobe menu was perfect for two, very tasty and a great value!

Very good. Great service. Sorted my problem immediately, with no appointment, at the best priceGood guys. Friendly and professional.Good range of top end bikes and accessoriesHighly recommended.Will use them again now that I have found them.
Top!

Molto bravi e disponibili. Mi hanno aiutato a recuperare la mia bici da strada con gruppo e ruote nuove che vanno benissimo. Una leva era in ritardo e pur di farmi andare in bici (cominciavano le ferie) me ne hanno messa un'altra provvisoria sostituita poi da quella originale quando è arrivata. Veramente gentili. Il negozio è bellissimo.Consigliatissimi.Grazie ancora.

Beautiful shop with extremely courteous, helpful and knowledgeable staff. Thanks to Maxi's advice, I purchased a wonderful Bianchi Impulso RC with which I am truly satisfied. An excellent purchasing experience, which I recommend to all cycling enthusiasts!

Biomeccanica effettuata ieri con Maxi. Salito mezzo minuto sulla bici e subito la sentenza: "Sei messo tanto male".Abbiamo lavorato per circa un'ora con regolazioni e consigli su come stare in sella. Servizio impeccabile, Maxi preparatissimo e molto disponibile anche a saziare la mia curiosità sui vari dati che venivano ricavati.Stamattina visto il meteo ho fatto un'ora di rulli e con il nuovo set up mi sento già meglio in sella, nonostante non senta ancora mia la posizione.Super consigliati. Servizio eccellente e qualità top!
SUPER MAXI... The best biomechanist around, very kind and professional. He has excellent equipment but his eye is decisive!Alexander. Udine.

Felice di condividere la mia esperienza assolutamente positiva c/o El Coridor con Maxi Dionisi;ho effettuato la visita biomeccanica e il posizionamento su 2 bici.Professionalità, attenzione ai dettagli, pazienza e serietà sono le caratteristiche distintive di Maxi.Consiglio a tutti.
I have never seen people who work with passion, love, professionalism and friendliness like Maxi. Really congratulations!!!!!

Such a wonderful experience all around! Good portion sizes and prices. You must order the crispy potatoes - better than any fried potato you’ll ever have. The little gem salad is so crave worthy, with a killer dressing. And then - do not miss the soft cream and mochi cake! We had sweet corn soft cream with the miso caramel. Heavenly.
Great place. Great atmosphere. Attentive staff. Amazing food. Will try to make it in every time I am in Napa from now on.

Love everything about this place. The design is warm and well thought out. The service was friendly and balanced with not toomuch attention, yet attentive. The food was fantastic! The spicy miso ramen did not disappoint, nor did the romanesco cauliflower. We sat in front of the street style bbq bar, and the wood fire was nice and warm since it was raining outside. I thought the price point was fair and on par with that caliber of restaurant.

Went there for dinner, food was ok, pricier than what it’s worth, service can be improved, didn’t try their soft serve ice cream, people seem to line up for it tho. I’d stay clear of their stone fruit salad and tuna tar tar, very average. Origini was overcooked, too hard on the outside. Skewers were average, not spiced in any note-worthy ways.pluses: nice decor, and their water boy was very attentive.
The food was very tasty and generous. The cocktails were yummy. The staff was fun.
Great place with Japanese food that isn't just another sushi joint. Try the soft cream!

An outstanding Japanese-focused gem of a restaurant in downtown Napa. The food and service are great, and their wine list is interesting. A couple of things that set them apart are their sommelier with an expertise in their fine selection of sakes, and their homemade ice creams - during their off hours, they serve at a window - that are invariably delicious. Miminashi is a pretty live space in terms of noise, so while you won't get a quiet, Auberge du Soliel kind of experience, what you will get is some mighty fine victuals and potables.

We had a spectacular experience. We did the chefs tasking menu and we were overwhelmed with the quality of food and service.  The sake pairing was a lovely addition.I loved the grilled mushrooms from the grill and my husband’s couldn’t pick a favorite from all the fun things we ate.The staff was knowledgeable and helpful in explaining the dishes and any specific recommendations on how to beat enjoy them.We will be back next time we are in town.

Amazing!!!!The waiters were very warm, knowledge and attentive. The food was fresh and delicious. The manager came over to check on us. She was very warm and friendly. I love how the menu changes with what is fresh and available. My husband and I had an amazing experience.
Food is deliciously good! Friendly staff and ambiance is great.

My first time to have Burmese food and every dish was excellent.  The Tea Leaf Salad was exceptional!  I would highly recommend if you have never had this type of food to give it a try!  Staff was friendly, respectful.  Good service! I consider this small, neighborhood El restaurant to be a real find! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Burmese Kitchen is the absolute best Burmese food in SF! The tea leaf salad is out of this world.. we may have ordered extra👀.I highly recommend ordering their samosas, spicy fish, coconut rice, and the Mohinga to share for the table. I wish I had more room in my stomach to try more dishes... the owners were also so kind and recommended these dishes for us!Overall, Burmese Kitchen is a hidden gem in the bay~ 10/10 would recommend.

First time having Burmese food. It was great. Menu was very enlightening; staff took it a step further answering questions. This place had my favorite atmosphere; family like, attentive without being intrusive, and totally unpretentious.Appetizer plate had samosas, falafel, and thinly sliced tofu with a nice crispy coating. Burmese tofu is NOT soy based (made from a yellow pea paste). Good alternative for those with allergies. I also had the Burmese fried rice. Had black tea, which they refill for you.Flavors are a blend of different influences. For those who like Indian food but find that mild is still a little too hot, the samosas were perfect. And this place is mild on the wallet as well. A lot of good vegetarian choices.

Truly delicious food served with enthusiasm and attention. The tofu curry was exceptional— Burmese tofu is made from split peas, and this was creamy and flavorful, never rubbery. Green beans were perfectly cooked. Also great samosas — a relatively simple dish that many restaurants manage to mess up. They must be fresh, hot and crispy — and these were! We will visit again soon.

Burmese Kitchen is our favorite restaurant in San Francisco! We always come here with folks from out of town and they love it as much as we do. You really can’t order incorrectly — everything we’ve tried has been delicious — but our favorites are the sour leaf, the golden tofu curry, the spicy fish, and the coconut rice. Their homemade limeade is also really refreshing. Highly, highly recommend this spot!

Delicious food served in a beautiful interior dining space or an expansive outdoor area.The beautiful umbrellas hung on the ceiling, art, and warm lighting make this restaurant very welcoming. The manager, Hsan, was very helpful, kind, and seemed happy to answer my questions. Service here is excellent.The food and drinks are also excellent. All of the portions are meant for sharing, which is why they have separate plates and serving spoons, but if you're alone, it's fine to eat out of the bowls the food comes in. I had the tea leaf salad, chicken curry with rice, and Burmese milk tea. The tea leaf salad is an acquired taste and I didn't like it, but it was flavorful and the tea leaves are imported because they can't be found in the US, according to the manager. The chicken curry was perfectly seasoned and the chicken was extremely tender. You could shred it with a spoon. The jasmine rice was perfectly cooked. The Burmese milk tea was the perfect temperature and really tasty. There were a lot of other drinks as well, with alcohol.Overall, I highly recommend visiting this restaurant. There's loads of dining space inside and in the back, the food is great, there's a restroom, and the food is fairly priced.Vegetarian options: Vegetarian options availableDietary restrictions: Ask employees for more informationParking: No parking lot, street parking nearby, paid parking lot at OfficeMax nearbyKid-friendliness: Good place for a family with kids to dineWheelchair accessibility: A large wheelchair will not fit, tables are all low enough
Nice food and service. We had the chicken coconut soup and fish noodle soup, both were great. Also enjoyed the hot tea. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

- B.K. Style Signature Tea Leaf Salad- Nan Gyi Thok - Rice Noodle Salad- Beef Lemongrass- Coconut Rice- Semolina CakeI visited a couple of Burmese places in SF, and this is one of the best place to go, especially for their Tea Leaf Salad and Coconut Rice!I had all the dishes above and all of them were amazing. It's a family business, and the salad is made super fresh when you order it. Coconut Rice had a great mix of sweetness from the coconut and the fragrance of the saltiness of onion. The texture was also perfectly chewy, but not too soft. I could tell the owners put a lot of care into each dish. And they're friendly, too! They were very careful about checking on a food allergy in my group. I'll definitely come back when I visit SF again!

I am half Burmese and this place is very authentic and super delicious! The mango salad (with dried shrimp, pictured), moh hinga, and ong noh kau swel were fantastic!! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

10/10 THE BEST AUTHENTIC BURMESE FOOD IN WHOLE CALIFORNIA. This shop give me the real Burmese flavor, no mix culture food, staffs are very nice, food are delicious, decoration are nice, what can i say?! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Garlic Noodles … More

Good place. The tables are low so you wouldn’t come here to work. It’s great for hangouts no doubt. There’s no second floor and the space is limited so it’s hard to find a spot when it’s crowded. However, the music selection is quite awful for my taste; I’d prefer if they have no music at all.
Really cute cafe with good coffee and super friendly staff! Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Quán mang vibe Nhật Bản, bầu không khí tại khu vực bàn lớn cạnh kệ sách mát mẻ do thiết kế đón gió tự nhiên của quán + với quạt trần hiu hiu dễ chịu. Đa dạng các loại bàn ghế để khách có thể trải nghiệm🇯🇵🌿.Mình gọi 1 cà phê muối Kinjo và cảm thấy hợp gu với bản thân do lớp kem muối không quá đậm vị khiến cho mình khó chịu cổ họng (vì mình thuộc type không uống ngọt nhiều)☕️.Quán nằm ở không gian đường nhỏ, không ồn ào. Bên trong quán được phát nhạc êm dịu, vừa đủ để giữ cho mình tỉnh táo chạy deadline mà không bị xao nhãng. Nhân viên chu đáo, dĩa hun dưỡng thê, cách service hợp ý mình💖.Menu không quá nhiều món nhưng đa dạng type, cà phê tới trà, nước ép, sinh tố, đá xay, ca cao, các thức uống sữa/sữa chua, mỳ… và có combo selection nữa (nước kèm món ăn). Nhìn chung thì do cũng trải nghiệm lần đầu nên chưa thể thử hết các loại nhưng đó là những ấn tượng của mình về menu quán🍜🥤.Review hơi dài kaka vì đó giờ mình chưa từng review một quán cf nào cả. Tình cờ hôm nay cần chỗ tá túc xíu để chạy dline mà dính quá nên thử sức viết feedback xem shao☺️ tóm tắt là tớ sẽ trải nghiệm ở đây thêm nhiều lần tới ạ❤️

Quán rất xinh, vibe thơ nhiền khá hoài niệm. Tông màu chủ đạo là màu gỗ có 2 khu vực. 1 khu ở dưới là theo vibe mình mới kể còn khu trên là hiện đại tối giản. Ngồi trên có thể nhìn xuống dưới. Giá nước tầm 30 trở lên. Nước uống khá ổn có trà đá kèm theo. Hơi buồn là k có máy lạnh chứ có chắc mình ngồi cả ngày haha. Nhân viên hiền lành thân thiện. Nên thử chanh tuyết đá xay nha, k bị đắng như mấy chổ khác. Có chổ ngồi bên rìa ngoài khá chill nếu đi đêm.
Giá ổn so với 1 quán gần sân bayNước 7/10Phục vụ 9/10Nhà vệ sinh sạch sẽ rộng rãiKhông khí quán rất chillNhạc hay hợp tai

It's great, I really love Kinjo, especially the water here is very good, the glasses are huge and the price is very reasonable, the staff are all young students, the service attitude is attentive, the uniforms look very professional, stylish. Ok food for the price. I typically go for chicken teriyaki because it's around $10 to get meat, boiled veggies, and rice.I wouldn't really recommend anything else because the food quality isn't that good for the other stuff. Though it's not bad - my first order was a beef bento and I'll never order that again!You can ask for more veggies vs rice. You can also ask for more sauce once you get your order. It's the same sauce for everything.They cook all the meat on one side of the grill and the rest of the food on another grill. The sushi is made in the kitchen/behind the cashier.Depending on when you get your food, you may need to wait a while (~20 mins) until they cook a batch of chicken - even though you may spot some cooked chicken on standby to be placed on a tray.The waiting line is like an assembly line - you order & pay and roughly follow your tray on the bar holder above the grill. They may or may not call your order # so I think it's better to roughly guess which tray is yours and follow it.

Come on, a restaurant in the Castro district of San Francisco with the name “The Sausage Factory” has got to get a few giggles from the chronically immature like me.  I was passing through town on my way to Portland and decided to meet up with an ex boyfriend after 25+ years.  We knew we wanted Castro district so our first choice was The Anchor Oyster Bar, but it was closed due to Covid 19 so then we went to Hamburger Mary’s which was also closed. I didn’t have Italian on my mind, but I’m glad we ended up at The Sausage Factory.  The food was excellent and it has an antique charm that makes it truly unique.  After telling some of my friends in the city about it they all sort of responded with”Oh that place.  It hasn’t changed much in 40 years.”  Well, guess what?  If something’s good, why change it?We started with mussels in a garlic sauce that were out of this world.  Not exactly sure what was in the sauce to make it green, but I loved it so much I took a spoon to it after all the mussels and toasted garlic bread were gone.  I was going to get the puttanesca, but I always get puttanesca at authentic Italian restaurants so I went with the chicken piccata.  I was not disappointed.  The lemon-caper sauce had just the right amount of tang and the chicken was so tender, there was no need to use a knife.  My ex had the pasta primavera served with an alfredo sauce which looked awesome, but I didn’t try it.  He said it was good, but couldn’t finish it because he was full.  I, of course, never stop until it’s all gone if I think it’s good; full or not.  Maybe that’s just another difference between him and me. Sigh.Everything about it was delightful. The server and food runner were very upbeat, fun, and efficient, and the food was great.  If you’re in the Castro and want good, authentic Italian cuisine, go to The Sausage Factory.

Great buffett, multiple veg and non-veg options. Chicken Tandoori and Pepper chicken starters were delicious, followed by biryani's and desserts. Loved the taste and would visit again. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Whether you're savoring a plate of butter chicken or relishing a bowl of steaming dal, Indian cuisine has a way of warming the heart and nourishing the soul.

This was our second visit to this Brazilian Steakhouse and we left with very full bellies. Our server was great but it looked like he was stretched thin (too many tables). I'm not sure if that was a standard number of tables or perhaps they were short staffed. But regardless of this detail the food was amazing and never ending! The price makes this a special occasion restaurant for us but the quality of food doesn't give us a second thought about selecting it and driving 45 minutes.

We had a family party here last week. They took amazing care of us. We felt like family. The service was top notch. The salad bar is huge and the servers made sure to keep our plates full. The food was delicious. I had a much better experience here than I have at other Brazilian steak houses that I have been to. Very cool experience!

Food? Incredible. Service? Incredible. Atmosphere? Incredible. We went for my bHusbands birthday with our daughter and had the best time. We will remember that experience forever. The best service I've had in as long as I can remember.Dietary restrictions: Were very kind and accommodating of our pork free diet.

This was my first visit to a Gaucho steakhouse.  We had a group of 5 coworkers for a 7pm reservation. We had a very good meal with excellent service.  This is a very well run Brazilian steakhouse.  The salad bar was very fresh with soup, salad, antipasto options. The drink menu was very adequate with a large selection of  domestic and imported wines, beers and an extensive whiskey selection.The gauchos were on point bringing around the meat selections which were all flavourful and cooked to perfection.  Thanks to all the servers and staff for a great experience!  I will be back the next time I am in Livonia MI.Wheelchair accessibility: There is wheelchair parking right in front with easy access to all areas of the reataurant

We made reservations for 3pm, which was as soon as it opened. The server explained how everything worked. The salad bar looked beautiful and had a nice variety of meat,  seafood and veggies.  The servers brought around several different cuts of meat. I like mine more on the medium well side, after i mentioned that,  they remembered each time they came around. Everything looked wonderful and the staff was pleasant it was a great dining experience.  We didnt feel rushed which was nice. It is definitely on the pricey side which will limit how often i will visit.

The food was wonderful and delicious. The seafood soup was amazing and so were the lamb chops!Our service could have been better. We spent a while looking/waiting for our waitress. They also required a deposit that could only be put towards a gift card or the bill, not refunded unfortunate for our birthday host. We were also almost charged for an extra meal. Would not suggest for groups unless paying all together.

Good experience ♥️The noodles are customizable, you can select the type of noodles,sauce, toppings and veggies u need which is great.I ordered a crunchy lotus stem which is delicious, 3 custom noodles were  good but black bean sauce noodles are okay okay, and Sushi which was a little tasteless , the sea weed covered was not to my liking, it tastes and smells fishy I mean like it should, it was my first time trying and was uncomfortable.There are many options available in soups,  starters, dimsum, bao buns, one rice bowls, dessert, ice cream, drinks .The ambience is great, the kitchen was hygienic , and the staff are friendly and helpful .

I recently visited this gem of a vegetarian noodle restaurant and was completely blown away by the quality and taste of their food. As a vegetarian, it’s often a challenge to find a place that doesn’t just offer great options but also excels in flavor and presentation. This restaurant, however, hit all the right notes.Their sushi selection, despite being vegetarian, was diverse and delicious. Each piece was a work of art, both in taste and in presentation. It’s hard to find vegetarian sushi that feels both authentic and inventive, but they’ve managed to do just that.The noodles were equally impressive. I had a bowl that was both hearty and bursting with layers of flavor. It was clear that a lot of thought and care went into preparing each dish, using fresh ingredients that truly shone through in each bite.Service was impeccable, with staff who were friendly and knowledgeable, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. The ambiance of the restaurant was cozy and inviting, perfect for both casual meals and special occasions.I can’t recommend this restaurant enough to anyone looking for outstanding vegetarian sushi and noodles. It’s a place that proves vegetarian cuisine can be just as exciting and satisfying as any other. Definitely a must-visit!

This is a must visit restaurant in AECS Layout.The flavours are so rich that for the first time I could distinguish different flavours while having food here.They have done something amazing with their variety of food mastering over their specialty sauces they provide.The menu selection process is something I loved and for me it was a new experience.Must visit place for new and old couples 😉 to spend more quality time and enjoy and experience new flavours from their incredible list of menus.Kudos to The Noodle Theory Team.

A pretty vegetarian asian food cafe, with unique and innovative menu. I didn't try the 'build your own bowl' option though.I had the mango sushi and Tibetan basil dimsum.The attention to detail in the presentation and ingredients used was very refreshing to see. The sushi rice was perfect. Food taste was overall good.Only issue I felt was the mango used in my sushi was sour, but other than that everything was very good.

Noodles Theory offers a unique and enjoyable ordering experience, allowing for extensive customization of meals. Their sushi and Khao Suey Soup is crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients, delivering a delightful blend of flavors and textures. The flat noodles with Chilli Hoisin Jain Sauce are a standout vegetarian option, combining perfectly cooked noodles with a spicy, sweet sauce, catering to diverse dietary needs without sacrificing taste. Highly recommended for its innovative approach and delicious dishes (Including Jain Food)

- Food :The food quality was up to the mark and it was flavourful and delicious.1) “Make your own wok” : I tried this custom made bowl , with options in base, sauce, veggies , protein and garnishing. It was very tasty , they offered a variety of sauces with options ranging in spiciness , sweetness and tanginess. The quantity was ample and I could barely finish the bowl. Totally worth it . Highly recommend  to try this .2) Thai Jelly water chestnut : I heard of this drink for the first time when I walked in to this place , It was flavourful and unique and not too sweet so I loved it .Service and staff  :I had visited at a unusual hour so the service was pretty quick , staff were polite and helpful while deciding ingredients of my custom bowl.Hygiene and ambiance :The kitchen is visible from outside , staff wore proper kits and hygiene was well maintained .The atmosphere in the restaurant was pleasant , the ambiance was minimalistic and the wall menu was well designed .Overall it is a better place to eat asian food  as compared to other overrated fancy restaurants I have been to in bangalore .
They have a wide variety of choices the best is to make your own wok. A must try are the chessy mushroom dimsums and the Bao buns.Vegetarian options: It's all vet restaurant
Service is fantastic 👏 even though this is a new restaurant. Tried 3 itemsThukpaLotus stem fryCustom bowl with udon noodlesAll are delicious whereas thukpa and custom bowl can be improvised a bit.

Ordered Crunchy lotus stem, honey chilli potato and a customized noodles combo and rice combo. The selecting of the combo customisation felt like answering MCQs for exams but it was very fun.Food was really nice, especially the noodles and lotus stem and moreover, VERY affordable with quantity and quality well worth the price.10/10 will go again.(P.S.: it's only veg)
Well stocked and employees are helpful

Awesome place to buy parts as well as animal feed and other lawn and garden items. Great friendly staff, who are very eager to help. Pam is fantastic and often times has most of the part numbers memorized.
Awesome customer service and staff. Very knowledgeable
Great staff, very patient with ordering and finding parts for me. These guys have it all, all the time.
Good store. The people working there is so nice
Very convenient to have this store locally, really good selection of both auto parts and auto accessories.

Battery died in the middle of a 5 hour trip on the day before Thanksgiving.  3 shops said we'd be waiting until Monday for a battery (it's Wednesday).  NAPA took us without wait, tested our old battery, popped in a new one, gave our pup some water, and were generally the nicest group of folks one could hope to encounter in such a situation.
Always feel like I saved money and support local.  Bought a car battery and it was good brand and was less than the big auto store.
Great customer service even though they didn't have the pay I needed

Tried to order flurry pancake but was told it took 30 minutes. So we ordered mocha green tea pancake which is very delicious. If my neighborhood famous pancake house has such flavor, I would have visited very often.The other dish we ordered is South side up. It's very tasty and enough portion as a brunch.This restaurant is not on a top location but seems to be very popular as people (some of them may be locals) walked in several times during our meal. The waitresses are very friendly and nice.Overall it's a very positive surprise on our San Francisco trip.

I came here specifically for the souffle pancakes but fell in love with the eggs bennie! Let me tell you, I don't eat much but we finished EVERYTHING. I haven't had so much food in months, it was just too good to stop eating! I got the Californian Benedict (drool worthy) and my honey got the Norwegian Benedict. This place does not skimp when it comes to anything, so much avocado on both, mine had tons of crab meat. Every bite was heavenly. This place has the best potatoes my honey and I have ever had (we both agreed on this and we don't agree on much), they were light and, dare I say, fluffy inside but perfectly (I'm assuming) fried outside. I usually never mind potatoes on my plate, they get ignored but not this time!!I noticed the menu has a 30 minute wait for the souffle pancakes so I went up right away to order these. They were everything I dreamed of. Light, super fluffy, the syrup and berry compote were just right and the berries tasted so fresh.Another thing worth noting is their $5 orange juice. It tastes like biting into a perfectly ripened orange!We had a server with red hair help us, she was friendly, attentive, welcoming. This place deserves all the stars! It was a bit of a wait for the food (about 20 minutes) but it just means it's fresh and I'm almost certain we were the first customers. I cannot wait to come back. I'm telling everyone I know about this little gem.

We came here and there was only one waitress, think they may have understaffed for a long holiday weekend. The reason we chose this place was the soufflé pancakes, which tasted very good. We also ordered multiple dishes which were good, and helped fill the wait time til the pancakes came out. Will return for the pancakes, for sure:

We made a brunch reservation for 6 people. Not too busy when we arrived. There is outdoor seating but we decided to do indoor since it was quite windy. Standouts were the Bangkok Scramble and the Matcha pancake. Tbh, the fluffy pancake was underwhelming because it tastes just like the sponge cakes (纸包蛋糕) they sell in Chinese bakeries. If you were to order one though, get the tiramisu. They did take at least 30min to make so it is definitely fresh! Overall, the food was tasty but there's a couple of things that are overpriced/overhyped.

Rough first impression, but it was so good that I’d give it another shot.I ordered 5 dishes, and I was pretty disappointed when I picked up my order to see that there were only 4. The food was really, really good so I’m finding it difficult to be too upset. That being said, they don’t include a side of rice with anything, so make sure to order some extra.

Very nice Thai restaurant with excellent thai favor food taste, it is recommended from thai people.I have a chance to eat at this restaurant while our group had conference in San francisco. All thai menu  are recommended and all of thai people in our group enjoy the food here.Service here is also good and the owners and cookers here are Thai to ensure that this restaurant is genuine thai taste and signature spicy. However you can order how spicy taste you want.Will visit again if i have a chance.

I enjoyed a Thai curry with eggplant. It was nice and sweet. The Thai tea portion was lesser than what I expected. The food menu is interesting because they have a lot of interesting menu items like diner foods in addition to Thai food.

Food: 😍🤩Jum-ba coffee was delicious (three layer coffee with a sweet red syrup in the bottom).Berry souffle pancakes are light and fluffy. And oh my  they smell and taste great. Totally worth the wait.Fully loaded hash browns are topped with some sort of spicy green sweet mayo that's kinda magical.Ambiance: 🤗Very friendly interior. Soft light incandescants give the space a warm glow, helped out by a nice selection of soft music.Overall: 🦄One of those rare restaurants that excels at brunch and dinners in unique ways. I'll be dreaming of those pancakes.

Loved this place! Nicely built parklet on Geary, wasn't noisy at all. Waitstaff was exceptional. We ordered the berry soufflé pancakes and the stuffed French toast. Both were to die for! Mimosa carafe was more than enough for the two of us and reasonably priced. Please visit this hidden gem!

I have been eating here since they first opened years ago. And while I never dine in, cause I take my food home. I have never had a bad experience ever. The food is always wonderful & delicious. I've had just about everything on the menu, but the spicy pork belly is my absolute favorite. The dressing for the Thai salad is also perfect. I got the basil hot fried rice here and it was so so good! It heated up very well for leftovers, too. The staff are young and learning but friendly and doing their best, and the atmosphere is really cool. They even have a vault since it used to be a bank! Overall really cool place that adds flavor to Dallastown. Also the Thai iced tea is delicious!

Great little place tucked away in an old bank in Dallastown. The big bank vault creates a unique atmosphere. Went with my parents. They do not like hot/spicy food. The owner was very accommodating and made sure nothing was spicy. Here is what we had: spring rolls (10 / 10), bubble tea (9 /10), me hungry (9.5 / 10), pork garlic (9.5 / 10), shrimp pad Thai (10 / 10), fried bananas with ice cream (9.5 / 10). Very satisfied with the delicious / healthy food. We will be back!

Great Thai food and friendly staff. Offers variety of spice level depending on your preference. Unique eat-in experience with the restaurant located in an old bank and the old bank vault door open. Highly recommend for dining in or takeout.Parking: Parking lot to left of restaurant.

Thé atmosphère is really neat. The spring rolls were delicious. But, the edamame was dry and a bit “off”. All the food, except for the spring rolls, was cold. The pad Thai was ok, but a small portion and the noodles were unique.I do appreciate that everything is easily veganized and the owners are very nice. But, there are tastier places to spend your money.

Nice overall spot. Easy to find with plenty of parking.  Food was delicious. Plate has a nice mild but consistent spice topped with the chicken and vegetables all made a perfect combination. Topped with an egg how can you go wrong. Food : 4/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Stopped in today to try something new in the area and was pleasantly surprised. I had looked into this place a few times but wasn't sure at first. If you're on the fence, go for it. I started with the Tom-Yum shrimp soup. The unique flavor of spice and sweetness had me drinking the broth. I then ordered the Me Hungry meal, because I wanted to try the fried rice and the chicken satay. The chicken was cooked perfectly, and mixed with the sauce and rice it was filling, but not heavy. Made for a very nice late lunch meal. I also ordered the fried bananas and ice cream, and that was delicious as well. I definitely will be back to try something new next time. I recommend to anyone looking to try some good Thai in the area.Parking: They have their own lot on the side of the building.Wheelchair accessibility: They have a lift on the front of the building for wheelchair accessibility.

Our last night in Pisa we went here for som italian tapas and wine. The magnicificent Stefano took great care of us and provided us with superb wine and food. He was also great company over the course of the dinner and told us a lot about Italy and food. If you're looking for a great wine bar in Pisa, this is where you need to go.

Wonderful,  wonderful place. If you are into natural wine and you happen to be in Pisa , that's the place to be.  The wine choice is really good,  people there are knowledgeable, food is of a great quality and locally sourced.  You get the personal service at the highest level,l. In all the youth craziness of Pisa, that's your place for quality.

Amazing wine bar, I would highly recommend whether it's couples, on your own or as a group. Very knowledgeable on wines and very good value for money too, the staff there are very lovely and friendly and happy to provide a free lesson on wine if you're as curious as I was. Definitely recommend this place.
Authentic place for wine tasting, cheese and jamón tapas. Great chat as well!
Small wine bar with just four tables,but hundred times more labels!Try the tapas and don’t forget to ask for some wine recommendations. There is really a lot to choose from.

A fantastic, genuine experience. Tapas with a wide selection of Tuscan/Italian foods and wines, with passion and knowledge in the service. Very friendly staff, sharing customs of the area and very good at recommending based on your preferences. Thanks for the great experience on our last night in Pisa!
Great wine. Great service. Highly recommend.

We had the chance to find out this delicious wine & food place. The 1st time we could enjoy an awesome degustation, the discovery of Orange wines, so good ! Stefano is absolutely charming and of great advice. We came back a 2d time to enjoy the wines and tapas. A place to go to enjoy absolutely divine Tuscany wine and food :-) Thank you so much Stefano, you rock !!

Stefano is a passionate and very knowledgeable guy and a warm host. I had a great evening and tried some delicious natural wines. The food is also great and pairs well with the wines on offer. Totally recommend this place. As a bonus Gorgio & Francesca two regulars are also great company if you get to meet them! Grazie mille!
Fabulous service, food and selection of wine. Would recommend the tartare, swordfish and tiramisu. The locations also great for outdoor evening dining.

Our group received VIP straight from the moment we hit the line. We were well taken care of upon our entrance and escorted to our table. Our bottle service staff were attentive and fun to have around in our booth. The club is very spacious and an incredible vibe that is both polished and lively. We arranged for this night as a surprise bachelorette party and the bride-to-be was on the dance floor the whole time, dancing the night away, she even missed her vibrant presentation that we arranged for her (despite the staff being gracious enough to delay doing in hopes she would be back at the table). It was the most lively night and best club experience any of us had ever had, we closed the place down!!!

It’s a great club to go to if you’re staying in the MGM. We saw DJ Pauly DJ.. totally worth it if you’re into music like we are. However, they have a very strict dress code and you cannot get in with shorts which I understand but at the same time it’s Vegas and it’s hot.Everyone has on shorts

Overall: 4.4/5We got on the guest list and got in around 11 PM the Friday of Halloween weekend. The line moved pretty fast and the check-in/security process was streamlined. It was our first time in Hakkasan so we were surprised we had to take an elevator up to get to the club. They only opened 2 floors so we didn't get to see the 3rd one. The floor we got off on was the top floor where it was all lounge seating. The bar area was big and provided a nice overview of the club. The space in front of the DJ was huge but it was already filled. We grabbed a drink first since there was no line which was a smart choice because half an hour later, both bars were packed. It was ladies' open bar too from 11:30 PM - 12:30 AM so the girls can get free well drinks/beers. HOWEVER, the drinks - even the paid ones - tasted like juice with barely any alcohol in them. The lemon drop was $20 and the long island tea was $26 too so pre-game before you come in. The lemon drop we got had sugar all over the cup so our hands got sticky. The bartenders were really nice though and didn't seem to hate their jobs. The music got better as it got later into the night but we left a little before 1 AM since it got way too crowded. They even blocked off the middle entry stairs to the main stage dance floor and had security managing path of travel/flow. Overall, had a pretty good experience. Definitely one of the better clubs I've been to.Parking: Parking is at MGM Grand.

It is an okay nightclub, nothing extraordinary.They really need to train their security guards they need to learn not to be tough to all their customers from the very 1st minute. I was wearing shorts and the security guard said no shorts and turned away. He could just spend 10 more seconds and make it a complete sentence explaining there is a dress code, it is not that hard. Also when I changed my shorts and got in, I saw 2 guys with shorts which was surprising.

Cool two-levelled nightclub inside MGM Grand. The night that my friends and I went, Lil Jon was playing. We had lots of fun. I wish there was more space on the dancefloor though. When the club is crowded, it's not easy to dance or get through people. Atmosphere : 4/5 … More
Located in MGM grand. It has multiple floors with varied music and good light/fireworks display for the vibes. Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

If you are staying in MGM area this is a great choice for a party. Be aware that some of the DJ’s are not that impressive and you have to arrive early to take a place on a dance floor or buy a table and splurge on bottle service. The ambiance is worthy an entrance ticket. The kinetic ceiling is fun to watch. I am only giving three stars because this club has a great potential.

It's a fun vives club. There was a DJ getting down on the turn tables. Not much clarity on where you can go. It gets crowded fast. But if you want to dance this is it. Don't expect much more. Food : 1/5 | Service : 2/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Servers are great and the place is nice. Food has very little flavor, it needs seasoning like salt as a bare minimum. I saw too late the review about small meatballs but they are tiny for $7 but were the highlight of my meal. If this is your go to Italian, I’m sorry but you haven’t had real Italian. It reminded me of what non-Italians would make and say it’s Italian.

Went here for a date night and it was a great, I really enjoyed the feel of the place and there was some nice jazz/classical music playing while we ate. I ordered the chicken paramsean which was cooked very nicely and had a great sauce. I would order different noodles next time, but I was just trying something new. The garlic bread came out hot and was very seasoned and tasty, my gf got the Risotto alla Pescatora which was a special for the day and she loved it "5/5". Will definitely come back here next time I want Italian, and I reccomend for a cute date night.

Luca was excellent in serving a team of 30. The food was delicious, fast and ready, and the portions were large. Excellent option for sports teams. Highly recommend! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Our go-to for Italian comfort food. Small, quaint, family run shop with a casual vibe. Simple, classic dishes at a reasonable price. Great food and friendly staff. Note, no alcohol sold here.Dietary restrictions: Gluten free pasta available for small chargeKid-friendliness: Very kid friendly. Half portion of pasta available for kiddos.
Very good traditional Italian place in the heart of Berkeley.Service could be better.Eggplant Parmesan was half cooked.Rest of the food was great.

No alcohol served. Food was good. The bruschetta and polenta was fine. Everything was fresh, well prepared. The mains were our favorite - pesto with penne pasta and the spaghettini aglio e olio. Pastas were comfort food. Al dente, like how we like it. We'll be back for they pasta and to try some of the other appetizers. Food : 4/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Lobster ravioli is great!  They now have table service so that's really nice and a heater by the door so it's much warmer now.  Really terrific improvements.  If you haven't been in awhile try it again.  You might like it better now.

Sublime food. Superb combination of flavors.Great service. Attentive and full of smiles.Unassuming restaurant. Packed to the gills.It’s a cult favorite. Once you’ve enjoyed these flavors, it’s hard not to get addicted to it and find it normal.The eel clay pot rice is to die for and their most popular item.Fusion as fusion should be.Parking: Large number of free parking spots right in front.

Decent spot but would recommend having few people to share the dishes with so you can try more things. They have a good selection of items to pick from. The pizza crust was very tasty but it lack fillings. Claypot was a decent size but the pork was a bit too tender. We also got the beef rolls but we didn’t enjoy it as much as it was very overcooked and had a weird texture.
Capacio is great, fresh and savory. The clay pot rice with salmon and roe is also very impressive. Highly recommend. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

During a recent work trip, I secured a table at Gochi in Palo Alto without a reservation. This visit was my 4th visit to this restaurant, situated in a strip mall, that offers truly unique Japanese fusion creations. So many amazing options that it will challenge your decision-making with their innovative combinations. I opted for a combination order of ahi with uni and beef with uni, which were both outstanding and the Nasu, Tofu with ground pork in Miso appetizer was full of flavor and easily a separate meal. The only lowlight was that the restaurant can get a bit noisy due to the close proximity of other diners, but the culinary experience more than made up for it.

Expected dishes to be more expensive.Rice balls and fusion pizza were very crispy, rice balls had strong butter flavor, if you like that this is very good, 2 for $11.Cold udon was chewy, $20.Pizza was thin and crispy, strong ham taste with noticeable crab flavor. Not sure if that flavor combo works for me.Yellowtail carpaccio wasn't cold enough, fish was nice enough, but best part was the slightly sour sauce. Not worth its price imo.Daikin salad $11 refreshing, although a bit too salty.
Love! Delicious food eg big varieties of claypot rice dishes, yummy appetizers like beef tongue, hamachi collar, black cod miso. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Great vibe with authentic look to the restaurant, props to the comic books and sake bottles at the start of the front of the restaurant.The food selection was great, really enjoyed the scallops & squid. The chicken was a bit overcooked and a bit too much batter. Super weird that so many restaurants in the area close early but fyi kitchen closes at 8:30pm mid week.

Hello Viewers,it's been a while since I re-visit Gochi Japanese restaurant.   Gochi used to be my favorite Japanese restaurant in town.  I love they are offering the some fusion style and non Bay Area traditional Japanese restaurant.  I had a feeling all Bay Area sushi store are coming from the same master - Dragon Sushi Roll, Rainbow rolls, teriyaki chicken,  sashimi plate, etc.this place offers different Japanese fusion cooking style such as Japanese dressing pizza, clay pot, and carpaccio beef.   I enjoy these type of Izakaya style that goes along with the sake or wine instead of treat it as a full meals.if the group of people coming here and hoping for full Japanese meal, this is not for you.  if you are coming to have sip of the drinks and tapas style, I will look no further.P.S - did I mention this place serve the foods way too fast? feels like it's missing the izakaya style.Paul
Gochi is always right. From my opinion, this is better than the one in Cupertino.

This was our first time visiting this Chinese restaurant.  First impression was great.  With a display of hanging roast duck and pork, immediately your eyes are treated with savory meats.  Their quick serve dishes, usually includes BBQ meats are front and center behind a glass partitioned kitchen.  The actual kitchen where they prep most of the dishes are behind what the customers can see.  Those dishes definitely do not disappoint.  The portions are substantial matching the steep pricing.  We paid close to $80 for 3 dishes.  In the end, they served us a warm red bean dessert for free.  We ordered a BBQ sampler over rice to share family style.  We also ordered Crispy Fried Fish & Pumpkin, and House Special Crispy Chow Mein.  The food was delicious.  I can't wait for us to return and try other dishes.

Not really a place you would want to bring your family or friends to eat out at or a value place where you can get decent Chinese food with good price. Their bean sprout dish is $21.95 and it is quite small in portion. The wonton and suimai noodle soup was underwhelming in terms of flavor and quality. The black pepper spare ribs were overly salted and the old oil taste was really coming out from some pieces.

The dishes here are pretty good it lived up to expectations. They are not cheap, but the proportions and quality of the dishes makes it worth the price. Make sure you come with at least 3-4 people so you get to share and try different dishes as the proportions are meant for sharing.

The food was delicious and the server who took our order and helped us was so kind. Very customer friendly. Will return and try their duck and lobster dishes! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Beef Chow Fun, Fish … More

It's like Hong Kong cafe with street food.  Food is tasty in general and service is efficient.  Price is reasonable.  Love the brisket dish, most of the noodle soup are pretty good.  BBQ items are good here.  The place get pretty loud with the hard surfaces and loud talking customers.The only gripe is parking is hard to come up as the lot is very small and street parking is hard to come by.

I love this place ! Very friendly staff! Fast and efficient service. Plenty of space to eat and sit. The food was very well in potion and good price ! The quality of meat was amazing . I will be going back frequently for sure . Be prepared to eat and enjoy a good meal ! I love this place so much !
This is a good place to get Hong Kong style food.  Portion size is pretty good and food quality is usually not bad. If you pay cash for take out they’ll give you a discount.

Hong Kong style cuisine. The price for each dish is about high teen or over $20. But the quality and quantity are maintained and not reduced after COVID. Service is adequate. We have come several times. The quality is consistent. Recommended. Food : 4/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 Recommended dishes
Soup

Parking space
Plenty of parking
