This place is no longer called cooking Papa.  It's Papa Express.I only tried the dishes on the photo.Chicken wing. Though it says salt and pepper, I tasted the salt, not much the pepper, also they use curry powder to marinate the chicken wing. It's pretty crispy. The batter is good.Chow fun with sauce, beef and egg. You can taste the a good stir fry Chow fun (鑊氣) flavor is good. Got skill.Beef stew noodle soup. Good tender beef stew, good flavor soup, noodle is not bad.This place is cheaper than cooking Papa which I thought was too expensive. Though it operates like a fast food restaurant, the quality of good seems to be good. I give it a 4 stars for now and will try more in the future.

The food was not exceptional but flavourful and typical Chinese chaise, strong umami flavours, oily and loaded with MSG and oyster sauce.The restaurant is small and the toilet is filthy.There is always a as it on this small restaurant but they are pretty quick in serving.

This venue is incredible. Such an intimate setting, making it even more magical to be so close to your favourite artists/bands.We saw Foy Vance and Bonnie Bishop here and it was truly an unforgettable evening.10/10 recommend. We also love the fact that the alcohol they had in the bar was from local distilleries/breweries! Great way to partner up and support your local businesses!

Not only was the show that I went to go see( Birdtalker) amazing, the staff was great too!! They let me bring in my leftover dinner that I was carrying around and said I could eat it inside. The decor is fascinating to admire. Complimentary water was offered. Definitely an unforgettable experience!! Thank you

I come here around once every two months to see some acts. This is one of my favorite places to watch a concert because it is small enough to actually see the performers and maybe interact with them if that's your thing.I go alone now and it is very safe. I don't think they have food but they do have drinks if you want to drink. They also have cushioned seats if you prefer to sit down and clean bathrooms. The tickets are cheap at around $25.I definitely recommend this place for concerts. I have seen some good acts here and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Saw LOOM at the State Room after Kilby Block Party and it was one of the coolest shows ever. Great venue and the sound was mixed perfectly so the band sounded incredible. Great light work as well - would definitely see a show here again

Excellent venue for music and the sound is great. They could gouge on drinks like every other venue but they don't because they are cool! Also there is lots of seating for shows if you didn't like to stand like me.
I saw the progressive rock band Riverside here last year and apart from the amazing show, everything went great. A great experience overall.
If I ever see that a band I like is playing The State Room I am excited. Great, intimate venue!

One of my favorite places to frequent. The State Room is intimate and has great sound. I have see hundreds of shows here and have loved every experience here. The drinks are affordable and there's water available for free!Friendly, helpful staff and clean bathrooms also make it a comfortable spot to see some good live music.  * Pic is of Joseph- 2022

We went and saw Brett Dennen. I was really impressed with the theater! Stadium seating, with a large place to stand right near the stage. Super intimate feel, not too small and not too big. Heads up that it is $1 to have them hang your coat. Lots of alcoholic drink options, but I would love to see more non alcoholic options. Water is free. I would definitely go again!

It was a nice restaurant with live music. My husband likes his food but mine a missing a bit spice. The service was good very friendly and appreciative staffs. Food : 3/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

I would not recommend this restaurant. Great location, but the service was very slow. Waited over 45 minutes for our main dishes. Burger was way over done. Appetizers were tasty. Tomato soup was too cheesy. Food : 4/5 | Service : 2/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

The live music was great and provided a really nice relaxed atmosphere. The food was very good for money, when I went I wanted something a bit homely - meat, mash, gravey and veg. I found the beef cheeks here, and god it was just what I wanted, it was delicious, the beef was just so tender, I also had the apple pie which once again was so tasty, the ginger bread biscuits just finished the meal off excellently

This restaurant in the centre square was just great. Live music but not intrusive. Extensive menu with food that was a feast to the eyes. Great wine and alcohol list. And plenty of time to watch the antics on the main square. Service was really ggod. Our waiter Simon was always attentive and helpful. Would recommend anyone stop by. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Had lunch there on the terrace with my son right under the statue of Neptune.  We had the double beef burger and a pizza. Both excellent. The homemade fries are excellent. Haven't seen the interior. Service was adorable and fast. Thx. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

1st, my server, Kasia, was Excellent!!  She was very nice, professional and helpful to me as an English speaker.  Next, the food, salmon pasta and Chardonnay was Excellent!!!  Finally, the patio was very comfortable.  It was a cool day and they had heaters. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Had a great lunch in the sun. Staff was friendly and prices were good for the location. I had the best pork cheek of my life, and honestly the best meal of the entire trip to Gdansk.The drinks were also good and the milkshake was phenomenal (according to my friends). We surprised the waitress by ordering in 4cl rum to mix with the shakes! Recommend putting on your menu, or trying for yourself. All in all, a really nice lunch.

A lovely place in the heart of the old town near Neptune's fountain. The staff were excellent and very friendly. We had a couple of beers and pepperoni pizza and burger withfries which were absolutely excellent. My wife said it's the best pizza she'd eaten.A great atmosphere and an ideal spot for people watching. We'll be sure to visit this place when we return to Gdansk. Thank you for an enjoyable visit. 🙂

We didn’t have any food but had a beer and Irish coffee and it was really relaxing to be sitting outside with acoustic live music playing. Service was friendly and warm. Recommended for a cosy time. Not sure about the quality of food since we came after dinner elsewhere. Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

A nice venue! Comfortable seats with great views from all angles. Nicely decorated and bar prices are reasonable for a theater. Need to walk a distance for parking unless you are lucky enough to find one on the street but that's a rare find.
First time there to see a Johnny Cash Tribute..amazing! Sound was great, no bad seats, very helpful staff. Definitely a sleeper spot for good shows, already making plans to return.
Was a great time seeing Tim Charron and Crystal Gayle..First time at the Odeum was was an impressive experience.

The great thing about this place is it's very small so you can't  have a bad seat, no matter where you are.   It's old, so there are few bathrooms and it gets crowded very quickly and very, very warm inside. It seems a fire hazard to have so many people crowded into such a small area for refreshments or meet & greet. But, again, it's a historic facility. Take the good with the bad.Parking is a challenge. We parked up the hill.  It's not a terrible walk, but it's a challenge for some.It's in the historic downtown, so the streets are narrow, and it gets crowded.  Again, we didn't  mind, but others could have challenges.

Small, intimate dated theater. It's well taken care of and servers for a good time in a smaller setting. The sound in the theater is perfect. Not to high or low. Acoustically fitting .Recommend to get there early for parking purposes or use valet. Drinks are reasonable and the bathrooms are updated and clean.I'll go back again for another show.

Comfortable seats, the sound is very good, and it is a pleasure to go to. Two negatives, there is a fair amount of parking but you have to look forward on  side streets and the men's room has one toilet for a good size seating area
We saw Almost Queen at the Odeum.  A nice smallish space for a concert.  The show was really good.  I would definitely go to another show there.

Great venue for watching live music in downtown East Greenwich.  It is an  old  movie theater that was converted into a stage.  There is not a bad seat in the place.   They typically have some decent artists.  This year I have seen Pure Prairie League and Phillip Phillips.  Adult beverages and snacks sold 😀

Fabulous venue for music performance in the heart of East Greenwich. I've seen some great performances here, and there is such a great vibe at this theatre. Would highly recommend seeing a show or performer at this venue.Not a bad seat in the house! Great, friendly staff. Fairly easy street parking, and lots of great restaurants and bars in walking distance.
Fabulous show and a terrific venue!

Delicious Turkish Cuisine!I had an amazing experience at Sofra Turkish Restaurant. The atmosphere was warm, and the staff were super friendly. The food was exceptional—flavorful meze, perfectly cooked lamb kebabs, and the baklava was out of this world! Fresh ingredients and authentic flavors made for a memorable meal. I’ll definitely be back!

Delicious Turkish Cuisine in MilanI recently had the pleasure of dining at Sofra Turkish Restaurant in Milan and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm hospitality and a cozy ambiance that set the tone for the evening.The menu offered a wide variety of traditional Turkish dishes, each bursting with flavors and beautifully presented. I particularly enjoyed the kebabs, which were tender and perfectly seasoned, and the bakava for dessert was a delightful treat.The service was impeccable, with attentive staff members who were knowledgeable about the menu and eager to ensure that every aspect of our dining experience was enjoyable.Overall, Sofra Turkish Restaurant exceeded my expectations with its delicious food, inviting atmosphere, and top-notch service. I highly recommend this gem of a restaurant to anyone looking to savor authentic Turkish cuisine in Milan.
Delicious food, friendly service, and generous portions :) Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
Everything was perfect, the food (Taouk shish), the service, the ambiance, the dessert (baklava is EXCELLENT). Don’t hesitate !!!!🤩🤩 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
Very yummy panino kebab, not expensive, very friendly staff, loved it Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

We had dinner at this restaurant, and it was very delicious. Now it’s my favorite place in Milan. The people who work there are very nice. As a Turkish woman, I rate it 10 out of 10. When I was eating, I felt like I was at home. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More
Very authentic and tasty food! Probably the best in Milano! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Thank you very much for your kind hospitality. Taste and service are perfect. If you new to Milano and looking for both delicious and Halal meal this is your place. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Must visit place!!! The Turkish hospitality is going a long way. It’s clean and very welcoming and most importantly they serve one of the best kabap in Milano Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 … More
I liked the pide, incredibly cheap, lots of protein Food : 5/5 … More

I absolutely adored this place. Not only is it a restaurant but it is also a shooing market. The food was served nice and hot and I love how you can choose what extra sauces or seasoning you want on your meal. It’s a perfect place for family and friends. You’d enjoy the experience! Follow me on Instagram for more. @officiallyroni_

The food is always good. Staff is friendly and have never had an issue with waiting on our order or getting refills on chips or drinks quickly. Good mixed surf and turf type menu with several kinds of meats available. I eat here a couple times a month at least. Would recommend.

El Torito is such a good somewhat hidden gem. It's pricier than most Mexican food in town but it's worth it for the portions and the quality. They get three stars only because there is always a long wait for food but I would still go back, the food is that good. I highly suggest an appetizer so you have something to eat while you wait. The salsa is great and I highly recommend the fajitas.

Great selection of products and the staff are very helpful!  The attached restaurant is really wonderful as well but if you don’t have the time to stop there, they have a deli section, bakery, dessert shop, meat counter, and other grab n go options.  We drive from Lawrence to shop here about once a month or so.  It’s just that good.

The food is fantastic!! The condiment bar is the best! Plenty of food for your money. Only complaints....the music can be loud so it annoying & hard to visit....there to eat & talk, not listen to loud music. Last visit it was Freezing Cold, everyone was complaining & we actually were shivering! Food got cold right away so we got togo's & left. They knew but did nothing. Will go back but if it's that cold again my rating will go down. Definitely worth eating there.

One of the best Mexican Restaurants in the Topeka area, food is high quality and will fill you up, came here multiple times since they built it, never let me down. The supermarket is also great, lots of variety, good pastries, and those chocolate bananas I got once were amazing, would recommend.

10.99 for 6 huge beef tamales! Ummm yes please. Great chips and guac. Fresh baked goods. Just a fun  and great smelling store. Didn't even eat at the restaurant. Food directly from store was all we needed. Ate I. The parking lot like savages.

One of my favorite places to go for some good marinated meat. The Arrachera is the BEST (pictured), and we also enjoy the marinated pork meat for making tacos Al pastor.Staff is always friendly, attentive, and accommodating. Good prices on fresh produce as well!

The food was delicious, very conveniently attached to the grocery store. I wished for more Hispanic decor.  Never shop for groceries on an empty stomach. Restaurant staff were pleasant, restaurant and grocery store were very clean and organized.  Yes, my wife and I will be returning.
They were decent busy for a Sunday.  The food looks good but very salty so we can’t quite finish themThe rice in the sushi roll was good.  We had to flag down the server to get water.

Came with a group of friends. We ordered the okonomiyaki, two of us got the combo sets, and others entrees. The food was large portion and very delicious. The 6pc nigiris were huge. The okonomiyaki has a lot of meat on it and an egg. We would come here again.

Overall it's a good experience and the good is unique it's own category. The business specializes in Japanese pancakes, Okonomiyaki, and a few other specific side dishes. Wait list can be long as the business is small and gets busy really fast. I would recommend coming in early right when it opens as the business is not your usual 9 to 5 hours of operation; it opens around 5 30 pm.Portion and quality of the dish is good, a bit saucey and hidden meat portions with a large portion of vegetables. If you like to eat, I would say it's just enough for you to be content a for the duration of your stay. However, if you wanted to eat another dish, you can easily order another without getting too full. Service was lacking as the waiters and waitress' had to perform multiple roles to ensure customer service. However, being that the place is busy, they overlook the basic service of asking the customer the quality of the meal, refilling water, and having ready to-go containers of any left overs. I felt the establishment lacked service, thus 1 star taken away.I would come again but given the circumstances of their limited hours, long wait times, and somewhat small portions - in my perspective, I'm not too inclined to make this my priority. Was a good experience.

I went to this place for a pre birthday celebration with my parents! It was pretty empty when we went in on a 6:30 pm on Tuesday but filled up so quickly after that that we had to have a reservation to get a seat!Food: I loved the pancake items they had - I got the house special and the seafood special! I definitely preferred the house special since it had a good balance of sweet and savory. We also got the taiyaki dessert which had the perfect cool finish to the meal!Service: The staff here are good at their job and super super kind. They were patient and you see your food made in front of you!Ambiance: A more upscale casual place!A truly unique and fun experience to be had!Make sure to ask about the yelp special!

It’s actually shown as Rokko from the outside. The okonomiyaki tasted really good and authentic (approved by my gf lived in Japan for 4 years)— the amount of cabbage and it’s sweetness were just impressive. Their chicken karaage was one of the best in South Bay. The were a variety of okonomiyaki, and we would come back to try different flavors!

Came here for lunch & to try their okonomiyaki (~Japanese pancakes). The service was awesome w/ friendly & very helpful wait staff. Parking wasn’t too bad, but like most of Santa Clara now... it’s a risk to getting ur windows smashed (warning on the door). But of course the highlight was their okonomiyaki, which my friend and I both tried different things. They had a Stewed Beef & Egg combo w/ the Beef Bowl add-on. I had the Negi Tsukimi-Tama w/Modan (adding noodles on top) because I love a ton of green onion. Though seemingly unassuming of a portion (looks generous but just right), you will find yourself stuffed by the deceptive amount they give you. The food is very good esp. as u add the sauce offered on the table.

Loved everything we had especially the nice cold beer and the ikura onigiri. I'm very impressed with the authentic taste of the okonomiyaki. Super friendly service, fresh ingredients, delicious food! This is definitely the best place for okonomiyaki in the Bay Area.

Why you should visit this place at least once:- Excellent customer service across servers- Appetizers- Japanese Okonomiyaki experience, though they added a lot of cheese to the otherwise traditional  dish- Ramune soda, a Japanese soft drink which my 11 year old really enjoyed; so much so that we ended up visiting several Japanese grocery stores to purchase Ramune after this dining experience

Okonomiyaki here was OK, but I’ve definitely had better elsewhere. Their special okonomiyaki with yakisoba noodles was quite large, certainly enough to feed two people, but I found the pork underwhelming and wish I had ordered something with seafood instead. The beef rice bowl was quite good, however, and other items on the menu look promising, so I will give them another shot.

Two of us ordered 9 dishes as we were a little excited. A little too much than our stomach can take. All dishes are great and better than most dim sum places in the south bay. Among the 9 dishes, we like dumplings, sesame balls, and bean curd roll a lot. Sesame balls are a little expensive at $15, but they are the best I have had so far (I like dessert a lot). The place is comfy, the dim sum carts are all around you. The jasmine tea uses true high quality tea leaves that is one of the best in Chinese restaurants I have been to. This place has been on the Michelin list twice (2016 and 2021). They deserve it.

Fresh hot foods prepared from fresh ingredients.  Everyone was very kind,polite,professional and helpful. Manager check on us to be sure we were well care for. Best Chinese food served in the cleanest restaurant in San Francisco.  Highly recommend for any special occasion. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Dim sum carts roll by constantly. The food is hot off of the carts. Some nice dishes that we tried. The service is prompt. Checkout is table side and like everything else in SF, electronic. Interesting that any of the servers or bus persons can check you out. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Yank Sink offers a nice variety of dim sum, both steamed and fried, that's sure to please dim sum enthusiasts. Conveniently located inside the mall, its dining area extends into the mall itself, creating a casual and relaxed atmosphere.The service at Yank Sink is efficient, with dim sum carts making rounds for patrons to choose from. Additionally, they offer the option to order some items via QR code, adding a modern touch to the dining experience.One of the best parts about Yank Sink is its reasonable prices. For just $70, two people can enjoy a satisfying meal without breaking the bank.In summary, Yank Sink is a solid choice for dim sum lovers looking for a tasty and affordable dining experience in a relaxed setting.

My husband and I made a last minute reservation for brunch and they were able to seat us. As soon as we sat down, the ladies with the carts came by immediately and we chose what we wanted. We’ve never had our food served in less than 60 seconds until we found this place. We also tried the Egg Custard Tart (but forgot to take a picture because it was so damn good) and it was delicious. Not too sweet, and the tart pastry was perfect. This is such an underrated restaurant and I must say this is my new favorite Dim Sum spot.

I have a low bar for dim sum served to me immediately off of passing carts. I thought it was ALL amazing, but I was also starving and thrilled that I had way too much food on the table in less than 90 seconds. But to be fair, some of the rolls (sea bass and sweet potato) were outstanding. Can't mess up a dumpling, in my opinion--they were all great. Lovely service.

Yank Sing is hands-down one of the best dim sum restaurants in San Francisco. I've been a customer of theirs for years and their food is *always* consistently delicious and perfectly prepared.If you haven't tried the dim sum from Yank Sing, you absolutely should. It's not a real "day out in SF" without dining on truly amazing Chinese food.❤️

Serving dim sum is an art in my opinion, much like sushi craftsmanship. It is delicate, unforgiving and beautiful all wrapped up in rice noodles. Yank Sing is brilliant in all of this while adding a beautiful location and wonderful service. An extensive menu and great drink choices round out the perfect total package. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Pork Potsticker, Steamed Dumplings, BBQ Pork, Sauce, Shrimp Dumpling, Shumai … More

Walked in on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. The food arrived pretty quickly from the time the table was assigned to the time I could review the menu. The food goes around in a cart. Based on what one would like to order, the waiter/waitress will provide the food from the cart. It was busy but the service was quick. Ordered the pork soup dumpling and pork potstickers. Both were really good and arrived very quickly. Great place to dine in with friends and family. I wish this place was open for dinner as well. Definitely will come again to try the desserts

We came to the restaurant pretty late, around 8 but was still able to get seats. Service was a bit slow but the servers were really nice. The food was great and the portions were generous especially the Gyro platter. The ambience was relaxing with good lighting. There was  heaters for outdoor seating. Food : 5/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Gyro Meat Platter, Paidakia Lamb Chops … More

Decorated spot with savory greek dishes. The waiters were friendly and offered recommendations if you aren't sure.Food: I ordered the "Pasticio" which reminded me of lasagna with noodle for pasta and nutmeg as an herb. It was very tasty and a pretty safe dish to order for meat lovers.Service: Regular check-ups, nice recommendations, very helpful waiters!Overall, I would come back. If there was only one thing I would order it would be the "Gyro Fries."

Good food (albeit, nothing extraordinary), comfy surroundings and reasonably priced.  Service is good, but not great.  We felt we waited a little long between when our orders were placed and served (first dish was the soup, which arrived nearly 20 minutes later).  The place was busy, so I'll use that for their excuse for now.  Hopefully next time will show an improvement.

I had been to this place for lunch during a weekday. The place is very vibrant with a beautiful outdoor sitting. Service was quick. Food was delicious. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
Grilled Pita Bread

We are locals to this location and continuously have bad experiences. We generally like the food at Opa but the service is awful. I don't know if they're under staffed or what but we are regularly turned away for a small table when they're less than half full and when we do get seated they are slow and orders are messed up.I'd recommend going elsewhere, it's a shame

Previous reviews and Thrillist recommended this place for their lamb chops. They don't disappoint. I came on a late Sunday afternoon and the place was still super busy at 2 pm. The service was fast and my food arrived fresh and piping hot. My lamb chops were moist and the meat was easy to tear into. It paired really well with a side of noodles and the corn. It's a big portion and worth the visit.
Great food!  Food had lots of flavor and was fresh. The beef souvlaki was so tender I could fit it with a fork.  The staff was friendly, attentive and helpful.

My first time trying Opa, loved the food here. The place and ambience are nice, they have a decent bar but the food was amazing. We had the zucchini fries with avocado dip. The dip was fantastic. For main course we had the rustic veggie flat bread which was very well made in wood oven. Second entree we tried was special of season called vegetable briam, which was a combo of well cooked veggies, aka delicious.The staff is very friendly and service is great. Plus the location is really good

Had 4 Tacos and the beet salad for a late lunch!   Recommend both since the beets were freshly done and served w goat cheese to add some salty flavor to them.   Tried Fish and Chicken taco and I would recommend the fish taco over the chicken which lacked a bit of character compared to to the fried fish.The service was a bit slow but they were busy.Parking: Had to park in the public parking lot on the next street!  Street parking is rare in this area  and sometimes risky.

Tacolicious Marina in San Francisco, CA:"Tacolicious is a great spot for authentic Mexican food. The tacos are always fresh and flavorful, and the margaritas are top-notch. I especially love the shrimp tacos and the grilled octopus. The service is also excellent, and the atmosphere is fun and lively. I highly recommend Tacolicious to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Mexican meal."Here are some specific details about my experience at Tacolicious Marina:The tacos were made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The tortillas were soft and flavorful, and the fillings were cooked perfectly.The margaritas were well-made and refreshing. I had the classic margarita, and it was perfectly balanced.The service was friendly and attentive. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and made recommendations that we enjoyed.The atmosphere was fun and lively. The restaurant was crowded, but it didn't feel too noisy or chaotic.Overall, I had a great experience at Tacolicious Marina. The food was delicious, the drinks were excellent, and the service was top-notch. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Mexican meal.Here are some additional tips for your visit to Tacolicious Marina:Make a reservation, especially if you're planning to visit on the weekend.Be prepared to wait for a table, as the restaurant is often crowded.Try the shrimp tacos or the grilled octopus.Order a margarita or another Mexican cocktail.Enjoy the fun and lively atmosphere.

The Baja fish taco and shrimp taco were delicious. The cocktails were very well balanced and easy to drink. Service was very fast and attentive. Overall very pleasant experience, would come back. Food : 4/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 Recommended dishes
… More
Delicious drinks that won't break your wallet in the SF Marina District. Food : 5/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 3/5 … More

Service was very nice, quick and kept checking in regularly.The atmosphere was so nice and welcoming. Loved the plants a lot!They serve chips and salsa as soon as you get seated - it’s bottomless. So you can have a lot of chips and salsa!But most important - the food was so good! All tacos tasted so good, very fresh and yummy!

I was so hungry I scarfed down my fish taco before I remembered to take a photo, but I did get a photo of the delicious margarita that came my way at Tacolicious.  Definitely a good restaurant to know about. Check it out if you find yourself on Chestnut Street in San Francisco. 2024 update: I enjoyed another meal at Tacolicious which included a Negroni this time. Really nice.
Tacos! Tacos! Tacos!! Loved beaf, mushroom, spicy shrimp. They can improve on the salsas though. Food : 5/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Watermelon marg was so yummy. Tacos are a bit expensive but if ur in SF its relatively average price for that area. We got our ticket messed up, the staff apologized, and we got two shots of very nice tequila for free and a fixed ticket.This restaurant really seems like they care about the customer experience! Delicious tacos and friendly service. What more could you ask for!

Not bad, but fairly overpriced. Food was fresh/ prepared well but half of the taco selections are really gimmicky. On that note; I don’t recommend the pastrami taco.  Guacamole is handmade but expensive. I can see why this place is popular with the ‘marina girls’ ….but the portions aren’t sufficient for a 200 pound male with an athletic metabolism to get their moneys worth.

This place was just ok. It was more of a "fancy" taco experience it did not have that street taco taste. The beef was better than the chicken it was full of flavor. The Guac lacked flavor it needed more lime and salt. The bean dip was the best and the cheese sauce was spicy but tasted like the kind you could get at the super market. I had a margarita and it was perfect but my friend said his was too sweet. Over all I wasn't impressed and wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for a good street taco. We had beef, chicken and chorizo tacos.

Ever been to a bar where the bartender makes you feel like they’re doing you a favor by serving you? Well, this is the feeling you get when being served by the bartender(s).I don’t know her name specifically, because they don’t wear name tags, but horrible service from a bar aspect. Great food!

What a good restaurant. Very nice eating area, great food, and excellent service! I absolutely loved our server, Cynthia. She’s incredible. So sweet but also gets the job done. We came on taco Tuesday so it was a great deal too! Thanks for a good night and great food. Maybe don’t come with a large group because they have a sign at the front making it clear they don’t like big groups. Signs say a lot.

Food was very nice and fresh. Chips and salsa was very good too. Overall good experience. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes
… More

Great atmosphere and staff was super. Decor is clean and modern and there is a nice large parking lot. Menu is detailed and has a lot of variety. I can only give 3 stars because I was willing to pay $32 for an entree of 12 prawns (as described on the menu), but what I got was 12 (mostly) large shrimp:( Seriously???!! I cannot believe they advertised the dish as prawns and, since there are no sides that come with this dish, that price should have DEFINITELY only been for PRAWNS!!! Very disappointing and makes me not want to even go back to try something else on the menu.

Had an excellent experience. It was a busy Friday night, my date and i walked in and we were greeted and seated quickly. Our server (gentleman with long hair) was attentive, friendly and prompt. The staff checked in with us and took our plates when we were finished.Excellent experience. The food was really good. Think i found my new favorite spot!

My recent visit to The Mexican Restaurant in Hayward was an absolute delight! After not being there for a couple of years, I was pleasantly surprised to find that they had undergone a stunning remodel. The new colonial Spanish vibes create a spectacular aesthetic that instantly caught my eye.For date night, my husband and I decided to sit at the bar, where we were promptly served our drinks. We started off with the Cristalino Tequila flight that was simply exquisite. Since it was a Friday during Lent, we opted for the shrimp quesadilla, which was incredibly tasty and filling.The atmosphere on a Friday night was lively and bustling, with plenty of people enjoying their meals and drinks. I particularly enjoyed the playlist of Mexican music, which added to the overall experience.Overall, The Mexican Restaurant exceeded my expectations with its beautiful ambiance, delicious food, and vibrant atmosphere. I can't wait to go back for another visit

Mediocre food. Nothing special. Tried the chicken tortilla soup and it was just thrown together not a real soup. You can't just put some chicken pieces into some chicken broth and call it soup.The baja fish tacos were so over fried and thrown together. Tasted more like moon rocks with mayo.But the service was fine and the restaurant was comfortable.Parking: They have a free parking lot.

Used to be great, traditional Mexican, now they charge for chips and salsa, don’t offer 1,2 or 3 items combos on the menu anymore so you get everything A la Carte with no beans and rice, so $10 for 1 Taco, $10 for 1 enchilada, really expensive for the portions. It’s basically white washed “Healthy” food now. I ordered the Combo fajitas and was expecting some sizzling peppers and onions maybe some tomatoes and mushrooms and all I got was some squash, Zucchini and Broccoli. The steak, shrimp and Chicken was cooked well and had good flavor though. I guess it’s closer to Whole Foods now and less Taco Truck. The service staff was excellent though along with the restaurant being clean and a nice atmosphere, but back to Mexico Lindo or La Piñata for me.

More than a 3 less than a 4 stars.Came here with a group of 9 for a birthday dinner. Drove past this place hundreds of times and never thought to stop.They have a huge building that can accommodate 50+ parties and even park-let style outdoor seating attached to the building.Our server was on point with our party. He checked in on us and made sure all of our food was correct when it was brought out to us. They didn't mess up a single order.I ordered a beergarita (pictured), honey had a regular and others at the table had mango margaritas. The regular margarita glass was smaller than the mango margaritas. All of the margs we're meh. Nothing to call and Uber over.When trying new Mexican restaurants always start with the carne asada, if their carne asada is not strong, the menu won't be strong either.I had the steak wet burrito and honey had the steak, chicken, and shrimp fajitas. The fajitas came with a lot of veggies and they were good too. Both were good and tasted familiar. Someone in another review said it good enough to go back but nothing to crave and I couldn't agree more.Once we left we found out the same owners of Metro Taqueria own this place. Which is why the food tasted a little familiar.Will definitely come back.

As a vegan it’s really difficult to find a great sushi place.  A friend suggested this restaurant and oh boy ! Loved their spicy garlic edamame. Spicy veggie roll was a great hit. Tiger roll was also great.  Guava juice , also very good. Would definitely recommend these items Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Such creative and cute sushi :)The atmosphere of the place is relaxed and funSmall detail but big bonus: our server was observant and waited for our convo to finish before placing the plates between us.Didn’t come by much but they came in time with a check-up/check as we’re ready/finished & ready to pay/leave. I enjoyed their service :)Second and third times were also great ^^

First time trying this place and it’s now our favorite place for sushi in the Bay Area. TLDR food is fresh, their service is awesome, space is a bit tight. We ordered a deluxe chirashi and a oh baby box for two of us. They both came with a free miso soup. Food is fresh and we are very happy with the portion. A big highlight of the dinner was the service here. The sever was very patient when explaining the menu for us and gave us extra napkins to hold the tea cups since they were very hot. We also asked for extra wraps for the sushi box and were given a lot (and they have soy paper here too!). It seems that they also do takeout with pretty good packaging. We will definitely come here again!

The attached pics have sauces on the side for gluten freeness. The sushi was generally great. My favorite was the yellowtail sashimi. The guava juice was pretty great too. Definitely utilize their spicy mayo when you visit.

This is a really cute place! They have amazing veggie and vegan sushi options. And their rolls are soo delicious. Everything is finger lickin good! The service is quick and nice. I would definitely visit this place again. Highly recommend it if you are looking for some good vegetarian or vegan options! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

The service here has really gone to the dumps, but the food remains consistently good. This is one of our favorite restaurants in the bay area but I think this is the end of our dine in days, they don't seem to have scaled their staff and operations to manage both dine in and take out. They seem overwhelmed and missed orders, got some dishes only after we reminded them twice. I don't remember the service being this bad, but it was poor enough to put us off. Might only consider this for take out from now on coz the food is still amazing.Excellent Vegan Sushi. On par or even better than Shizen. Veggie on fire, Veggie bomb, sushi taco and the jalapeno bomb are our favs. The spicy garlic edamame is great but can set your mouth on fire - ask for mild! The junmai hakatsuku sake is unbelievably smooth - don't miss out on this one!

I absolutely loved this place, I’m pretty picky about my sushi and this killed it Perfect size, fresh, perfect amount of rice and everything. I will 100% come back. Oh baby roll & Warriors Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

** Pro tip: This place fills up really fast since the seating is very limited. So early to secure a place as it closes early too.Will review our entire order from the 1st received to the last.Miso Soup: Decent flavor. Good to start with on a cold day.Avocado Maki (6 pcs)Simple avocado roll. Nothing special.Big Daddy MakiLittle bland compared to some of the other ones. But really flavorful tofu curd.Mango and Asparagus rollHas a strong asparagus flavor. Good bite to it.The chef sauce is really nice.Veggie On FireA little spicy. But very close to spice veggie roll. Absolutely delicious.Loved both the Spicy mayo and the sriracha sauce. The entire combination comes really well together.Spicy Veggie Roll:The avocado and tofu filling along with the spicy mayo and paprika with black sesame seeds and lightly deep fried just oozes flavors in your mouth.The warm sushi just melts in your mouth with a slight bite to it. Absolutely must try.Vegetarian options: All the fried sushis are amazing. The entire combination comes really well together.

Oh Baby Sushi! You took my heart away :)So I don't relish Sushi at all, but my sister spoke highly of Oh Baby Sushi.She said I would love their innovative preparations.And to my surprise, I loved a couple of dishes there - "Spicy veggie rolls" and "Call me nuts" sushi.It's a must try restaurant!!

First off, how we were greeted and welcomed was far more impressive than our table service was. Not that it was poor, just not as lively and as friendly. Ok… enough of that. The visit was certainly worth it. Fior d’Italia was recommended by a friend and certainly being able to claim we ate at the oldest active restaurant in the U.S. made it a must visit. We very much enjoyed our meal and visit.

The restaurant seems solid and cozy :) the waiter was friendly and professional. He is patient to our questions. The food is okay. We went during the restaurant week and I got the $45 menu. The food is quite on the salty side. The salad is a bit too vinegary than what I liked. The portion is big though! And they cut the cake for our birthday party :)

This was my first time and I must say, What a find! My girlfriend and I were visiting for dinner before catching Pauly Shore at the Cobbs Club a block away. We're both on a Ketogenic diet and we found it easy to order. We both got an 11 oz. steak with asparagus. Including a small side salad with oil and vinegar from the table.The steak was delicious and cooked to perfection. The asparagus was good, but the salad was great!I am glad I took the opportunity to treat myself and my lady to a great meal out and we didn't cheat on our diet.Dietary restrictions: Keto was easy to do here, just speak with the wait staff about your needs.

An absolutely outstanding place to visit. Warmly greeted by the host, and even though we were early for our reservation we were sat without hesitation. Starting with champagne and ending with dessert, we could not have been happier with the meal, the service, and the ambiance. The gnocchi were so light and outstanding, and the bolognaise sauce on the lasagna was incredibly rich and flavorful. Appetizer plate of homegrown tomatoes, melon and prosciutto, grilled prawns, and olives was presented well and quite appealing. The piano player was pleasant and conversational, and even played our wedding song. If I didn't live 3,000 miles away, I would go back frequently.

--The Oldest Italian Restaurant in America--This place has the old-fashioned 1960's homey vibes you're looking for in an Italian restaurant, just absolutely delightful and great for a night out. When you walk in, you are greeted with decorum and interior design of an old-age Italian Trattoria, plucked right from Rome or Florence. The servers are very courteous and friendly as well. The menu is about as classic as it gets, which could be a good thing or bad thing (all your Italian and Italian-American favorites are here, but there is not much reinvention or creativity in the menu). Some of my personal favorite items I tried were the Pesto pasta, as well as the Risotto alla Milanese (though would've prefered if the Risotto came with the Milanese Veal too). The fried calamari was also a classic and very tasty. Overall I think it's a great place, a little on the pricey side but great for a night out in SF North Beach.

Down on Chesnut street visiting with my pal Cy Anará and his little stab Luluchia, and she blurts out something about the polenta from Fior d'Italia is just like Nona made back in Naples...can we go?It's right around the corner from their home, it took 4 minutes to get there and we were welcomed like we were heroes returning from war.  Everything about Fior d'Italia was Amazing, ..the atmosphere was exciting, the crowd buzzed with a sense of being in the right place at the right time, the vibe was as electrifying as the service was, and Luluchia was right..the Polenta with chicken was Spectacular! ☆☆☆☆☆

My fiancè and I escaped to SF for a celebratory getaway, celebrating our brand new engagement and his birthday. We were staying at a hotel down the street and wandered up Mason Street for dinner. We came upon Fior d’Italia and saw the sign stating “America’s Oldest Italian Restaurant” and we were intrigued and hungry! This lovely restaurant exceeded our expectations. Lalo greeted us with a “welcome home”, was able to seat us immediately and we went on to have a delicious meal with live piano being played by a charming performer. From the fresh crusty bread to the pancetta wrapped prawns to the pumpkin ravioili, to the BEST cannoli I have ever had, we loved every moment. Friendly, warm, delicious, and just HAPPY vibes at this restaurant. We were so happy we stumbled upon this historic gem!
Celebrated a special birthday and had amazing service. The food is amazing and we had a lot of fun with the live music as well. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Every moment we spent on a Sunday afternoon at this historic restaurant was truly divine. We listened to fabulous (and well-seasoned) jazz musicians during our leisurely (3-hour) lunch. Our waiter Gil regaled us with tales about the origin of our bottle of Italian wine, as he served up a scrumptious 4-course beautifully plated meal. The atmosphere transports you to another very special place and time. A perfect way to spend an afternoon by the Bay.

We researched a good restaurant in Little Italy in hopes to find something amazing AND WE DID!  Not only does it claim to be the oldest Italian restaurant in the US it’s also amazing.  We went with four of us and we all enjoyed what we had.  While the restaurant was a little older, it added to the historic piece of the restaurant.  The staff was friendly and we can’t stop talking about how yummy the food was.

Metro Station located in the shopping area. So convenient for the people who want to come for shopping or for tourism here. There are many exits and some exits are far from the other ones so check carefully before you get out. It is also connected to RER A in underground. There are line 14 and RER D which are not so far to walk. The bus stops are not so far also.
A brilliant metro station that provides easy access to the fancy area of Opéra.
Amazing mall. Just one of the most famous in Paris
Nice clean station. Good connectivity. Very friendly staff.
Took the M9 from Chatelet to here.
Small station

A very pretty restaurant with incredibly talented servers. The ambiance was a 10/10.I just wish the food matched the vibe.My Risotto was undercooked and kind of crunchy. The lettuce wrap appetizers were very bland, and I’m almost certain the bread pudding was microwaved; it came way too hot. I give the Mac and cheese croquettes and cocktails a 5/5. Absolutely delicious!

Prompt, friendly service. Good flavors and portions. Would definitely eat here again. We had the Rueben, clam chowder, beat salad, a burger, and oysters. All were very good. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 Recommended dishes

Newly renovated space with high ceilings and an appreciation for nature and the history of the locale. Looks like they were training new servers while we were there.  They were all very friendly and responsive. The food fell below my expectations, though.  The bread plate felt old. The Niçoise salad was very short on fish. The grilled asparagus was the best of all our choices, alongside the fresh oysters, of course.

One of the few places open for dinner, and it's quite homey inside. It was getting late so we were struggling to find some local food after our backpacking trip. The Station House Cafe burger was juicy and savory and the mushroom risotto just hit the spot. A bit pricey for what you get, but I'd definitely recommend it. We were delighted to find a restaurant with modern decor and spacious ceiling height. We both wanted the Seared Steelhead, but they only have one order left. I questioned why they ran out of Steelhead before seven o'clock when people were still coming in after us, it appears that because the cafe is closed on Wednesdays (the next day), they didn't keep enough stock. So, I broke my gluten-free diet and opted for Linquini  & Clams without garlic butter. Both dishes were well made, well plated and very enjoyable. To finish, my partner ordered Apple of Your Eye for desert.

Great food, beautiful ambiance, and good service. The cocktails were delicious as well. We Initially went on a Saturday night in the off season, and it was still super busy. The restaurant has just undergone a major renovation and everything was truly fabulous. Loved the ambiance of the restaurant and bar. The service was very good and the food fabulous! Hubby and I started with an appetizer of fried oysters with a cornmeal crust and were not disappointed. We then shared the fresh steelhead salmon and the pork chop. Both were cooked perfectly. There is a full bar and nice wine and beer selection as well. We plan on going back while we are here.

Service and atmosphere were perfect.Food can be s little better.Fried oysters were great with tartar sauce! Recommend!Clam chowder does not cater to my taste. Somehow watery and almost no clams.The price was high based on the portion.I guess maybe i didn’t get the best experience because lunch menu is so limited. Dinner menu looks great!

Sonya was AMAZING! It was my very first spray tan & I was nervous because I didn’t know what to expect but she made me feel so comfortable and walked me through the whole process. I will definitely be coming back!

I first went to Bronze Buddha for my schools prom and I have been going ever since. I have tried out many other spray tanning places and none of them have lasted as long or been as convenient as this place. My skin is pretty dry and my spray tans tend to peel off and get patchy and not once has it gotten patchy here. Sonya is so sweet; I have been to her multiple times and you can tell she actually cares about making your tan look perfect. The location is perfect and not hard to find at all, and their pricing is very reasonable. I wish I could write all the reasons I would recommend this place but that would take hours. Honestly if your looking for an amazing tan that will last and not make you look orange go here.

I'm not one to write reviews but wow - words can't describe how amazing my experience was! It was my first time getting an airbrush tan and I was a little nervous but she was super personable and made it a very comfortable experience! Super cute space, it is a little hidden but she gives great directions on her website to find it. If you can't decide if you want an airbrush tan or you are looking for a new salon to go to, I would HIGHLY recommend heading to Sonya. She gave me the perfect color for my skin tone and the tan made me feel 10x better about my skin! PRO TIP: For $5 you can mix in anti-aging and an amazing scent (I choose Pineapple and it was so good) - they are worth every penny! I'll definitely be recommending this salon to all my friends. Thanks Bronze Buddha Glow, I'll definitely be back!

The girls here are awesome. I got a spray tan with Reina as a trial before I get my spray tan before my wedding and I’m obsessed. They will customize your tan according to what they thing will be the best shade for you and even have a lotion that is a tan extender in case you need the shade to last longer. They even worked around some sunburn peeling that i had on my back. I let them know when I will be leaving town for my wedding and Reina didn’t hesitate to say yes to coming in to tan me and get me ready for my big day which is such a weight lifted off my shoulders.

This was one of the best tans that I’ve ever gotten. It still looks great even after multiple days. I have very light skin, and therefore typically my tans don’t fade well, but she recommended a prep spray that has made it fade amazing! I’ve been looking for a good place in the Arcadia area for years, and honestly I would drive 20 minutes for her! I’ve been in the spray tan and beauty industry for over a decade, and cannot recommend this place enough. On top of an amazing tan, she was super friendly and makes the experience fun!

I’ve never had a bad tan with Sonya. She cares so much about her clients. She goes above and beyond to make sure that everyone gets the perfect custom glow and is always accommodating. She is the first person I’ve ever gotten a spray tan from and I’ve followed her to her new studio! Not only that but everyone I’ve ever referred has had the best absolute experience. I cannot stress enough how amazing Sonya is. 🥂☀️❤️ So proud of her and know she’ll give you the best glow ever!

I will 1000000% be recommending Sonya to all my friends wanting spray tans from now on!! Sonya is so welcoming and is very detail oriented so she makes sure you come out looking perfect! She is so sweet and even checked in on me after my appointment to make sure I was loving my tan. Amazing quality tan and amazing quality service!! Positive

OK so I’ve seen a lot of scary spray tans and it’s usually turned me off from ever trying it. But one of my best friends went to Sonya and looked amazing so I figured I’d try before a vacation. YALL. I’m feeling like a golden goddess. No weird orange, no weird lines, it’s perfect! And Sonya is an absolute gem. She made me feel 1000% comfortable and has the sweetest spirit. I told her my only concern was it being too good and me wanting to come back and that’s EXACTLY what’s happened! If you’re considering it, go to Sonya ASAP! You will not regret it

I had my first spray tans with Sonya, and I only wish I would have done it sooner. She was so accommodating and explained every step of the process to me.  It was as painless as possible and I look like I came back from the Caribbean with the most gorgeous glow! Her place is so cute & she is extremely friendly & responsive. I bought the mango grapefruit lotion from her for extra hydration & it smells amazing! Thank you so much, can’t wait for my next tan ! 💗💗

I was referred by an amazing Stylist in the Phoenix area, Risa Kostis and I was not disappointed! First, Sonya is so welcoming and made me feel so comfortable with the entire process. There are a lot of step when getting a spray tan from the prep to the aftercare. Sonya made all the information easy to understand and accessible. When I arrived, we discussed what color I wanted and what additives were available - I decided to try the warm vanilla scent and an anti-aging serum. During the treatment, she was precise and professional with each step. The aftercare was clear and easy to keep up with. It has been a week since I received my spray tan and I am obsessed! It was perfect from day 1 and it looks natural (which is what I wanted!). One of the most difficult areas to avoid the tell-tale signs of a spray tan is the hands/wrists and she did an amazing application on them. I left wearing one of her after-tan dresses and it was so nice to not have to worry about transferring my tan on my car seats or couch before bed! I highly recommend Bronze Buddha Glow & all the extras that I mentioned above. Get yourself the dress - you won’t regret it!

Fast and friendly delivery service.Good pizzas and salad.We recommend.

Ordered online and got a plate with extra meats.Honestly for the prices now a days it wasn't too bad compared to some local spots.Good portion of food while solid flavors. The roll and dumplings were mid but the rest was good.

I ordered the Beef Teriyaki. Decent food, however the portion of meat they give is too low given the high price. They fill the container with rice and put only a few pieces of beef. The service speed was fast but it was a bit chaotic due to not knowing which container is your order. This is a mall location, so seating may be hard to find.In summary, a bit too pricey, but a good option for a mall lunch.

This is usually the place I go to everytime I go to this mall due to affordable prices since it's considered fast food and  also the quality of the food. Not really authentic Japanese food, but this is good for coming by if you're hungry. Also the fact that the amount of protein of meats are probably high due to serving large portions.The taste of the chicken is alright, but vegetables taste kinda bland. I will still eat here though.

I used to love this place 15 years ago... when they had bigger portions, mushrooms and friendlier staff.Food's still good.I asked the guy if they had mushrooms and he was impolite and said no. I stood in line for 10 minutes and they were super shady on the scoops of meat from one person to another. But what do I know, I'm just a customer.

Japanese fastfood at the foodcourt of Westfield Valley fair. they have chicken teriyaki, bento boxes with dumpling, vegetables and california maki. service is fast. Fresh food. Taste is just ok, maybe need a little bit of sauce or seasoning .

This is one of those that you know is probably not healthy or good for you, but the heavily marinated, grilled teriyaki chicken over rice tastes so good that you decide to forgive yourself for eating it.  Conveniently situated in Valley Fair, this is one of my favorite fast food.  It is greasy and salty, but quite delicious!  I suppose you could ask for extra vegetables to try to balance things out.  The only thing that I sometimes worry about is how they handle the cookware between the raw and cooked chicken 🤔🤔🤔

I have eaten many times at Sarku Japan restaurant in Valley Fair Mall San Jose/Santa Clara in the “food court” as people used to call it. I love the chicken teriyaki meal with noodles (or white rice) and vegetables. The meal is prepared right in front of you while you wait. The chicken teriyaki has always been flavored perfectly and cooked just right.  I am not overly fond of the vegetable, so I wish management would improve that. The price is fair.Sarku Japan is popular, but if there is a line, it moves quickly.The food court can be busy at times, but there is always available seating.The combo meal comes either with white rice or noodles. I prefer the flavored noodles. And the vegetables are optional, I believe. A drink costs extra or they have free tap water and ice.

I have been coming to Pearl Garden Restaurant for many years, and it never disappoints! The food is always super authentic. Whether I’m craving their delicious dim sum or a full dinner banquet, every dish is a delight. The service is consistently friendly, and the authentic atmosphere is warm and welcoming. It’s truly my go-to spot for amazing Chinese cuisine. We had the best experience last night - thank you again ! Highly recommend

It was nice to know a new yumcha place for me, and food was good.I wouldn't notice the entrance on the street if I don't know the place, you will need to walk up to level 1 and spot the hidden pearl lol.Staff were friendly enough, some were smiling and some not, well I don't really expect much in a Chinese restaurant lol.Having said that, service was prompt, don't have to ask for tea or top up. Ordered from the menu, you just tick what you feel like.Only feedback to the restaurant management is to tell the dishwashing person to pay more attention on the cleaning, as I can see greasy sharing plate and dirty tea cup...Overall was good enough and will be back. :)

Pearl Garden Restaurant is one of the best Chinese restaurants in Auckland.Having dined at Pearl Garden Restaurant for at least ten times, we  have totally fallen in love with the tasty food and fantastic service offered by the lady owner Mable.We always invite our friends and family members for inch gatherings there and they all enjoy the food and service there.As this restaurant is always fully booked on weekends, please make sure you make online reservations at least a few days before the weekends. We also celebrated our birthday and wedding anniversary there.We highly recommend you to go there for lunch if you live in downtown Auckland or drive past there.Vegetarian options: Deep fried vegetarian spring rolls, steamed vegetarian rice rolls, steamed vegetarian dumplings, egg tarts
I love their dim sum, it’s sooo sooo good. The soft shell crab is also crispy and yummy Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

Genuine Cantonese style. Very busy on Sunday lunchtime, people queuing up the stairs. so I came the second time at 230pm, absolutely beautiful food. I ordered something on the menu which I don't usually see elsewhere, and was delighted deliciously. I like the sunshine through the balcony, the singles section (so you can come alone)Parking is a matter of luck in New Market, perhaps better at Westfield. Definitely my most favorite my top Dim Sum place in NZ.Parking: Best park in Westfield at a short walk

It was a busy Sat noon. Nevertheless service was prompt. Food was yummy. I love the chee cheong fan and sweet soya bean. Very authentic Hong Kong Tim sum!Parking: I would part at Westfield. Free 3hrs parking. And walk over :)

Great experience, I love Japanese cooking, I always try the best place to eat it when travelling and I wanted to practice, finding the rights place to learn. In this couse the Master chef Tatsumoto Tozai gave us detailed and clear procedures to practise in cooking sushi/sashimi. I also enjoyed a lot. Thank you and see you soon at the next course! I definitely recommend that.

Ho visitato Kansai con Tozai: Kobe, bellissima città nella Baia di Osaka; Kyoto con il tempio Kiyomizudera, uno dei templi buddisti più belli del Giappone, e Nishikori Market, caratteristico mercato coperto con tantissime bancarelle e negozi perfetto data la giornata di pioggia, e infine Nara con il Tempio buddista Todai-ji e il Parco con i bellissimi cervi che passeggiano accanto a te!!Grazie ancora a Tozai per la bellissima esperienza.

Sognavo il Giappone, ma non volevo un viaggio organizzato, volevo scegliere io i luoghi e dedicarci il tempo che ritenevo io utile, temevo però l'idea di essere in un posto così lontano da casa senza rete. Ho avuto la fortuna di incontrare Tozai, una società che mi ha aiutata a definire in un itinerario i miei desideri e mi ha aiutata a risolvere tutte le questioni pratiche necessarie per non essere in difficoltà una volta arrivata in Giappone. Mi ha inoltre fornito assistenza anche sul posto nei momenti in cui a me sembrava più utile averla. Insomma ho fatto un viaggio importante con la libertà che volevo ma senza sentirmi senza una copertura in caso di necessità. Quindi per chi volesse visitare il Giappone così come lo desideravo io, davvero Tozai è la soluzione migliore!

I went to Japan with my husband and my children aged 20 and 17 during the Christmas holidays. We all love Japan and with Tozai's support we have been able to appreciate the beauty of this country even more. Unforgettable trip!!

Sushi ,Shodo e Sorrisi! Questo è il ricordo della magica giornata trascorsa da Tozai.Immersi nel folclore giapponesi, abbiamo avuto la possibilità di provare ogni attività proposta dal centro, spaziando dagli origami,i manga,i corsi di scrittura ,lo shodo e il famosissimo sushi! Ogni corso ,ha una sua meravigliosa sfumatura data anche dall'insegnante che lo propone! Abbiamo poi deciso d tornare per intraprendere il corso di Shodo, cioè l'Arte della calligrafia giapponese... A mio avviso molto rilassante e piacevole,quanto erano piacevoli i manicaretti che ogni tanto venivano proposti in assaggio. Sembra di essere in Giappone, è stata una vera occasione di poter evadere dalla routine di tutti i giorni e lasciarsi trasportare dal vento della fantasia,la creatività, e come dicevo prima da tanti sorrisi. Pietro

Siamo stati in Giappone in primavera 2024 e abbiamo chiesto il supporto di Tozai per aiutarci ad organizzare alcune attività che da soli non riuscivamo a prenotare perché molto spesso i siti giapponesi non sono tradotti in inglese. Inoltre, ci hanno garantito un’assistenza per tutto il periodo della nostra permanenza in Giappone. Abbiamo avuto il piacere di visitare il Fushimi Inari ed i templi a Nara con la guida del signor Tatsumoto che non solo ci ha raccontato la storia dei santuari ma ha anche arricchito la nostra giornata con aneddoti interessanti sulla cultura giapponese! E’ stata davvero una giornata arricchente sia per noi che per i nostri figli di 13 e 11 anni.Siamo soddisfatti del servizio ricevuto e di aver conosciuto il signor Tatsumoto.

Ottimo servizio di consulenza e supporto nel ambito bancario con apertura conto per bonifici bancari online presso la città di Kobe.Giro panoramico di Kobe con macchina noleggiata a lungo termine(30 giorni) tutte le pratiche sono state a cura di Mr.Tozai persona super gentile e affidabile che parla italiano in modo fluente. Tutti i servizi sono super consigliati.In allegato foto Kobe Meriken Park -Mosaic Mall.Grazie mille Tozai San

La scuola Tozai merita davvero 5 stelle .. il sensei Tatsumoto e la sua assistente sono, oltre che preparatissimi, sempre pronti a consigliare ed aiutare in ogni occasione.Ottimi gli insegnanti madrelingua.CONSIGLIATISSIMA !!!Vorrei inoltre segnalare che seguono per filo e per segno tutta la prassi nell'ottenere il visto lungo come studente.

Ragazzi che chicca! Per tutti gli amanti del sushi "maltrattati" nel palato, nella vista e nell'anima dagli "all you can eat" tanto di moda oggi consiglio vivamente un'esperienza con lo chef (e amico) Tatsumoto.Ho avuto una moglie giapponese e un po' quindi me ne intendo,...fidatevi!Esperienza meravigliosa fatta a domicilio recentemente nella mia villa di Roma.Subarashii!!

Sono un allievo di Tatsumoto Katsuya, ho fatto un corso Sushi nel 2006 e da lì è partito tutto...Sensei Tatsumoto mi ha preso sotto la sua ala e mi ha insegnato l'arte del Sushi, oggi a distanza di anni siamo a stretto contatto e nel 2018 ho aperto il mio Sushiya a Varallo Vercelli...un ottima scuola per approcciarsi alla cultura giapponese! Ringrazio di cuore Sensei Tatsumoto Katsuya e vi invito a partecipare anche ai suoi viaggi nella terra del Sol Levante!E allora come dicono in GiapponeGambatte!!! FORZA! W TOZAI!
Good food, nice environment. Perfect location in downtown. Close to SkyTrain and Parking.I loved the shrimp appetizer.They weren't busy, but the waitress forgot about us :/

I recently visited the St. Regis Hotel bar for a casual drink after shopping, and I was thoroughly impressed by the level of service provided. The standout moment came when an elderly gentleman entered the bar, and the staff went above and beyond to ensure his comfort. They greeted him warmly, swiftly assisted him with a cozy seat, and attentively catered to his needs with genuine kindness and respect. It was clear that their care was not just about delivering excellent service but about making him feel truly valued and at home. Witnessing such thoughtful and exceptional service made my own experience memorable. The St. Regis Hotel bar exemplifies hospitality at its finest, setting a standard that’s hard to match.

Rustic hotel style old  pub in the heart of Vancouver. Friendly staff and good atmosphere. Bartender really good and attentive. Best Cesar I've had so far in Vancouver. Loaded, spicy, and good. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

We absolutely adore this place! It's a unique blend of upscale and dive bar vibes, with fantastic decor and an exceptional staff. The happy hour is a major draw, running until 6 pm with outstanding prices and a impressive selection. The combination of fancy and laid-back elements makes for a truly special experience. We can't get enough of this gem!

Food options are limited after 9pm but it's a great spot to hang out and drink with friends.  It's nice that they let you order cocktails that aren't on menu as long as the requests aren't overly complex (and they have the ingredients).Cost obviously goes up as you order more alcohol to go with your meal.

Four of us had an awesome time at late night happy hour. The service was excellent - our server Danielle was really fun and friendly (and she checked in often). We were happy with our food choices - the chocolate chip cookie skillet was super decadent.

A really nice unpretentious place to go for drinks and good pub style food. We really enjoyed the atmosphere here, it has a nice genuine pub like feel to it. Plenty of TV's for watching a game. The happy hour drink and food specials are great and they also have daily drink specials at a discount. Whats nice is you actually get a full Pint at discount not a sleeve (although you can elect to order a sleeve size if you wish). I have their take on Bangers and Mash, and it was excellent. They use locally sourced meat. My partner had their burger and she loved it. Our server was Elena and she was excellent, she was always coming by to see if we needed anything. Just a great experience overall. This is definitely going to be a go to place for me, and I will certainly recommend to my friends and family.

Had a nice quiet dinner in a loud sports bar. Watching the Vancouver Canucks on the big screen and getting mentally ready for my early morning flight home.Service was quick, wait staff friendly & honest, and the food was comfort pub food at it's best. My server transplanted herself from Edmonton to Vancouver four years ago and was very friendly and willing to talk about her adopted home town to an obvious visitor.Highly recommended.

I’ve been here a couple times and the food has always been very good. This last time I ordered the Hawaiian pizza and my husband had the Rueben sandwich with fries. Everything was very tasty and I was also happy with the berry sangria and selection of beers. We also asked the bartender to make us a shot of his choice and he made us something super delicious- a Burt reynolds I believe it was called. I’d definitely come back here especially if going to an event at the commodore of Orpheum as both venues are nice and close by.’
best action sport travel agency.

Non potrà che diventare anche la tua Snowave Family!Per chi ha soltanto una passione in testa, per chi ne coltiva molte o per chi come me si trova alla ricerca di nuove scoperte e ha voglia di mettersi in gioco!Apri le porte ad un mondo super organizzato, caloroso ed accogliente! Tante avventure in Italia e all'Estero, sulla neve o su una tavola da surf, con lo Skate o a lezione di yoga. Puoi buttarti sola o con amici ma ciò che ti porterai a casa saranno sicuramente nuove emozioni, nuovi hobbies e nuove anime!Il mondo Snowave è proprio da non perdere!

Abbiamo prenotato a fine marzo il pacchetto all you can snow a Cervinia con #snowave.Linda e Dario hanno organizzato alla perfezione tutti i giorni, curando  ogni dettaglio dall'inizio alla fine.Sempre attenti alle esigenze del gruppo, riescono a  creare un'atmosfera pazzesca  e di grande amicizia.Instancabili nel proporre e nell'organizzare attività extra con la naturalezza di vecchi amici creando stupore, compattezza nel gruppo e tanta allegria.Loro non fanno gli organizzatori, loro fanno parte del gruppo :)sono sempre presenti e premurosi dando anche tanti consigli utili per fare sì che tutto sia super perfetto.È stata un'esperienza fantastica!!! Pochi giorni sono sembrati una settimana ricca di attività, spensieratezza, sport e relax.Da ripetere? Assolutamente si!!Linda e Dario sono davvero persone uniche e con la loro professionalità,  proattività, creatività, allegria e resilienza, hanno contribuito a rendere speciali i nostri giorni e saremo felici di organizzare un'altra avventurano con loro tra surf,skate e snow.Consigliamo a tutti di provare un'avventura con @snowave perché andrà oltre le vostre aspettative.🤙

Ho conosciuto i ragazzi di Snowave per caso su FB.Pur avendo zero esperienza di skate, surf o snowboard, ho cominciato a seguirli perché incuriosita.Quando hanno organizzato l'evento GilrsOnWheels, gratuito per imparare ad andare sullo skate o nuovi trick, ho deciso di buttarmi e provare. Gli skate li hanno messi loro a disposizione, insieme a delle insegnanti eccezionali: si sono dedicate a noi ragazze con passione e pazienza al 100%.Dopo questa esperienza ho deciso di partecipare ad un surf camp in Marocco. Anche questa, esperienza fantastica! Siamo stati 4 giorni in una surf house stupenda, almeno metà giornata era totalmente dedicata al surf divisa tra lezioni dedicate e surf libero, ma comunque sempre seguiti sia dagli insegnanti che dai ragazzi di Snowave. L'atmosfera che si è venuta a creare è stata davvero unica, ma la cosa più bella è che siamo rimasti tutti molto uniti, continuiamo a sentirci e quando possiamo, quando potremo, si organizzano serate per condividere questa passione.Che dire... stra consigliati!!!

Ho seguito gli allenamenti di Yoga e Training for Surfer con Snowave prima di imbattermi nella mia prima esperienza con il surf. Gli allenamenti con Max sono stati professionali e divertenti al tempo stesso e mi hanno dato la preparazione giusta che ho potuto testare la mia prima volta in acqua con il surf e che mi hanno permesso di prendere la prima onda! Sono impaziente di partecipare ad un Surf camp con loro perchè sono certa che sarà un'esperienza super entusiasmante. Linda e Dario sono fantastici e super disponibili e non vedo l'ora che potranno organizzare una skate night per poter condividere passioni e serate divertenti con tutta la community di Snowave!

A perfect day! We had a wonderful day wakesurfing on Lake Maggiore. Linda and Dario, two very easy-going and fun people, a well-organised day, nice people with a great desire to have fun and share.Thanks see you next time!!  ✨

Ho partecipato al surf camp Marocco di Marzo (giusto in tempo per un'ultima boccata d'aria prima del lock down). Trovati su internet ho deciso di provare questa nuova esperienza e partire da sola...Estremamente soddisfatta della scelta fatta!Linda e Dario sono meravigliosi sia a livello personale che professionale, super organizzati (dalle lezioni di surf, allo yoga, ai servizi fotografici, alla surf house con terrazza vista city/mare) contribuiscono a creare quel clima unico che poche volte s'incontra..Gli aperitivi in terrazza, le risate, le onde..Un gruppo di persone sconosciute che in un paio di giorni diventa la tua crew dove l'unica cosa che regna sono le good vibes!Non vedo l'ora di partecipare ai prossimi eventi!

Ho deciso di partecipare all’ultimo surfcamp in Marocco e sono tornata rigenerata! Organizzazione perfetta: surfhouse accogliente, pulita e con ottima cucina locale, siamo stati viziati e coccolati, dalla colazione alla cena, per non parlare delle deliziose merende!! Lezioni di surf e di yoga con insegnanti professionisti e soprattutto professionali che trasmettono la passione per lo sport: le lezioni si svolgono in un clima molto rilassato e qualunque sia il livello del partecipante ci si diverte. A questo si sono aggiunte due belle gite al suk di Agadir e al pittoresco paese di Taghazout. Non vedo l’ora di partecipare ad altri eventi, di rivedere le ragazze conosciute in quei giorni e di riabbracciare gli organizzatori.  Sono stata accolta con un affetto e un calore che si riserva solo agli amici, non potevo affidarmi a persone migliori!!

Sto scrivendo questa recensione nel bel mezzo di una pandemia e mi scende una lacrima. Molto brevemente vi racconto la mia esperienza. Era luglio 2019 quando per caso, in un periodo particolarmente difficile della mia vita, ho incontrato i ragazzi di Snowave. Mi sono precipitata ad una surfskate night organizzata da loro e subito ho notato la disponibilità di Dario e Linda. In realtà non sapevo neanche cosa fosse un surfskate e soprattutto non avevo mai skateato con così tanti sconosciuti che poi sono diventati amici. Da quel momento in poi ho deciso di frequentare  i corsi di training for surfers e yoga for  surfers  nonostante non abbia mai surfato in vita mia e sapete cosa mi è piaciuto più di tutto? Incrociare lo sguardo sorridente delle persone alla fine di ogni stancante lezione di training o di ogni rilassante lezione di yoga, condividere un’ora e mezza dimenticandoci della quotidianità. Forse non sono stata poi così breve però vorrei raccontare un’ultima cosa. Un giorno di febbraio, ho deciso di salire sul Cervinia shuttle, le birrette, i tramonti, la condivisione,il rispetto per le persone. Questi sono i valori che mi hanno trasmesso i ragazzi. Mi manca un surf camp e sono sicura che supererà ogni mia aspettativa.Ci vediamo presto

Ho avuto la fortuna di partecipare a diversi Surf Camp organizzati da Snowave, dico fortuna perchè è difficile trovare un gruppo di persone in grado di accoglierti come fà la snowave family....che tu sia Pro o Beginner è lo spirito che conta!Bellissimi i surfcamp in Marocco, terra unica in cui non si può evitare di lasciare un pezzo di cuore al momento della  ripartenza...Un classico anche i Surf Camp in Spagna, a Somo nella splendida Cantabria... location dagli spot infiniti e per qualunque livello, basta affidarsi alla guida degli organizzatori che sanno ogni giorno qual'è lo spot migliore dove andare per divertirsi....Poi ovviamente le feste, ma di quelle non può dir niente ti tocca venire di persona...

If you want the best barbecue in the DMV, you must go to Chalkboard! Seriously, the food was absolutely delicious, the beer was cold and the cocktail just strong enough. First time trying this place and I ordered The Frickle Burger and seasoned fries for lunch. Overall the burger was decent, definitely lacked season for my taste buds (I’m from further south so I know season food very well) but it was nice & fresh. The fried pickles on the burger is a nice touch for sure. The fries were fresh & crispy. Customer service is great. Definitely a good spot for lunch time if you need to grab some quick to eat.

Buffalonian here, so I like to think I know wings. And this is one of maybe two places in the DMV area where I truly enjoy the chicken wings. They're decent sized wings, fried crispy with a flavorful but not too hot Buffalo style sauce. There's several other sauces and rubs available, but why deviate from perfection? Rotating taps and a wide whiskey selection provide plenty of options to drink.The bartender was friendly and given that she was also acting as the server for the entire restaurant, she was fast. The location is a bit cramped, but the space is generally attractive.Would definitely recommend and will certainly be back!
