Nice atmosphere, just too small. The pulled pork and Brussel sprouts was good but the chicken wings were unseasoned, flavorless, and just didn’t take good at all. They also could’ve been cooked for at least 5-7 more minutes. Olivia was a great server. She’s a nice young lady and made sure I was taken care of properly. I wish I would’ve tasted the wings before I left. I took them home to go.

Wings and flavor were average. Definitely not worth the price. We also didn't receive the dipping sauce nor the carrots/celery with our delivery.Tried again.  The wings were really dry and had little flavor. The chicken was actually really tough. We were really excited because of all the unique sauce choices but it seems like we really didn't get any sauce. The artichoke app with Chipotle ranch was good though.

This place was absolutely phenomenal.  I had the Hot Peach BBQ and Nashville Hot wings with the 4 Cheese Mac n Cheese, and a jalapeno mule.  I also snuck some of the seasoned fries from my friends kid (don't judge me).Everything about this meal was top notch.  I will certainly be going again the next time I am up this way.

The food is AMAZING! We ordered the chips and cheese for our app and we devoured it.I ordered the Pitmasters sandwich and it was so good! I especially loved the jalapeños on top.*chef's kiss*My husband got the brisket and pulled pork with the Mac and cheese and seasoned fries. As a guy who loves to run his smoker on the weekends, I was interested to hear his take. He instantly said it was delicious! Our baby had some of the Mac and cheese and she even approved.My husband was also a fan of the craft beer selection.The guys who helped us were really chill and kind.My husband and I are from the south and we both agreed the vibe of this place reminded us of home. It was very relaxed and casual. We are about to move out of the area and we both agreed that we wish we could've found this sooner.

I bought 3 types of wings. They all seemed to need more seasoning, but the lemon pepper were good. The mac n cheese was also good. I didn't care for the slaw. I would go back to try something different and have a drink! Food : 3/5 | Service : 4/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 Recommended dishes

My husband and I had dinner for my birthday.I ordered Italian Mule ( tastes like Moscow Mule but more refreshing like mojito ). Best Birthday Ever 😮Food was great, but the portion was not that generous I would say. However, having a cheesecake for a dessert made us full enough.Friendly staffs. Good enough food. The good was great. I have a gluten allergy and went here 2 days in a row. The first day the server was nice, the second day the server was a bit short attitude wise. I gave very specific details on the "create your own pasta" option. My food was good the first day. The second day the order came out incorrectly but then was fixed correctly. The second server seemed to have an attitude but became more polite as the meal continued. All in all the food was good and the service was good.I have 3 stars because of the bathroom. The rest of the restaurant was great. I will say that I did complain the first day that the bathrooms stink something awful. I didn't even go into the restroom the 2nd visit. I told them that it smelled like a porta potty that had been sitting in the hot sun, in New Orleans, during Mardi Gras, used by thousands of people. That's not an exaggeration. It was awful. They were aware of the situation and said that they were working on it but nothing had been done yet. I react to air fresheners but that would have been better than the stinky smell.Dietary restrictions: Gluten free

I have always had a good experience whenever I visit the Romano’s Macaroni Grill on Ramstein Air Base so today I have decided to give it a positive review. I typically cover areas such as atmosphere, customer service, and the food itself when reviewing restaurants, cafes, and the like.Atmosphere:It’s just like any Macaroni Grill back in the states. It looks the same, the employees dress the same, and it even sounds the same. I was very comfortable the entire time I was there and encountered no issues with my surroundings.Customer service:My waitress was very attentive during my meal and constantly checked in on me for drink refills or to ask if I needed anything. All the employees here maintain a positive attitude and take special care in making sure you have a good experience.Food:The food here is very good and isn’t too pricey for what you get. The bread they serve is delicious and bottomless (as are the soft drinks and iced tea). The appetizers are great but I feel as though the main entrees could have a larger variety. Still, you get what you pay for and it is worth it.Miscellaneous:In order to save time, it is recommended you call and make a reservation. They only accept same-day reservations sadly and if you walk in without one you may have to wait around an hour to be seated. Not an issue if you decide to shop at the BX beforehand.Overall, a very good place to grab an Italian meal while on base.

Everything came in fast and I was done in at most 30-45mins. I'll come back another time when I want a quick meal.😊 Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 4/5 … More

Crouching Tiger in Redwood City is a good choice for a big group gathering. They have a ton of spacious tables perfect for family-style dining, and our service was fantastic. The staff was friendly, attentive, and kept our water glasses full throughout the meal.Unfortunately, the food itself was a bit of a mixed bag. The Vegetarian Manchurian house special had a decent sauce, but the Manchurian itself was a bit soggy on the inside. It felt like it had been sitting in sauce for a bit too long. The egg fried rice with BBQ pork was another letdown. The rice was undercooked, and the BBQ pork itself was bland and lacked the smoky sweetness you would expect.The hot iron plate style chicken had so much potential, but the execution fell flat. They put the chicken on top of the crispy rice, which sounds good in theory, but it meant the rice got soggy almost immediately. By the time you got to the rice, it was all mushy.Overall, Crouching Tiger is a good option for a large group with friendly service, but the food needs some work. I'd recommend sticking with simpler dishes and maybe skipping the sizzling plate options.

Had a birthday celebration here. Their newly-renovated outdoor platform was nice. Ample space to do a magic show and buffet lunch for crowd of 60 inside and outside. Thumbs up for service, food and atmosphere. The owner, Tonia, was very friendly and accommodating. Only posting pics before the crowd due to privacy. The food was beyond excellent. I tried many dishes, and every single one was made with incredible quality. The dishes were not greasy, and yet they were packed with intense, wonderful flavors. The fried rice was fresh and lightly cooked with soy sauce and oil. It wasn't slick or too greasy. This is not your typical americanized chinese food restaurant--the chefs here know how each dish should be crafted.I have to recommend ordering the magic chili prawns. They are peeled, lightly battered shrimps in a medly of chilis that you can't find elsewhere. It was lemony, but not sour, and very balanced. The orange chicken, spicy eggplant, and szechaun lamb are honorable mentions.

Delicious spicy  and flavorful Chinese food The braised string beans and duck were fresh, not oily, and simply delicious Chicken and lamb dishes had fresh meat and not that stinky frozen meats served in most places Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

I was visiting a friend in San Francisco,  four of us had lunch just so before my flight back to Houston. Absolutely loved the food! The dry shrimp and boiled fish was deliciously warm and spicy,  just the right heat you need especially on a chilly day. Customer service is great as well and we didn’t have to wait long for our food.

Really friendly hosts. Neat atmosphere. Open parking available nearby at Perry Street Lot.Wide selection of vegetarian and non vegetarian options. We ordered General Zhao's chicken and Taiwanese rice noodles. Both quantity and taste were really nice. The price was also decent. The total price for both the items with tax excluding tip came up to 27$.Would definitely recommend for someone looking for Chinese food in the Bay area. Can't vouch for how authentic Chinese it is though.

I've seen this place on yelp multiple times, with a lot of high reviews. I was a little skeptical of the place from the appearance outside, but inside was actually really nicely decorated with a lot of space. It was almost empty at 7:30 pm on Tuesday, so we were seated right away.We ordered general zhao tofu, sweet and sour chicken, potstickers, and salt and pepper pork chops. The food came out quickly and all together. Everything was really hot and fresh. The potstickers were really good, perfectly cooked and the skin was well made. The general zhao tofu sauce was a bit over powering. I think it would have been better without the sauce//on the side. The salt and pepper pork chops were really good. The sweet and sour chicken was also well made. The food was fresh and tasted really good.We loved the ambiance inside and the fresh hot food. They had an extensive menu, so we definitely want to come back again and try their other foods. They also had cocktails for only $9 that we wanted to try next time.

The food was delicious, great place to order lots of dishes to share. Definitely get the tea leaf salad, authentic taste and super fresh. The samosa soup was delicious, not something you see on the menu everyday but would definitely get it again. The employees were super attentive. Even though the restaurant was busy, we got seated right away. There were about 4 or 5 parties that were celebrating their birthdays. A wonderful place to celebrate with large parties. If you want authentic Burmese cuisine, give Rangoon Ruby a try!

I love this place! This is my go-to when getting Burmese food in Palo Alto. I love all their Burmese dishes like mohinga, coconut noodle soup, and their noodle salads. I also got the Burmese tea this time and it was great!Service is good here. I don’t feel like we waited too long for our food or the check.The inside is nice. It feels very modern and formal, so it’s also a good place to go for a fancy dinner.Parking: Palo Alto downtown has various parking lots you can park at so we generally manage to find parking in the areaVegetarian options: Noodle salads can be vegetarian if you don’t add the chicken. This Hard Rock is very unassuming from the street view but is very cozy and lively inside.  The  employees were all helpful and friendly.  Our server was the greatest, patient and kind.  I had the Messi Chicken sandwich; come with an appetite, that’s all I got to say.  We also had the ribs, the meet was falling of the bone tender.  They have 50% off drink specials in the early evening, yum; even non alcoholic for the kids.

The experience was quite enjoyable, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a classic American dining experience with a touch of Parisian flair.I ordered the Legendary Burger, and my companion opted for the Big Cheese Burger. Both burgers were cooked to medium-well perfection, with juicy patties and fresh toppings. The fries were crispy and well-seasoned, making for a delightful side. The serving size was generous, and the presentation was on point. The aioli dipping sauce added an extra layer of flavor to the meal.While the prices are on the higher side, the quality of the food and the overall dining experience justify the cost. Our total bill came to €56.40, which included two burgers and two sodas. Given the portion sizes and the quality, it was a reasonable expenditure for a special dining occasion.Hard Rock Cafe Paris offers a solid dining experience with delicious food, great service, and a lively atmosphere. It’s a fantastic spot for both locals and tourists looking to enjoy a meal in a fun and iconic setting. I would definitely visit again and recommend it to others.

If you're looking for great burgers and fries in Paris, then definitely check out the Hard Rock Cafe!We arrived a few minutes before our booking and were greeted immediately with a table and menus. All of the staff were incredibly kind and courteous to us throughout our meal.To be honest, the music was a hit or miss for the hour and a half that we were there. It ranged from Led Zeppelin, Nirvana, Aerosmith, and AC/DC to Halsey and Youngblood.The food was so so so good! Far better than the Hard Rock Cafe in New York (which I have previously reviewed 😉). I would LOVE to visit here again.

As we are a fan of Hard Rock, we already knew the standards of service and foods. Amazing as always! 👏🏼A big thanks to a lovely server there, she was very attentive and friendly. Our salad was missing and I was a bit disappointed but she tried her best to manage it for us, we understood how busy and crowded it was.. result was impressive. 👍🏼One thing to note, we came from Switzerland to Paris (visited almost 10 times) and we speak German and English.. there was a bartender (I prefer not to mention the name) he was not so happy once we said we are from Switzerland.. his reaction was strange, the way he spoke to us was not friendly at all. He even asked if we speak German? With a tone of voice that I concluded that he didn’t like that we speak German. (I was speaking German to my daughter, though my husband speaks fluent French.. my husband pretended to don’t speak French to him just to see how he would serve us) my husband ignored this ridiculous reaction and we didn’t take it seriously or personally, but as a world class restaurant I expect more that the workers are used to meet people all around the world who speak different languages.

I had a fantastic experience at the Hard Rock Cafe in Paris. Located in the vibrant heart of the city, it’s a wonderful spot to enjoy a meal amidst the Parisian charm and excitement.The menu features the classic Hard Rock selections, all freshly prepared and full of flavor. We took the time to explore the shop and found some great souvenirs to remember our trip.I can’t wait to come back on my next visit to Paris!

Super yummy spot, especially if you like a lot of food. For a buffet style restaurant the quality is very good, I didn’t have anything that was too dry or anything like that. Where to begin??!! FRESH FRESH FRESH and delectable!! No matter your food selection anything you choose, guaranteed will be bursting full of flavor. Definitely not your typical buffet.Get there early to beat the rush or be prepared to wait...but the wait is worth it!!

I absolutely love coming to this place!First off, the staff is very friendly and attentive, and they provide a great atmosphere. Secondly, the food is priced very well, nothing on the menu seems overpriced at all, so very affordable.Thirdly, everything I have had here is delish!What I pictured is the falafel plate which comes with four and some fresh veggies.I also got the saffron chicken plate, which came with rice on the side. The rice had a nice hint of fragrance and paired fantastic with the chicken and the sauce. The chicken itself just about melted in my mouth, and the sauce was very flavorful.You can also go here in the morning to mid lunch times for their buffet which is an incredible way to try the majority of their dishes! If you haven’t been here at all , I highly recommend you try the buffet first, and enjoy your experience here cause that’s what you’ll have!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Alibaba Restaurant in Dallas, and I must say, it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. Her friendly demeanor, attention to detail, and genuine passion for hospitality were evident in every interaction. She anticipated our needs before we even had to ask and made us feel like valued guests throughout the entire meal.Overall, Alibaba Restaurant exceeded my expectations in every way possible. The combination of delicious food and unparalleled service, thanks to Amanda, made for a truly memorable dining experience. I can’t wait to return and indulge in more of their delectable dishes while enjoying the same level of exceptional service.A heartfelt thank you to Amanda and the entire team at Alibaba Restaurant for making my visit truly unforgettable.

We had a delightful experience at Amoura Restaurant for arranging team dinner. We were a team of 19. The reservation was easy, just called them to book and put a credit-card for a hold.The ambience and seating arrangement was good. Started with drinks, appetizers and ended with dessert.The appetizers were a good arriving with fresh pita, falafel and dips including hummus, baba ganoush, yogurt, tahini, and a zesty red sauce.For dinner my personal choice was the Chicken Kebab with fries instead of rice, the kenab was juicy and tenfer, not dry.Also ordered Mint Margarita that was refreshing.Others ordered Beef steak, lamb kebabs, burgers and the list goes on and everyone enjoyed their food with the choiceof drink.For dessert, I opted for the Baklava with ice cream. I really wanted to try a different restaurant for burmese food and found this place. Inside was pretty small, but the lights above were nice. We came around 7pm, and it wasn't too crowded. We were seated immediately.We ordered the platha with dip, mango salad, eggplant with chicken, sesame tofu, and burmese-style curry with pork. The mango salad didn't seem to have too much mango, but was really refreshing. It was a good starter. The platha was also really good. The dip had pieces of meat in it too. The eggplant with chicken was cooked really well. This was our favorite dish of the meal. The sesame tofu was cut up pretty small and the sauce was similar to a sweet and sour sauce. Wasn't a favorite, but good enough. The curry had a lot of meat and would have gone really well with rice.While we didn't love all the food, it was good. If you want burmese food in this area, this place is definitely affordable and has decent food. We would probably come back.

The most important reason that I want to go back here not only really tasty salad or the mango ice cream which give it a rich taste, but only the sparks of candle gave me a surprise for late birthday celebration! Thanks amazing memories and your waitresses.

Papa Ray's is what I call a small business. The place is small and there are no tables and chairs. Imagine a family size garage with a pizza oven and commercial refrigerator. Normally we order a pie and get it delivered in about 45 min. This time I picked up because we had a birthday party with 12 ten year olds and they were tearing the place up. The place is small functional and effective, the pizza was piping hot and on time. I got home and everyone was happy. If not there might have been a riot and they probably would have burned the house down. By the way, order 5 pizzas (be sure to get a stamp for each one) and redeem it for a medium sized 1 topping pie on your next order. I love their rewards program.

Came here to celebrate our anniversary, ended dinner on a elated note. Everyone was super friendly here, even the other neighboring parties surrounding our table. We even witnessed a proposal.   The staff here is stellar. Super courteous, extremely helpful explaining, a different level of service.The vibe is classy old school and the environment is warm. The price meets the quality standard without compromise.The food and drinks are exactly how we expected. The coffee gelato dessert was extremely delicious.You can park anywhere in the public structures around Rodeo Drive.

This place is unbelievably good. My Gram lives in BH and this was my grandparents go to place for taking family and friends out for dinner. They know them. My grandfather passed and his waiter was at his funeral. He has since retired but there are still amazing waiters that really take good care of you. So the service is amazing.The drinks are also yummy. I ordered a lemon drop (or 2 😉 🍋 🍹) which was sooo good and my husband ordered a "Flawless" . So good. But my husband liked his first one better and I noticed there were fruit garnishes on our second round so the bartenders must have changed.My husband and I split a ceaser salad which we devoured. They split the plate automatically for us without asking and added black pepper to our taste. Perfect service.I ordered the salmon special which honestly the salmon was brilliantly cooked and yummy but didn't pair that well with the citrus dressing and greens topping it. I ate half of it and the rest of my grandma's John Dory. The John Dory is the best fing thing on this menu. You MUST order this dish. Or at the very least someone at your table willing to share. Thanks Gram! The sauce it's paired with is incredible and comes with the halibut too because my aunt order the parm encrusted halibut and she got the sauce. Hers was incredible too! Let's see.. My husband ordered a ribeye with mashed potatoes. Yes yes yes! I got one delicious 😋 bite. And it was the best bite ever. My daughter got a kids size steak filet and after finishing it she ate some of the ribeye. She is a sucker for good steak. My son got mac and cheese and he's a Kraft fan so he wasn't impressed with the rotini shape and sauce.. But we were! We took it to go and ate it later. It was tasty. My great aunt ordered a prawn pasta she liked it. I could tell she'd ordered it before. I saw another person with it too so it's a popular dish.Lastly on the food.. You'll definitely definitely want to save room in your belly and wallet for dessert, because this is where our Texas sized appetites were satiated. The portions are huge! We ordered a key lime pie, cheesecake and hot fudge sundae. My son got the hot fudge sundae (yes even after his meager attempt at his mac and cheese), but you have never seen a happier little boy in your life. There was a huge amount of whip cream atop the chocolate ice cream and then you get a little gravy boat full of hot fudge; he was having the best time pouring it on top. His face lit up! Get your child this sundae or be a kid again and get it for yourself. My aunt and gram shared with him but he ate a lot of it. My daughter and great Aunt shared the keylime pie and OMG ITS THE BEST DANG key lime pie you've ever had. And we've been the the Florida keys and had plenty of their pie but this was better. Even my husband who doesn't care for it as much as my daughter and I, loved it. The portion looked was 2 slices in 1. It's creamy and not too sweet and the gram cracker crust is just perfect. My husband and I split the cheesecake bc he loves cheesecake. It was dense and perfectly made. But I need more than the little strawberry puree they put on the plate. My husband is a purest and loved it as is. Any critique I have is really my own taste preference and not the restaurant's quality. I know from eating there before that they will adjust anything you ask based on your tastes. Pan seared vs grilled, more sauce etc..I mean this restaurant is top notch. It's been my grandparent's favorite since my childhood. Things come and go in Beverly hills but this restaurant is a staple.You get what you pay for! This place is pricey but not in an exorbitant kind of way. You will be happy to pay the prices once you experience the quality of service and food and atmosphere. If you want a good dinner by Rodeo Drive, this is the place!People wear jeans and shirts here so no need to dress up but we always look nice when we go here.Takeaways: if you like seafood, try the John Dory. Dress nice but not up and order the key lime pie if you're a fan. Kid friendly!

Beautiful venue. It can be a bit noisy when even half full. The service is attentive yet we still need to ask a few times for things. Lovely atmosphere, very good flavors, and attentive service...at times TOO attentive.I was in town for a conference and decided to just have one solo, quiet meal to take a break.It's just the right noise level - bustling enough to feel safe and comfortable, but not so loud as to not be able to hear myself talk.The food was quite good. I loved my lamb dish. But the kale I got on the side was inedibly salty. I ate a few bites but couldn't keep going. Usually the wait staff would have asked if I didn't enjoy it or something if a dish was barely touched but here they did not, and just took it away.They did, however, spend almost 3 minutes recommending and describing half the menu. It was too much, especially because I didn't even ask for recommendations. I was also trying to relax with headphones in and watch a video while eating my meal, but the server kept coming by to ask me how everything was when I clearly had headphones in.The Sesame dessert was interesting and excellent!

Dishes were standard fare.Service: 3/5 - Service was standard fareAmbiance: 4/5 - Definitely loved the ambiance of the place.  Very modern interior.

Ms. San Francisco Real Estate Janice Lee dines at Mourad, a fine dining Moroccan restaurant in Downtown San Francisco. The ambiance is nice and the food has unique flavors and excellent portions. The octopus was very fresh with a good mix of textures and flavors. The duck basteeya had a crispy exterior and the filling was so hearty. The 72 hour aged short rib had good portions and melted in my mouth. I always love the milk bread and three types of butter (lemon, pomogranite and light spiced butter). The uni over the brioche was cute and feeds two. I also ordered a spicy ginger ale. This is a great place to eat on a date or with a large group. It's like creating your own several course meal. I would return again for a group dinner.
Had a group dinner.. enjoyed some of the food..Candied pecans, grilled chicken..The salad was okay and the cod was a little overcooked for me.Reminded me of my first team birthday lunch in 2017 ..

I work in the same building as this restaurant, so it was easy to score a reservation with my colleagues for a weeknight dinner. The place had been on my list since the time they had a Michelin star.Since we had vegetarian people at the table, we started with an Eggplant (zaalouk), an Eggshuka, their Milk Bread, and the Salmon.The zaalouk was this nice concoction of eggplant, tomatoes, spices, and tahini. It comes with some decadent flatbread that's like brioche, but butter. Cannot recommend enough.The Eggshuka is a refined take on the traditional shakshuka. It was made with extremely whipped egg whites as the crust, hen yolks in the middle, and the usual tomatoes/spices/peppers underneath. I was impressed with how in sync with flavors were of these perceptible layers.The salmon was plated well but I did not think of it as highly, and really recall what it made me think of :/The Milk Bread might be the best form of carbs i've had this year, seriously. It is pillowy, sweet, and pairs incredibly well with the accompanying butters (peppered honey, lemon, pomegranate).Next we got the Lamb, Heirloom Beans, and the Couscous. The lamb was cooked medium well, and had a satisfying bite. The beans were huge, and cooked to a smooth consistency. The couscous was topped with gooseberry and almonds- unusual but a great combo that went down easy.Our server gave us great recommendations, the staff was attentive. The food took a while to prepare, but that was my only gripe. The ambiance is great, and the interior is gorgeous.8/10 would go back again!

Such an amazing experience and such outstanding service…especially from Ghariba. The food is wonderful and was paced perfectly. These folks truly provided an amazing experience and will be gladly returning. Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 … More

My fiancé took me here to celebrate International Women's Day. We were seated on the second floor, which was wonderful because of the intimate lighting and fewer crowds than on the first floor. The potatoes were included with almost every dish, which was great because I love them. We ordered potatoes as a side dish as well,but it was too much, and we couldn't even finish it. The Farro dish wasn't that good for either of us. Overall, the experience was good, and we would definitely come back.

We’ve been patrons of Mourad since 2016, consistently delighted by our experiences. Yet, our visit last night transcended all previous ones. The culinary execution was simply sublime. Every dish, from the sumptuous milk bread to our staple order of short ribs, was impeccable. The flavors and textures have always been impressive, but this time, they were exceptional. The addition of dashi to the salmon and barramundi enhanced these dishes and elevated the dining experience even more so. The couscous is simply out of this world.

Will definitely go back!

The lunchtime atmosphere was unexpectedly calm. Seated at the bar, I couldn't help but notice the usually lively restaurant was a bit subdued. The bartender was multitasking, attending to both the floor and the bar, making it hard to read her mood. The service, while not unwelcoming, lacked the usual warmth and friendliness I've grown accustomed to here. The scent of sizzling fajitas and spicy salsa wafted through the air, causing my stomach to growl in anticipation. I observed the bartender skillfully mixing drinks, her hands moving swiftly and accurately. I pondered what had shifted in this once vibrant eatery. Was it recent staff changes or the economic downturn affecting business? Whatever the cause, the atmosphere was undeniably altered today. Despite the subdued vibe, I still found peace in the familiar setting. The cozy booths, vibrant decorations, and delectable food all served as a reminder of why I kept returning to this place. Even on a quiet day like today, I knew I could rely on this restaurant for a moment of tranquility and relaxation. For a brief moment, I was able to escape and listen to an audiobook. As I completed my meal and settled the bill, I mentally noted to return soon. Despite the alterations, this place remained dear to my heart, and I felt assured of a warm welcome whenever I visited. Leaving the restaurant, I felt content and appreciative of the brief escape from the daily hustle and bustle. Despite recent menu cutbacks, I still felt drawn to this establishment whenever I needed to unwind and clear my mind. Even though today felt different, I would still recommend this spot for a casual meal, hanging out with friends, and indulging in some chips, salsa, and a refreshing margarita.🌮🍹After getting a reply to my review, I made the choice to elevate my rating from 4 to 5 stars. I'm grateful for the restaurant's commitment to handling feedback and aiming for perfection. I'm totally loyal to this place because they respond quickly and care. On The Border response, makes me feel grateful that I had decided to tip the bartender generously to bring some joy to her day. Sometimes, a little kindness during imperfect moments can bring happiness and brighten our day.I believe that it's important to acknowledge and appreciate when a business takes the time to address feedback and make improvements. It shows that they truly care about their customers' experiences and are dedicated to providing the best service possible. This level of dedication and commitment is what sets On The Border apart from other establishments and makes me want to continue supporting them.By choosing to tip the bartender generously, I wanted to show my gratitude for her hard work and dedication to her job. I know that working in the service industry can be tough, and a little extra kindness and appreciation can go a long way in making someone's day brighter.This experience has reinforced my belief in the power of positivity and kindness, especially during challenging times. It's a reminder that simple acts of appreciation can create a more positive and uplifting environment for everyone involved. I am thankful for the opportunity to support a business that values feedback and strives for excellence, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit for a mango    margarita, empanadas 🥟Vegetarian options: Options are availableKid-friendliness: When you enter the restaurant, you'll notice that one side offers a cozy family-friendly atmosphere, perfect for dining with children. On the other side, you'll find a more lively ambiance, ideal for those looking to relax and enjoy easy access to the bar.Wheelchair accessibility: It’s wheelchair accessible friendly!

The restaurant serves authentic, home style Indian food. Spices are wonderful. The aroma makes me feel like I'm back in India and the owner makes me feel like I'm in his house. Prices are reasonable. The atmosphere is nothing fancy. Personally, I love eating on the metal plates.

My cousin recommended this place. We had just arrived from Texas with my in-laws. They have a very specific taste. Spicy vegetarian South Indian food. We had the buffet here and it was amazing.  Nice spread and everything was hot and fresh. The place is busy but the owner made sure to get is seated soon. I'd recommend this to folks wanting to take their elders.

The owner was very personable and came to my table to make sure that I was comfortable and explained how the dishes were eaten or paired together. They switched to buffet style as of January and the menu changes daily. The food is cooked in small batches which maintains it's flavor and home style tastes. They are mainly Telugu but  try to rotate the menu to hit every state.

The restaurant gives proper south indian food with authentic flavors. Loved this place. The food is spicy and has coconut flavor, if u are not too keen on spicy may be you need to ask them to tone down a little. 1 less star just because the ambience is not the best but still good enuf to have a quiet meal.

This was our first night at Pacific Grove, we had been driving all day and didn't want to drive around looking for a restaurant and a parking space. Lalla Grilled  Oceanside appealed to us, and we were fortunate to get a booth. They have an extensive menu. I decided on Chicken Cutlet. Great memories made here so no complaints but definitely could improve.

Hakka Restaurant is a great spot for those looking to enjoy authentic Chinese cuisine, especially when dining with a group. The portions here are generous, making it an ideal choice for sharing among friends or family. The menu offers a wide variety of dishes, from classic dim sum to hearty mains, all prepared with fresh ingredients and traditional flavors.For solo travelers, the large portions can be a bit overwhelming, and it might be challenging to fully enjoy the variety of dishes on offer. The restaurant's ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for gatherings and celebrations, but it might feel a bit too much for a lone diner seeking a quick meal.Despite this, the quality of the food and the reasonable pricing make Hakka Restaurant a solid choice for anyone looking to experience hearty Chinese meals in a convivial setting. The service is efficient, and the staff are accommodating, making the dining experience smooth and enjoyable. Overall, it's a fantastic spot for group dining, earning it a well-deserved four stars. ⭐⭐⭐⭐

I got the Bang Bangin Chicken Bowl and let me tell you: with each bite gave me a sense of satisfaction that I’ve never experienced before in my life. Server Chen really elevated my experience here like no other, effortlessly and gracefully procuring my order as I take the time to ponder. I really hope the higher ups at Pokeworks can give this guy a raise man! I will go there next time just to see him!

Pokeworks is your Chipotle/subway set up but with Pokebowls. In the area, it’s the only place that seems to do pokebowls. For myself, I ordered the Ahi tuna bowl and my wife did a custom chicken bowl. We both enjoyed the flavors, and the service was pleasant. The price was higher than what I’m used to for a poke bowl and the portion size was a bit smaller. That being said, the flavor profile was very nice for both, the taste was very good. Not too much else to say. Solid.

Pokéworks is my go to for a fast and healthy lunch. I usually get their poké bowl but this time I tried their sushi burrito and it was the perfect amount of food. The sashimi and ingredients were fresh and tasty. Their pineapple dole whip was refreshing and delicious. Perfect for a hot summer day! Food : 5/5 | Service : 5/5 | Atmosphere : 5/5 Recommended dishes

This place offers a delightful culinary journey with its Nepalese and Indian offerings. Very cozy and traditional flavors with a punch of spice that tingles the taste buds. I tried some light snacks including vegetable pakora and paneer tandoori, and each was deliciously seasoned, showcasing the rich, bold spices typical of Himalayan cuisine. Highly recommended for a flavorful dining experience if you’re in San Diego. Pretty close to the zoo.

This was about my 5th time coming here and I feel I have enough experience to right a review.I must say the food is absolutely amazing it's a simple menu with nothing out of its place. Super saucy, great flavor and just overall awesome! I enjoy the dishes they use to serve, too, nice touch. I have had all of the lamb curries, momos, naan, the pastry apetizers and of course the Chicken Tikka Masala. All pretty good, especially the naan (can't go wrong with delicious bread) but the spice levels vary on the curry for sure. Tikka? Totally rock a 6. The Takari? 4 is plenty thank you. Definetly worth a visit for the food.The service is where it lacks. Out of the 5 times, 2 were rough experiences, 1 was great and 2 were mediocre. Some servers don't write the order down and have messed up the order a couple times and were just not the best people to interact with. Not to mention one of the experiences I had the server did not seem "fully aware" and even said he wouldn't place the order a friend requested for whatever reason and argued with him about it until he complied. That was a one-off experience, however, and to me the food is worth coming back. Also, I've had good interactions, too, more than not. I recommend trying it out, love it and will come back often myself.- $60 for two- parking is average- food is amazing- service is better more often than not

First and foremost the price is decent, the portions could do better. I do agree that the curries were a tad bit sweet, but missing a few ingredients to give it that kick, the pakora was tasty. Wish there was more. The chicken butter Masala was very buttery and the chicken vindaloo was too sweet, wish they had more meat then sauce. The herbal Naan was so heavenly it fused and melted in your mouth with the savory and herbal mixture melting on your pallete. The service was great. Our server was nice and ensured we were well taken care of. If you are in yhe area I would recommend coming to five them a Try the aesthetic is very appealing

The food was great with great options. The bhindi masala was amazing. Lots of restaurants can mess up on this dish.They allowed dogs in the restaurant- server was super nice about it. Love when the restaurant folks are so accommodating for the customers.Vegetarian options: Great Momos and bhindi masala
